Job Title: Intelligence Analyst - Systems Operator (No Experience Required)
Description: Your role:As an Intelligence Analyst – System Operator (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Systems Operators) your role supports classified Government intelligence programs by analysing signal transmissions; and informing tactical and military advantage both at sea and ashore. This diverse and mentally stimulating role encompasses a range of specialist skills that support intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance activities. You’ll use sophisticated, state-of-the-art search receivers and other complex equipment to intercept, record, analyse and disseminate the intelligence of signal transmissions. Teamwork is an important part of the role. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel; all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.As an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator, you will receive training in the  following areas:- Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving,- Communications theory and networks,- Methods for working with intelligence information,- Preparation and presentation of intelligence briefs, and,- Provide advice to Commanders and other audiences as required. Prior experience isn’t needed. You’ll gain all the necessary skills and qualifications to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator as part of your training. Although, it is worth noting that successful Operators typically have a sound background in mathematics and are comfortable with the fundamentals of physics.Life in the Navy: A career in the Navy is challenging and highly rewarding, and comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment. Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters. Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be stationed locally not too far from home. Salary: Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package from $75,625 including service and uniform allowances. You will also receive a Maritime Allowance when serving on ships. In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.Apply Now: For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English, Maths and Science (physics is preferable).Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/intelligence-analyst-systems-operatorThe Australian Defence Force is an equal opportunity employer. This advertisement is to ensure women are aware of the rewarding and fulfilling careers available in the Navy, Army and Air Force. Females are encouraged to apply, however all roles are open for Australian men and women to apply.

Job Title: Senior Service Delivery Analyst Business Intelligence
Description: * Contract Until End of June 2022 with view of extension* Hybrid working condition* $800-$900 per day   SuperMy client has a new opportunity for a Senior Service Delivery Analyst to join their team based in Macquarie Park.You will manage and administrate mission critical enterprise BI tools and environments. This includes analysis and reporting standards, and to support the development, testing and maintenance of BI Reports, visualisations, user interfaces, data models, queries and related artefacts. The application portfolio includes, but is not limited to Power BI, Tableau and Alteryx. Your role will include Administration and management of the platforms at the enterprise level which includes but not limited to: configuration, performance monitoring and maintenance of the platform.Providing second level and third level technical support for operational issues.Establishing best practice, integrity and governance across the platforms by implementing standards and securityProvide a key role in supporting and partnering the business in all data driven initiativesSupport the continual investment in business focused analytics, with emphasis on statistical, predictive, prescriptive and next generation AnalyticsTranslating complex technical issues into business terms and collaborates with business partners to refine and facilitate prioritization of requirements to address the immediate business needs based on complexity of the technical solution environment.Work closely with project and support teams in multiple locations and expected to work independently to plan and accomplish goals and collaborate with Business stakeholders to define and design solutions for business intelligence and analytical applications. To be successful in the role you must have:Previous experience with Power BI and Tableau. Alteryx is desirable Solid experience in a support/development role within a business intelligence/analytics at an enterprise level using Power BI, Tableau and/or Alteryx.Proven business analysis skills with a customer focussed approach in delivering results.Excellent communication skills both verbal and writtenSound experience in developing operational support processes and procedures across analytic platforms Interested? Please apply online now with an updated resume or give a call to Leila Boubahlouli on 8257 0521 for a confidential discussion.

PM-Partners group are a specialist Project Management Consultancy.  We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk.  Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.PM-Partners is currently seeking a Senior Functional Analyst with strong Business Intelligence, Data and Reporting skills for this large scale community health focused project.In this role you will be responsible for several business, functional and data analysis activities including: Data and Security classification Functional Design specification Completing the Requirement Traceability Matrix Developing the System Administration Guide Delivering the Support PlanLocation:           Working RemotelyDuration:           Initially 4.5 months with likely extensionsDaily rate:          $850 - $950 including superTo be considered for this position you will have experience and strengths in the following: 5+ years proven experience in delivery as a Business / Functional Analyst Experience in Agile delivery as a Business/ Functional Analyst (certifications preferred) Advanced experience in data analysis and advanced excel and SQL capabilities. Experience and skills in designing business process maps. 5+ years of proven system solution analytical experience. Experience in Microsoft Dynamics environment Minimum 3 years working with data/datamart/data warehouse related solution requirements and high-level design. Experience in System integration specifications. Experienced with assisting with User Acceptance Testing. Experience with negotiating with users, technical staff and product owners to achieve desired outcomes. Strong demonstrated ability to lead workshops and work directly with solution stakeholders Strong experience with data analysis environments and incorporation of varying data sources and Business Intelligence tools Experience working in both the public and private sectors Strong skills and experience with documenting business requirements and functional design through user stories, wireframes, screen mockups, etc. Work directly with and between stakeholders and solution development teams for requirements elicitation and refinement. Experienced and confident facilitating workshops  Proven ability to lead the development of functional requirements, specifications, use cases, and business rules etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Industry standard BA and Project methodology certifications are highly desiredWhat we can offer you: Culture: A fun, fast paced, collaborative delivery environment People: A group of talented, experienced, and dedicated Consultants to work by your side with a dedicated Relationship Manager Passion: Ability to band together when under pressure to deliver first class results to clients Transparency: Open door policy Professional Development: On the job development and access to certifications in our Training practice Care and Support: On-going support and advice from experienced PM-Partners Consultants Knowledge: Access to PM-Partners Delivery and Advisory practicesIf you feel you meet our selection criteria and are looking to join a leading Project Management Consultancy, please submit your resume to Steve Brewer at PM-Partners via Seek application (preferable) or email – stevebr@pm-partners.com.au

Welcome to Monde Nissin AustraliaA big welcome to Monde Nissin Australia [MNA] – the home of iconic Australian brands including Black Swan, nudie, Wattle Valley, Peckish & Quorn. As an exciting business in the FMCG space, we are achieving big things and have our sights set on significant growth!The Opportunity  At Monde Nissin, our Business Intelligence team is set to achieve big things in 2022 and beyond. We are on the hunt for a dynamic Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team on a permanent basis. Reporting to the Head of IT, this role will be pivotal for delivering & supporting the strategic plans for the entire organisation.As a key team member, you will be responsible for the delivering key insights to aid the leadership team in their decision making.  We are looking for someone who can think big and use their data skills to turn data into actionable insights by answering not only what happened but why. If you are a passionate, creative self-starter with a strategic mindset and a natural skill for performing quality data analysis then we want to hear from you!Some of your key responsibilities will include:Subject matter expert for data analytics projects, ensuring project deliverables are met.Work with key stakeholders to gather, analyse and translate data into actionable business insights to drive quality decision making in a timely manner.Develop regular and ad-hoc business reporting according to business needs and metrics to form a strategic reporting & analytics suite.Build partnerships with stakeholders to become a trusted advisor to facilitate and drive fact-based action.Conduct root cause analysis for data quality anomalies to identify data improvement opportunities via improved data models and processes.Monitor and Maintain automated reports and dashboards along with identifying areas for improvement within data governance and data analysis.Other ad-hoc duties as required To thrive in this role, you will ideally possess:You have a curios, analytical mind and strong problem-solving skill using data.Self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively with extended stakeholders.Competency in data analytics and problem solving including exploratory data analysis.Advanced analytics skills – ability to generate actionable insights from large complex data sets using tools such as (but not limited to) SQL, & Power BI.Detail-oriented work habits, strong time management skills and delivery focused by being highly capable of prioritising tasks.Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a changing environment, strong communication & presentation skills and ability to work with different personalities across the organisation.Proven ability to work effectively with teams and senior managers, including ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders and advisors whilst promoting and supporting change.Microsoft stack including SQL, Azure Data Factory, Power BI, Excel and Office SuiteExperience with Cloud based services (Azure is preferable).Be prepared to travel domestically as required, as well as between locations. You will also possess:Tertiary education in related field such as Computer Science or Mathematics.Extensive Data Analysis experience with demonstrated delivery of high impact data visualisation and storytelling.Impeccable data visualisation design skills. (Power BI is preferable).Highly proficient in Power BI & ExcelPrevious experience working cross-functionally to align processes and expectations (highly regarded).Experience in FMCG/CPG industries is helpful but not mandatory.Experience with various data applications.If you consider this opportunity is for you, please 'Apply' now and attach a current resume and cover letter explaining your interest in the position and your suitability based on the listed selection criteria. Please answer the below questions in your cover letter:How many years of experience you have with Power BI?Which other systems have you used:TableauQlikMicro strategyProntoOther

Company DescriptionGlobal Express moves the businesses that move Australasia, offering our customers unrivalled access to an extensive transport network across Australia and New Zealand. Our services are designed around our customers with road, air, sea and rail freight options to securely deliver everything from documents through to critical spare parts and medical supplies.  Job DescriptionDue to growth we currently have exciting opportunities for a full time Business Intelligence Analyst to join our business. Based in Melbourne you will be responsible for defining and developing new data processes and supporting our BI & data platforms. You will work closely with project teams and technical support teams to develop and maintain data visibility and drive continuous improvement in performance measurement and reporting.As the BI Analyst, you will:Responsibilities:Design and develop data processes to be used in business reporting and analytical processesContribute to the implementation of the Common Data Platform, including documenting requirements for data ingestion pipelines and end-to-end orchestration processesContinuously review data quality and support initiatives to improve consistent and standardisation of business dataSupporting our BI & data platforms including system administration, maintenance and monitoring of servers and process to ensure ongoing service continuityActively engage with IT business partners and relevant IT teams to protect the health of the data warehouse, set up and other necessary technical mattersQualificationsTo be successful in this role, you will need:Demonstrated experience in business intelligence or data engineering (minimum of 5 years’ experience in similar role)Experience using SAS for data integration and supporting analytical data processesWorking knowledge of SQL, data extraction techniques, data profiling and MS SQL ServerStrong verbal and written communicationBachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information systems, analytics, or a related disciplineExperience with AWS data services and/or Snowflake will be highly regardedYou are a strong communicator dealing with stakeholders easily, having high level influencing skills and collaborative approach. In addition, your strong Statistical analysis methodologies, including forecasting, machine learning and predictive analytics techniques will be essential to the success of this position.  Additional InformationBe ConnectedRecently acquired by Allegro Funds, a successful Australian private equity company, Global Express has an exciting future ahead and will benefit from a transformation program, underpinned by $500 million in funding to support and grow the business. It’s never been a more exciting time to join our team as we take the next step in our journey.Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careersTo be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.

How you can impact our business: Joining us as Reporting and Visualisation/Power BI Analyst, you will become a key player in achieving Resolution Life's strategy to become a data-driven business whilst enhancing our customer experience.  The Analyst will support Resolution Life's core business through analysis of our current and future activities: identifying emerging trends and highlighting areas for investigation and opportunity. You will engage the business to deliver Power BI reporting and employ best practice design, integration, and data quality.  You will also: Become a data SME in your allocated crew area. Our analysts work like 'internal consultants' and cover many areas of our business!Deliver ad-hoc analysis and/or industrialised Power BI dashboards to support your crew area driving an in-depth understanding of Resolution Life's portfolio, identifying emerging issues and pinpointing areas of opportunity and improvementEnhance our documentation of business rules and processesImprove data efficiency through Power BI integration, automation, adoption, training, and self serviceChampion data through your Power BI dashboards in our cross-functional business environmentsYou will enhance us and our capabilities by: You'll have a curious and enquiring mindset which will allow you to deliver meaningful reporting, insights, and visualisations. You'll think like a data analyst but communicate like a successful business leader; our role is to traverse business and IT, so this is vital. Resolution Life work within an AZURE environment, so Power BI expertise is critical.  Your key skills, attributes, and experience Data visualisation skills in Power BIData modelling in Power BIManagement and Regulatory reporting experience likely gained in Financial ServicesAbility to source data through existing data systems and databases (SQL)Strong diagnostic skills - adept at providing advice and solutions to issues which will have a business impactProven problem-solving capabilitiesAdvanced communication skills both verbal and writtenOutstanding stakeholder management experience with the ability to win the trust and respect of their colleagues and stakeholders (inclusive leadership teams)Experience in an Agile environmentCommercial acumen and decision-making abilityPower BI experience(We're strictly a Power BI shop, so other tools won't cut it)

Career development and growth opportunity
Not for profit with salary packaging benefits (amongst others!)
Flexible location – Melbourne, Hybrid role
 
Are you a passionate Business Intelligence Analyst that is also passionate about making a difference in your local community?
 
Calling all Business Intelligence professionals!!
An exciting opportunity has become available for an enthusiastic and talented Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team that provides the data and insights that drive the success of our business. The BI team manage the design, development, implementation, delivery and maintenance of the business insights function to support organisational performance and growth at Campbell Page.
 
The company
Campbell Page is a not-for-profit organisation delivering multi-faceted employment services for disability, youth, indigenous, labour hire and general sectors. Campbell Page also provides community services and social enterprises from more than 80 locations across four states. We’re on a mission to prevent and reduce unemployment while creating jobs in the communities we’re a part of. Campbell Page has a passion to improve the lives of people seeking employment.The role
Reporting to the Manager – Business Insights, the Senior Business Insights Analyst is responsible for delivering both daily operational requirements and strategic organisation wide initiatives. Being a small team, you will have the opportunity to really make a difference and see the positive impacts your work will have on the performance of the business and services to our customers. This is a high profile role that will allow you to develop your influence and visibility across the organisation. We believe that BI is closely aligned to the business and as such, you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself and learn about this exciting and rewarding industry.
 
This role will see you:
Collaborating with your BI and business colleagues to continually enhance the quality of data analysis and reporting
Provide proactive analysis of trends and insights into the operations and business of the company
Ensure all daily, weekly and monthly Business Insights tasks are completed on time
Working with business colleagues to design and develop new reports
Gather, extract and manipulate data from multiple databases and transform this data into ongoing reporting solutions & insights
Developing capabilities to exploit API’s from internal and external systems to extract data
Continually improve BI processes & procedures aligned with the needs of the organisation
Continuing to enhance our data management and governance processes
Continually building your own technical and personal skills with access to leading tools and training
As a team member whose inputs, suggestions and experience are encouraged, valued and appreciated
To be awesome in this role, you will have: 
Skills in R, Python, C#, Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS
 
And experience in:
Data Visualisation tools, such as PowerBI
Master Data Management and tools like Azure Purview
Migration from on-premise data warehouse to Microsoft Azure
API development
Business intelligence, data warehousing or advanced analytics projects
A similar Analyst position for at least 3-5 years with a focus on data management, data governance and data strategy
All phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, defect management
Conducting process mapping and requirements gathering workshops with non-technical stakeholders
 
If you have knowledge of SQL queries, databases and data modelling as well as developing Microsoft PowerApps and Employment Services industry experience, then we would love to hear from you!
 
As a senior team member, you will be a self-motivated individual who thrives on digging into data, problem solving, clearly communicating a meaningful action plan, and creating solutions using a combination of experience, insights, technology and new thinking. 
 
In all our people, we need someone who will naturally live our values.
 •    We’re in it together
•    Never give up
•    Do what’s right
•    Deliver on our promise
 
So, what’s in it for you?
 
Give Some - every role contributes to local communities and local people in some way. A proportion of our profits are dedicated to local projects.
 
Get Some - the perks of being a not-for-profit include salary packaging means you pay less tax and more money each fortnight in your pocket! We offer flexible work options - just ask us what’s possible. And then, there are meals and entertainment perks on top!
 
Grow Some - We are committed to your development and career development. Tell us about your professional development aspirations and we’ll put in place a career plan. We invest in technical and leadership development and encourage internal promotions.  We have awards for being awesome and hope that one day that could be you!
 
Apply now!

Insurance for Individuals
Youi prides itself on being different. We've challenged the Australian insurance industry since our inception in 2008 and have worked hard to build a strong brand that’s agile and innovative. Our unwavering commitment to our people and our dynamic work culture is the key to our success. So for a career that lets you be you, and rewards you well for your hard work, Think Youi.
About the Role
Working as part of our Business Intelligence (BI) team, sitting within the ‘Product’ department, you can expect to be dealing with people from right across the organisation from the CEO to Call Centre Advisors. The BI team are responsible for bridging the gap between IT (systems) and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to management and stakeholders.
You will...

Conceptualise and manipulate data
Design, enhance and supply necessary BI reports to all business areas
Deliver accurate and timely reports available to relevant users
Provide adequate documentation of reports and processes for maintaining reports
Respond to staff queries within the agreed time frame
Assist with ad hoc project and initiatives

The successful candidate will be based at our Sunshine Coast Head Office in Sippy Downs, working a weekly rotation of in office and work from home. Full time work from home employees may be considered - please apply and we can discuss your requests for flexibility at the phone interview stage.
About You

Tertiary education in numerical or IT disciplines preferred but not essential
Previous experience with SQL
Previous experience using a data visualisation tool such as Tableau preferred
Experience working with large data sets
Professional verbal and written communication skills
Solutions-focused, driven to achieve great results
Customer-focused, always wanting to provide awesome service to those you assist

Culture & Benefits 
We are well known for our awesome culture and working environment and award-winning employee experience programs. Combine that with smart casual dress code, Sunshine Coast location, career progression opportunities and onsite cafes, it’s no wonder why our people love coming to work every day! 
How to Apply 
If you’re ready to fast-track your career by adding real value, please "APPLY NOW". We can’t wait to meet you!

About the company  ASX listed business in the nutritional products space experiencing rapid growth and company transformation. This company really lives their values of passion, purpose, and pace in all that they do creating a high performing and engaged culture that is family focused and flexible whilst driving significant growth in share and market development. They are now seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team.About the role  This role will be focused on developing, deploying, and monitoring cloud-based data pipelines and ETL solutions for the organisation. This is a critical role for the business to share valuable business information with key decision makers in the company.   Skills & experienceExperience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL skill, ideally MySQLHands on experience with developing end-to-end data pipelinesExperience working with cloud data platforms development toolsMicrosoft eco-system and software stack SQL Server, Highly proficient in SharePoint, Power Platform and Power AutomateExpert level in ExcelExperience in data visualization and reporting using DOMO, MicroStrategy, Tableau, MDX or DAXUnderstanding of Data governance, data security and PrivacyProficient on writing queries and converting business requirements into visualization.Documenting the project requirements, process maps and design documentsHow to applyShould this opportunity be of interest to you click on the APPLY button above or contact Nicole Cooke on 0449 853 240 for a confidential discussion.

As a senior team member, you will be a self-motivated individual who thrives on digging into data, problem solving, clearly communicating a meaningful action plan, and creating solutions using a combination of experience, insights, technology and new thinking. 
 
In all our people, we need someone who will naturally live our values.
 •    We’re in it together
•    Never give up
•    Do what’s right
•    Deliver on our promise
 
So, what’s in it for you?
 
Give Some - every role contributes to local communities and local people in some way. A proportion of our profits are dedicated to local projects.
 
Get Some - the perks of being a not-for-profit include salary packaging means you pay less tax and more money each fortnight in your pocket! We offer flexible work options - just ask us what’s possible. And then, there are meals and entertainment perks on top!
 
Grow Some - We are committed to your development and career development. Tell us about your professional development aspirations and we’ll put in place a career plan. We invest in technical and leadership development and encourage internal promotions.  We have awards for being awesome and hope that one day that could be you!
 
Apply now!

We are offering an exciting opportunity to be part of an organisation that is reinventing itself to remain successful in a rapidly changing market after more than 50 profitable years in business. Genworth is Australia’s leading providers of lender mortgage insurance, providing a range of capital and risk management solutions to some of Australia’s biggest (and smallest) lending institutions. Our mission is to help more Australians realise the dream of home ownership and we play a unique role in the housing market for that purpose.At Genworth there is genuine opportunity to be involved in projects that are agile and vibrant.Current opportunity: Business Intelligence AnalystAs a Business Intelligence Analyst you will parnter with stakeholders to drive Genworth's strategy through the design and delivery of meanigful reporting, analytics and operational insights using visual analytics. What you can expect from the opportunitySupport the creation of business reports and presentations to key Stakeholders.Own the provision of regular Enterprise reports, including clear analysis of emerging trends with a focus on cause / effect relationships and recommendations.Own the delivery of detailed analysis to identify root causes to problems and model potential solutions using statistically valid methods.Support Enterprise leaders and operational managers by providing analytical support and advice to investigate potential opportunities and in developing visual analytics and control dashboard systems. Own and drive the automation of reporting and metrics.What you'll need to succeedFive years in an analytical roleFive years experience working in financial services A Bachelors Degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science or ITTechnical nad programming skills in SAS coding, data mining, excel and SQLStrong understanding of Tableau, Power BI, Python or KnimeGood understanding of data repository systems / business intelligence infrastructuresWhat you getGenworth cares about what’s important to its people and understand that the little things can make a big impact. Whether it’s spending more time with family or looking after your wellbeing, Genworth provides access to several benefits that help support its people both professionally and personally.Genworth is committed to the long term growth of its people, therefore fostering career development and investing in you.If you are interested and have the passion, enthusiasm and skills to join Genworth, we would love to hear from you.

Business Intelligence Analyst The Reporting and Insights Analyst is responsible for providing vital support to the business by using data analysis and reporting to drive insights and decisions that improve Service operations. This role will work cross-functionally with key stakeholders across business leaders to identify business optimisation initiatives, deliver reporting solutions and support the business in implementing key analytical initiatives. The Analyst is responsible for supporting business managers with Optus Business in the identification and execution of opportunities for continuous service improvement, journey optimisation, and relentless focus on customer service optimisation across our Voice and Digital Channels. You’ll be a self-motivated individual who thrives on digging into data, problem solving, clearly communicating a meaningful action plan, creating solutions improving service journey’s using a combination of experience, insights, technology and new thinking.  To be successful you’ll have sound analytical ability to problem solve, some knowledge of experience design, understanding the importance of creating seamless Omni-channel experiences across service journeys. Using modern business intelligence tools, you will undertake critical analysis of data and information to achieve improvements in performance measures such as cost reduction, time reduction or quality improvement across the entire Business Care. Your core focus:  Leveraging enterprise wide information assets and system capabilities to design, map, develop and automate reporting. Team player who can work independently to source data from various feeds, while working with various groups from around the organisation to build a simple view of operational insights. Partner with key stakeholders across the business to identify business problems for analysis and reporting to keep them engaged and to resolve the problem together Develop and implement analysis and reporting to resolve business problems (e.g. customer behaviour prediction, market analytics, interaction forecast, resource and operation optimisation, etc.) Develop business intelligence and analysis to report and measure business performance Coordinate analytics projects in an agile way to ensure business value deliverables are maximised Actively identify process improvements and recommend necessary actions to promote continuous improvement culture Support leadership team with timely and accurate data to analyse and represent the current operational performance. Automate reporting (Tableau and like systems). Where Tableau reporting would not be available other automated options will be scoped to limit manual reporting requirements.  The Analyst will be able to understand the reporting requirements from Stakeholders and design and build a simplified reporting view. Time management and prioritisation will also be a key skill, along with managing stakeholder expectations.  You’ll be accountable for executing small projects and supporting larger projects from identifying and fixing broken journey’s to optimising existing experiences through to building new seamless, frictionless service journey’s and experiences for Optus customers with an omni-channel approach. About you:  5 years full time commercial experience of which a minimum of 3 years is in a full-time  (Direct or indirect) management position in a customer services / contact centre environment  Strong stakeholder management Demonstrated experience in managing an operation of significant size and reporting on performance. Proven remote management experience Proficient in systems such as IBM Cognos, EDW, Tableau, Excel, SQL, Alteryx Identify key parameters, assumptions and considerations that impact a development and its business case Identify optimal solutions that balance Customer and market needs with what is realistic, at reasonable cost, in reasonable time and with available resources Advanced Excel data lookup/matching and/or database manipulation skills Anticipate difficulties and identify contingency plans  The perks [link removed] We offer all kinds of benefits, such as: [link removed] ·        Work collaboratively in an open, agile environment with flexible working hours and location·        Discounts with over 400 companies Australia wide (Technology, Retail, Home, Fashion and more!)·        Mobile and Broadband staff discounts·       ·        Training, Mentoring and further learning opportunities·        About us At Optus, we don’t sit back and let the future happen to us – we’re out there making it.  By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we’re working to create a better tomorrow for all Australians.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Fully Remote) - International start-up
Description: We're looking for an up and coming Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, who will be responsible for managing data retrieval and analysis. You’ll work across teams (Growth, LiveOps, Product and Game Design) to help drive decisions based on your analysis.We are a fully remote, creative team distributed around the globe looking for novel ways to bring the metaverse to life.WHO ARE WEAglet today is a digital sneaker collection game, powered by step-counting and an ever expanding catalogue of virtual sneakers. Tomorrow, Aglet will revolutionize how we play games, how we interact with brands, and how the next Virgil Abloh will be discovered. Aglet is powered by Onlife, a bold company and vision dedicated to inspiring the world to Play Life via a series of gamified overlays of our real, location based, context-rich lives, as we live them.WHAT YOU’LL DODevelop key data reports and dashboards and present analysis to stakeholdersDesign, development, testing and deployment of Tableau DashboardsStructure ambiguous business problems and recommend visualization solutionsCollaborate with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing on driving key decisionsBuild the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of dataIdentify, design and implement internal process improvements such as automating manual tasks, optimizing data delivery and governance as well as evolving infrastructure for improved scalabilityABOUT YOU0-1 year experience working with big data sets1 year experience working with Tableau; Experience with using Tableau to aggregate and analyze data collected from various sourcesFluent in SQLExperience with Tableau, dashboard design and deliverySkilled in SQL Server Database Applications: SQL Server Management StudioStrong sense of accountability and understanding of privacy around user dataAccustomed to working in a fast paced environmentExperience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environmentExcellent problem solving, design, debugging, and testing skillsWHAT WE OFFERFully remote position with flexible hoursBudget for home office setupPaid parental leave

multiple_details: Experience in data & analytics is essential!
Description:
G8 Education is an ASX 300 organisation and leading provider of quality early education and care services. Owning over 450 Centres and with over 10,000 team members, we are continually expanding and looking to grow and strengthen our network.
About the role:
To provide value added insights to the business that lead to optimal business decisions. Provide in-depth strategic and analytical information in the areas of operations, customer, network growth and portfolio performance management. Build and maintain reports to track key performance indicators.
Key responsibilities include:
• Use Power BI to understand, interpret, and blend large volumes of data from different sources• Use Power BI to build company-wide reports and model data for analysis• Using data analytics to generate insights in the areas of customer experience, operations, marketing and team• Undertake regular reviews of existing portfolio for demographic, economic and commercial drivers• Produce documentation of results and findings, interpret and present back to the business, including to the executive management • Providing relevant and accurate analytical review of the Group’s data and key performance metrics • Creating efficiencies in reporting methodologies• Work with the rest of the FP&A team in developing G8’s data strategy including data dictionary, data integrity rules, documentation requirements, and master data file management• Business partner with departments within the other areas of the business to provide reporting and analytics to drive increased revenue and lower costs• Present information using Power BI to a range of levels in the organisation including executive management
 
Essential Criteria:
• 4+ years’ experience in a similar role• Undergraduate qualifications in finance, business, or a related discipline• High attention to detail• Problem solving skills• High level understanding of data and experience of blending large volumes of data from different sources• Prior experience in extracting, integrating, manipulating, and displaying data from various systems using automation where possible• Power BI experience highly desirable• A good communicator across all levels of the business• Presentation skills • Ability to plan and prioritise workload • Advanced level of Excel modelling skills• Early education sector experience desired • Natural curiosity to ask questions of the data and look for insights• Basic to intermediate SQL knowledge desired
 
Benefits Include:
• Attractive salary package• Generous discount on childcare fees • Exclusive access to our employee benefits program covering a wide range of discounts and promotions • Dedicated focus on professional growth and development
This is a rare opportunity; if you want a diverse, challenging and personally fulfilling role, apply now!
Please note the advertising closing date is indicative only. G8 Education reserves the right to close the advertisement before this date is reached. Therefore, it is encouraged that you submit your application as soon as possible. G8 Education is a committed advocate for child protection, safety and wellbeing. We have a zero tolerance for any form of child abuse or harm. The safety and wellbeing of children will always be our priority and all team members are expected to embrace this shared commitment.G8 Education is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all who attend the premises that it operates. This includes accepting responsibility to provide, so far as is reasonably practicable, a workplace that is safe and without risk to health for all team members, children and members of the broader community. G8 Education requires all employees to have received both vaccinations by 31st January 2022 (or hold a medical exemption), all new employees joining the organisation will also need to meet this requirement.

Important note: This role is Perth based only - applicants must be in Western Australia or able to relocate.   About the roleWe are currently seeking a Senior Power BI Consultant to join our dynamic and growing team as a permanent staff member. In your new role you'll be responsible for delivery of great data visualisation and analytics solutions to our clients.  Your responsibilities will include:Delivery of Power BI report, dashboard and data management solutions for both long and short term project engagementsProvide support, coaching and training for client staffThis is a customer-facing position with lots of exposure to senior business leaders and industry professionals.  As a self-motivated BI professional, you'll be as comfortable leading a customer workshop as you are delivering high quality dashboard solutions. About the businessLime Theory is a specialist Business Intelligence consultancy based in Perth, Western Australia. We deliver data analytics solutions for businesses across the country.Our mission is to help our clients make better decisions using data.  We achieve this through a unique combination of experience across multiple industries, a focus on true business requirements, and a passion for unlocking insights.As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we specialise in implementing great solutions for our customers using Power BI and Azure data platform components. Benefits and perksLime Theory is a new and growing company: if you're looking for experience working in a dynamic start-up business then look no furtherWe're searching for the right person to fill this important role, with a competitive salary package on offer to match your skills and experience.Flexible work is a core value for our business.  When we're in the office, our ultra-modern working space is in the heart of Perth CBD and includes end of trip facilities, on-site gym and other great perks.   Skills and experienceThe right candidate has specialist experience in scoping, designing, implementing and supporting customers with Microsoft Power BI.Specific skills we're looking for:DAX and Power Query M (minimum 2-3 years)Data model design and development (Power BI or SSAS Tabular)Business requirements gatheringExcellent communication skillsStrong experience in stakeholder and project managementDetailed knowledge of current data visualisation and analytics industry trendsIf you tick any of these boxes then it's an advantage to have experience in:Development using tools such as Tableau, QlikView, Qlik Sense or SpotfireOil & gas, mining or education industriesConsulting roles (including internal consulting roles in large organisations)Specific experience working with LMS, HR, Finance, Health & Safety, or mining production dataExperience with Python for data transformation or analysis

Our people at Central Highlands Water (CHW) have welcomed 2022 with their focus set firmly on our refreshed strategic direction to enhance and deliver our:Customer experienceEmployee experienceBusiness transformationDigital transformationTogether, we’re actively working on evolving to the CHW of the future and, right now, we’re seeking critical thinkers, innovators, outcome achievers and collaborators to help navigate and drive our journey.We require dedicated individuals, across a number of teams, to help us all become the best we can be, while also ensuring our customers, our people and safety are always our number one priority.About the role:Our Business Intelligence Analyst opportunity is a 9 month, fixed term contract position. Your role will support effective decision making at CHW through the delivery of business intelligence products, reporting and analytics. Your responsibilities will include:Assisting CHW in achieving its strategic objectives by working with the business to provide meaningful reports and analytical insightsCoordinating monthly reporting processes for the businessIdentifying opportunities for continuous improvements in the KPI reporting processWorking with business partners to understand and translate business needs into data models, reports and dashboardsSupporting business partners and leaders in the effective use of business intelligence products.Click here for a more detailed position description.What’s in it for you:Working for one of our region’s largest employers you will be part of an organisation that is high achieving, cohesive and always striving for better customer outcomes. We’re full of “everyday people” who are great to work with and reflect our community!At CHW you will:Have access to training and development opportunities that will further develop your knowledge and skillsGain access to career advancement opportunities across the organisationBe part of an organisation that strongly promotes work life balance, flexibility, safety and wellbeingAccess to RDO'sWork in an organisation that makes a difference to our communityBe part of an organisation that cares about you, your safety and wellbeingHow to apply:Before submitting your application, we recommend that you read our Job Application Pack which has important information about how to apply.Please ensure you provide a cover letter, resume and a statement addressing the key selection criteria.If you would like to have a confidential chat about the role or to email your application, please email applications@chw.net.au and a member of the People, Culture & Safety team will get in touch with you.Applications close: 5:00pm, Monday 7 February 2022At CHW we are dedicated to supporting our team’s physical and mental wellbeing. Your new companyAt Hays, we are on a journey to become life-long partners to millions of people and organisations. We are proud to be the Industry Leader and understand the important role our people play to ensure we stay the best.
We are bold, agile, and open to new ideas and approaches, whether embracing cutting-edge technologies, developing our people, or innovating the way we work. We know the right person in the right role can change lives and transform the organisation for the better.What you’ll need to succeed in this role:As Junior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work alongside our Senior BI Analyst and help support the boarder business by analysing and presenting data to inform the decision-making process. You will be responsible for:
Designing, supporting, and maintaining a suite of reports through SSRS, with a view to growth into other reporting platforms (Power BI).
Stakeholder partnering to gather requirements, design, build and deploy solutions.
Analyse data to identify trends and uncover patterns in data and present in dashboards.
Proactively creating and maintaining BI that will assist decision makers and help identify areas for improvement
Assisting with the design and deployment of solutions for contractual requirements of external clients in conjunction with account directors.
To be successful for this role, you will have strong communication skills, the ability to work autonomously and be a self-started. Experience working with SSRS, and advanced SQL knowledge is essential for this role.What you’ll get in returnWe work in a rapidly evolving industry and to help support you in navigating these changes and to enable you to work more efficiently, we invest in your training, development and technology, as well as offer a flexible work environment with the opportunity to work between the office and home.
We encourage diversity of thought to create new ideas and innovate our ways of working and our leadership group is committed to helping you develop your skills and career through on-going training, coaching and support, which could include a move to one of our other 33 countries that we operate in.​
A career at Hays means working with skilled people from diverse backgrounds, in a great atmosphere and with career advancement opportunities.

What's Vision Super all about?Vision Super is an industry super fund that's been looking after Australians' retirement savings for 70 years. We put our member's best interests at the centre of everything we do. We're a top performing fund, one of the few with SuperRatings' coveted 10-year Platinum Rating. We are a hybrid work environment.The Business Intelligence team is a very important part of achieving Vision Super's goals as we look to consolidate our growth. As a BI all-rounder, you will work in each of the areas of the lifecycle, from gathering requirements to back end and report development. What will I be doing?The team has already established an extensive data warehouse, and your role is to help extract value for the business and in turn our members. Your ability to interpret and elaborate requirements, to rapidly develop iterative solutions will be key to your success in this role.You can expect day to day variability and interesting work, so you’ll need to be a flexible all-rounder to enjoy this environment.This includes:Gathering and interpreting business requirements to produce a variety of reporting products, primarily reports using Power BIDeveloping insightful and robust DAX measures that are underpinned by sound business logic, and documenting theseContributing to our tabular models (Tabular Editor 3), including relationships and hierarchy design, partitioning and processingAssisting with maintaining and further developing the enterprise data warehouse (EDW) using the Microsoft stack, mainly SQL and SSISHelp internal stakeholders through the data discovery process, to foster understanding of the BI infrastructure and capabilities What are the applicable skills and qualifications?We're looking for someone:With a passion for providing innovative technology solutions, with a ‘can do’ attitude and ability to hit the ground running in new environmentsWith three or more years’ experience in a similar BI role. If you have experience in professional/financial services, that would be a plusWho has data warehousing knowledge and experience working with complex datasetsWho has experience in developing analytical modelsWith a relevant tertiary degree - IT, maths/stats and/or business majors preferred All applicants must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst | 6 months Contract with extension
Description: Job Title: BI Analyst  Job Type: Contract  Duration: 6 months with possible extensions Location: Sydney, NSW (remote working)   Description: As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the success and growth of our client by advancing the local business intelligence competency in the ANZ region. You will engage with internal business stakeholders of all levels across the business, consult with them, and provide support & guidance in defining and delivering their BI needs.  Support advancement of the business intelligence competency in the ANZ regionConvert business questions and high-level data collection needs into well-specified analyses and reporting requirementsEngage as the subject matter expert on our selected platforms and successfully deploy business intelligence solutions to satisfy information requirements.Promote the use of BI solutions throughout the business and help ensure they are a key part in decision makingManage the full BI solution delivery processGather BI requirements, design solutions and see them through to deliverySupport project management activities as requiredManage business change and adoption by coordinating delivery through to releaseMaintain functional and/or technical documentationMonitor usage and engagement of BI projects Experience Requirement  Must Have:Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau, Looker or Power BIAdvanced SQL skillsExperience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and BigQueryDemonstrated success of project delivery / business change within Business IntelligenceDetermined to identify solutions and be prepared to overcome obstacles to follow through plans to completionAbility to communicate complex ideas simplyProcess focus and detail orientedAbility to tell a story with data, comfortable presenting to senior leadershipExcellent communication, organization and presentation skills (written, oral, and across Microsoft Office Suite)Highly motivated self-starterGood to Have:Experience with Python and/or RTableau DataPrep  Interested candidates please reach out to our consultant Waqas Kidwai at waqaskidwai@future-you.com.au or 0401 274 821

Job Details:  Permanent Full-time Location: Melbourne Salary Range: $105,684 - $114,389 per annum + 17% super  About the Role: Our client is a prominent learning and research University seeking a BI Technical Business Analyst to facilitate the success of data consumers and users from within the University Faculty environment by connecting them with the University Decision Support Team's services and allowing them to understand and exploit the capabilities of the data asset. The role will promote good Data Governance Practices across the Data Governance Network. Your day will include:  Developing high-quality process maps, user stories with associated documentation and development test cases scenarios. Document data linage between source systems and data warehouse Provide end-to-end process analysis and provide recommendations via gap analysis Work with developers & testers to ensure development aligns with functional specification including:  developing /supporting end-to-end test plans & activities, such as unit testing, SME testing and User Acceptance testing (UAT)    Experience needed:  Gathering & documenting user requirements Knowledge of good data governance practices Proven ability to manage stakeholder expectations Superior presentation, analytical, verbal, and written skills. Strong SQL skills and understanding of data linage Data warehouse and business intelligence tools Relational databases Developing end-to-end test plans including unit testing, SME testing and UAT    Benefits:  17% superannuation Extra public holidays throughout the year Salary packaging – pay for phones / laptops, child care etc with pre-tax dollars 25% off University fees if you want to pursue further study Pool and gym memberships IT courses to maintain certification Excellent team environment  Apply now. For more information contact Erin 0262010106 or one of our Consultants on 0386139999.

$87,931 per annum + super +benefitsPermanent Full-TimeInformation Services BranchOrganisational ServicesBundaberg Region About Us Are you ready to join our team and build Australia's best regional community?   Here at Bundaberg Regional Council, our vision is bold but simple, to build Australia’s best regional community. In order to achieve this, we’ve created a culture that’s centred on our core values. To be a Council that is customer-focused, respectful and prides itself on teamwork, diversity, sustainability, and innovation. Uniquely positioned north of Brisbane in Queensland, Australia, the Bundaberg Region is one of Australia’s fastest-growing regional cities and the gateway to the Southern Great Barrier Reef. The Bundaberg Region boasts the most equitable climate in Australia and rates fifth in the world alongside Hawaii.  Noted for its environmental excellence, pristine waterways, and proximity to the Great Barrier Reef, the Bundaberg Region showcases everything that nature’s palette can create.   About The Opportunity Your role as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to support Council’s direction by delivering modernised reports to effectively satisfy audit requirements and drive the value addition in decision making by delivering Council’s disparate, complex and large data sets in an effective fashion.  Some of your challenging and interesting responsibilities include:  Writing SQL scripts to extract/input and analyse data from numerous platforms. Analysing and understanding business process with the diverse teams across council to understand the requirement for emerging reporting needs. Development of dashboards in business intelligence tools such as Power BI against live or point in time data sets. Utilise business improvement, innovation and design expertise to create opportunities for improvement and risk mitigation. Contribute to organisational capability development and continuous improvement initiatives.  About You  You will possess a tertiary qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology or related discipline. Considerable relevant experience in a similar role. High level ability to common scripting language such as PHP or Python. Experience and knowledge of enterprise data architecture of core business applications such as ERP, Finance, EDRMS, CRM, HR, Payroll etc in a medium to large enterprise environment. Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem solve effectively. Exceptional communication and presentation skills with the ability to effectively engage with internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrated experience in Power BI stack or equivalent software. Extensive knowledge and proven experience in MS SQL and reporting packages.  What We Offer  A competitive remuneration salary with options for salary sacrifice, up to 12% Superannuation contributions, 17.5% leave loading Opportunities for professional development training and study assistance to enhance your career progression Flexible working arrangements Work within a culture that promotes a healthy work-life balance and a friendly and supportive team  We offer more: To view our full range of benefits, rewards and recognition, click here. The Selection Process The preferred candidate will be required to undertake a National Police Clearance as part of the recruitment process; and will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide the appropriate evidence. How to Apply To apply or find out more about the position, please click on the 'apply now' button where you will be redirected to our website to answer our questionnaire, followed by attaching your resume. Closing Date: 11:30pm Friday 28 January 2022 AEST Bundaberg Regional Council prides itself as an equal opportunity employer and embraces the diversity that our teams bring, so if this sounds like the position for you, don't delay - apply now!

Great opportunity to join our team at Demant, a global healthcare organisation.  We are looking for a passionate, skilled Business Intelligence Analyst to join a small team working closely with departments across the business to support the use of data and analytics to improve the quality of life of people living with hearing loss.   This is a fulltime role and can be based either at our Macquarie Park Office, Sydney or our Parkside Office, Adelaide.    About Demant Demant is a world-leading hearing healthcare group that offers solutions and services to help people with hearing loss connect and communicate with the world around them. For more than a century, the Demant Group has played a vital part in developing innovative technologies and know-how to help improve people’s health and hearing. In every aspect, from hearing devices, hearing implants and diagnostic equipment to hearing care all over the world, Demant is active and engaged. A growing business in intelligent audio solutions for gaming and office communication is also a significant part of the Group.The Demant Group operates in a global market with companies in more than 30 countries, employs approx. 17,500 people globally. Our products are sold in more than 130 countries where we create life-changing differences through hearing health. As a valued member of Demant shared services BI team, you will join this effort to help people reach their full hearing potential. Role We are seeking a motivated business focussed Business Intelligence Analyst, working in a dynamic and fast paced environment, you will be exposed to the commercial aspect of both Australia & New Zealand with opportunities to add value within our Asia markets in the near future.   The core focus of this role will involve:    Strategic thinking, commercial acumen and creating positive change Turning data into information, reports into action and delivering continuous improvement Developing and delivering sustainable business solutions Interrogating our database to locate opportunities Conducting cost benefit & root cause analysis Report development and optimisation Representing Business Intelligence across multiple forums including major strategic projects     The ideal candidate will possess:  5+ years’ experience in an analytical, BI, Insights role  Previous experience supporting a Retail and/or Marketing team is highly desirable Demonstrated experience in relational databases and writing SQL queries Advanced computer skills including Excel, Power BI or similar Ability to combine strong analytical and problem solving skills with a key focus on attention to detail Versatility to build rapport with key stakeholders at all levels   What’s in it for you:   Permanent, Fulltime, Office located at either Sydney or Adelaide Be a part of fast-growing global business that offers best in class hearing care ‘MyRewards program – a program that offers discounts to more than 300 retailers and services across Australia. Wellbeing centre – an online platform that offers a countless number of online workouts, meditations, nutritional and financial advice – everything you need to live a healthier and happier life Employee Assistance Program Birthday and Christmas gifts   Don't Delay,  Apply Now!    NOTE: We review applications from multiple platforms and invite candidates for interviews continually, so don't delay, submit your application as soon as possible.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Report Analyst - 6 month Fixed Term Contract
Description: About us  Connecting people and communities| Driving eCommerce | Moving Australia & New Zealand  With an unrivalled and expansive network, Global Express builds unique, innovative, and tailored transport and logistics solutions.  From a shipload of containers full of fresh produce, urgent medical deliveries on the next available flight, end-to-end retail to every corner, or simply delivering gifts to friends and family you dearly miss by road or rail, we connect people, communities, and businesses across Australia and New Zealand.  Backed by Allegro Funds, Australia’s most awarded and largest transformation and turnaround private equity firm, we’re looking to the future and working towards new and exciting ways to put our customers’ businesses at the heart of ours.  Your Opportunity  We are bringing our Global Express Shared Services (GSS) department onshore to Australia to bring us closer to our customers and enable us to provide them with an exceptional customer experience. We are going through an exciting period of transformation and are looking for proactive, solutions focused and customer obsessed individuals to join us on our journey.  We have a rare opportunity for a Business Intelligence Report Analyst to join our Transformation space.    Reporting to the Head of Operations Support, you will be responsible for managing the delivery of high-quality Business Intelligence services to Global Express Shared Services, supporting effective business decision making and enhancing both financial and operational performance.   You will build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders across the business, as well as coach and mentor team members to achieve great outcomes, and actively seek to understand the business context of data and associated business processes.   Other responsibilities include:  Work with the Operations Support team to ensure we have a breadth of developing expertise and provide input on the resourcing and capability gaps we are likely to face in the future to cover our evolving data and reporting needs Foster an agile, high-performance, collaborative culture which is creative, open, collaborative and dynamic with a continuous improvement mindset  Strong emphasis and understanding of data quality and excellence in reporting – this includes uplifting existing reports  Liaise and collaborate with IT delivery and support teams to achieve successful business outcomes, while aligning with established IT processes and standards  As an employee you will also enjoy flexible work options, supportive hands-on training, and career progression opportunities.    What you’ll bring to this role  To be successful in this role, you could have the following experience:  Proven experience in developing reports and administering Business Intelligence applications, in at least one of the following: TM1, Power BI or SAS Strong programming skills, preferably in Power BI or at least one of the following: SQL, Python or SAS Experience in in gathering business requirements in the context of data analytics and report writing  Highly effective communication with the ability to coach and mentor team members, and feels confident leading workshops with business users and/or delivery teams  Passion for data and quality report writing  Collaborative, self-motivated and customer-focused service attitude  Undergraduate and/or gradate qualification in a discipline relating to Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology is highly desired   Additional Information  We believe nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace, which celebrates different points of view and gives everyone the chance to contribute, as we build to a bigger and brighter future.   As an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.  It’s never been a more exciting time to join our team as we take the next step in our journey.  To find out more about us, visit https://www.tgexpress.com.au/careers  To be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment. Global Express is required to comply with State/Territory public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces. Accordingly, you may be required to produce appropriate evidence to enter a workplace or verify compliance with any applicable State/Territory issued public health orders/direction

Business Intelligence Analyst - Exciting Permanent Opportunity in a Growing Organisation

Our client is seeking a business intelligence analyst to assist in the design and build of the centralised Data Platform and Business Intelligence capabilities to ensure clients and business users have access to relevant information at ease.

The organisation is relatively small with an emphasis on culture and creating a positive workplace environment with employee benefits such as gym membership and complementary physio.

The suitable candidate will hold a position within the data and analytics team. They will be responsible for developing reports and dashboards to meet end user needs, the ongoing support and maintenance of existing Power BI dashboards, ad hoc analyses, and data extracts. The emphasis on Power BI experience is highly desirable.

Please note that applicants must be Australian Citizens and can obtain a baseline clearance.

If this role sounds suitable and you would like to find out more details, please feel free to give Con Karapanagos a call on 0432 276 472.

hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.The group has an insatiable appetite for analytics and insight; we understand and leverage data to deliver world-class customer experiences, operational processes, and strategic decisions. Our analysts are rock stars and recognised for the great work they do. The Business Intelligence Analyst role is a multi-faceted function. You get to work on strategic projects, provide analytics and consulting to business partners, deliver on ad hoc requests, and work on analytics products. Across these varied engagements your primary responsibility is to enable our organisation to extract the most value possible from our data assets. Your expertise enables you to analyse and model data to extract valuable insights and present this back in a form which enables timely business decisions and actions.You will be responsible for:Working closely with the Humm group business to understand their business need and requirements for analytics and insight.Discovering and blending data from our data warehouse, source systems and other internal and external data. You need to understand data origin and sources of authority for data and ensure that data is consistent and fit for purpose.Analysing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns and validate and socialise these discoveries. There are opportunities to learn and leverage advanced analytics approaches such as data science and probability predictions to forecast outcomes and identify hidden customer behaviour.Presenting your analysis to the business community using data visualisation and storytelling techniques ensuring that data elements are clear, well defined, and unambiguous. You will demonstrate understanding of the problem domain, business processes and the underlying systems and data sources.Applying appropriate data governance to your solutions aligning with our data standards and controls.There are opportunities to mentor junior analysts in the team.About you:Relevant tertiary qualification or analytics experience.An enthusiasm for data analytics and motivated to be the best you can be in this exciting and rapidly changing landscape. You are naturally curious with a strong attention to detail and motivated to go the extra mile to deliver outstanding outcomes.You have high data literacy and technically capable, but also someone who equally enjoys working in the business and building relationships. You are comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic work environment, are highly consultative, confident to voice your opinion when necessary and pride yourself on being a good listener.Possess strong attention to detail, reconciliation, and testing. Highly organised and reliable.Good time management with the ability to multitask, prioritise and deliver to schedule. Work well under pressure and use judgement in problem solving.Driven to constantly learn, develop new skills, and share these capabilities – importantly you have a growth mindset.Skills RequiredCompetent analyst and problem-solver.Able to understand business requirements, translate these requirements into prototypes and analytic solutions, and deliver through visual reports and dashboards.Excellent communication with an ability to interact with different stakeholders, both non-technical and technical.Experience in Microsoft Power BI and being highly competent in SQL is a requirement. You are confident working with large datasets, building data sets and competent in developing and publishing reports and dashboards.Able to manage multiple work requests concurrently, self-manage your workload and manage expectations with stakeholders.About the teamThe Data and Analytics team sits within wider IT function. We are a team that is tasked with using data, analytics, AI and automation across the organisation to deliver outstanding outcomes.We work within a flat organisational structure which encourages strong relationships, ownership, teamwork, and autonomy. We have a great team culture, where we celebrate openness, our willingness to support each other, and a strong focus on learning and innovation.
