About us:We’re known for being the country’s most popular rewards program, making the everyday worth more for millions of Aussies. But 26 years of success and growth doesn’t happen by keeping up the status quo.All the things that make working at Flybuys different as usual – these aren't just values we talk about. They’re built into everything we do, every day.Be part of a company that's always questioned the norm. A business that's well-established, but still expanding. With one eye on the horizon.And together we can make every day different as usual.Your Team:We've already built a pretty amazing team, but we're not looking for more of the same. Our day-to-day is made stronger when we surround ourselves with people who are different, like you.We work really hard to build teams that support each other. It’s the kind of environment you’ll miss while you’re on holidays.Your Role:There is no typical working week at Flybuys. But here are some of the things you might be working on, day-to-day;Work with Analytics and Commercial teams to articulate the customer opportunity, commercial benefit, analytical findings.Respond to requests from partners and Commercial team in a timely fashion, providing accurate, QC'd analysis and findings.Have input on workload prioritisation, with informed view of relative value of each analytics request.Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics based decision making.Translate complex mathematical techniques into consumable and commercial concepts, with a focus on promoting the value of the flybuys program.Participate in planning with key customers to create a joined up vision and deliverables.Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.Use of a variety of sources to keep abreast of industry practices.Ensure key stakeholders are updated, ensuring the commercial impact has been explored / communicate.Your Experience:Tertiary Qualified in Business, Mathematics or Science discipline.Analytics professional with a proven track record, (minimum 3 years working experience)Experience in reporting analytics - from planning to post campaign analysis.Great influencing and storytelling skills and the ability to navigate internal and external organisations to build and leverage relationships.Experience in clearly articulating commercial benefits of analytics.Naturally collaborative with a strong emphasis on building and leveraging relationships both internally and externally.Experience of large, complex data sets.Naturally curious, able to positively challenge existing practices.Experience of analytical tools – data extraction, data exploration and analysis, data visualisation.Experience of working within large, complex, cross functional projects .Technical skills including Oracle SQL, R, BI experience (e.g.Tableau, MicroStrategy)Experience with Snowflake would be advantageous.We value ways of working that work for everyone, and use our different strengths to make us stronger.We work hard to make sure everyone’s voice is heard and respected equally, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.So whether you’re an earlybird list maker, a night owl coder, a brainstorm chaser or a PowerPoint proof-reader, we want you to Be You, With Us.

So, this is William Buck:
We believe in Changing Lives!
Forget the 'number crunching' stereotype, this firm is 100% people focused. Our bold brand promise 'Changing Lives' is more than just a brand promise, it's part of everything we do.
William Buck is fast growing a reputation as a place that provides a professional and friendly working environment with a great culture, benefits and clear and progressive career opportunities.
The Opportunity
William Buck are developing innovative new solutions producing insights from data, and we have a fantastic opportunity for a BI Analyst to join our team.  
This is an exciting new role for us and we are looking for an individual who will work closely with our business software developers and the broader technology team to understand our business needs, develop and maintain reports and data visualisations, and develop prototypes that can be further developed into reports and dashboards.
As well as demonstrated technical knowledge, we are seeking a friendly, collaborative team member with fantastic customer service skills, and a problem-solving attitude. 
 
Key responsibilities will include:
Developing strong relationships with stakeholders to capture requirements and business needs
Translate business needs into data models, business intelligence reports, data visualisation dashboards and the underlying data structures that support evidence-based decision making and insights
Assisting with analysis, strategic advice and support across the organisation, with a focus on the use of business intelligence to drive improvement 
Working with data owners to understand the data capture processes and design validation reports to improve data quality processes
Assist with the design and migration to a cloud-based enterprise data warehouse
Provide technical support to the development team as required 
Desired skills and Experience:
Experience in a similar role or an accountant who has gained skills in data analytics or software development
Relevant tertiary qualifications (accounting, computer science, mathematics, STEM) or equivalent experience SQL data extraction and manipulation skills
Demonstrated experience in data warehousing and automated reporting using Power BI or similar
Working knowledge with APIs – RESTful desirable but not essential
Experience working with integration and workflow automation platforms such as Workato, Dell Boomi, Nintex etc. is a plus
Attention to detail, ability to identify technical issues, contribute to business process improvements, and to clearly document progress and solutions
Demonstrated ability to work within a team and independently to deliver high quality results in a dynamic environment.
 
Your application will remain confidential and the successful applicant will have Australian permanent residency or unrestricted Australian working Visa rights.

Background  Due to its significant and ongoing business growth this innovative organisation has an exciting opportunity for a talented Reports / Data Analyst to support its expansion and goals of bringing life changing solutions to the Australian market. Working predominantly on products built in-house, across multiple industry sectors, Power BI specialisation will be a key foundation of this new requirement however broader Data Warehousing and Data Analytics skills will be expected as the business looks to enhance their products offering.    Over the course of the pandemic our client has led the field in how it’s supported its employees. They’ve retained strong relationships with their teams, strengthened by the care it’s shown to their individual situations and well-being. They will encourage your continuous professional development and advancement through the provision of ongoing in-house technology hubs and career development opportunities as well as offering generous remuneration and recognition programs.    The Role  The projects you'll be tasked with delivering will vary in terms of technology stack and complexity and you will be provided with an autonomous work environment where your input and ideas will be incorporated and rewarded within group decision making processes.    As an experienced Reporting Analyst, you will assist with the development of interactive reporting dashboards in PowerBI.  Working in an integral position facilitating information between multiple client departments, the successful applicant will work within the Data team and partner with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver reporting and analytics solutions, as well as providing solutions to visualise data to aid the clients reporting capability.    About You  To be successful in this role, you will need to have a genuine team based and collaborative approach to project delivery. We are looking for a self-driven individual who can bring innovative solutions to the table and is happy to contribute ideas in a supportive arena.    To be successful in this role, ideally, you'll be able to demonstrate the following:  Key Requirements:   Experience developing reports and interactive dashboards in Power BI SAP experience highly desirable (not mandatory) Proven ability interpreting and connecting data elements from imperfect to real-world applications Demonstrated experience visualising data to help aid decision making and providing level reporting capability SQL Server Integration Services or similar ETL tools desirable Stakeholder engagement and communication       If you think this sounds like the role and environment for you, please apply using the “Apply Now” button on this page for immediate consideration.   Alternatively, for more information on the role and organisation, please contact Alan Quigley on Alan.Quigey@calleo.com.au or on 0450 352 686.

Job Title: Senior Functional Analyst, Data and Intelligence
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
Our Senior Functional Analysts support the Manager to lead the collection, analysis and dissemination of high-quality data, and BI solutions to support and influence decision making. We have two roles:

One role focuses on analysing and recommending opportunities for integration and workflows between Microsoft Office 365 and Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Portals, Power Automate, and Power Virtual Agent, Dataverse) and how they influence and shape Division's reporting.
The other role is a data visualisation specialist supports who leads the visualisation component of the Data and Intelligence Unit through the use of Power Bi and Tableau data visualisation tools. The role is responsible for collection, analysis and dissemination of high-quality data, and BI solutions to support and influence decision making.

An exciting opportunity exists for a Senior Functional Analyst on a fixed term basis until 31 December 2022 in COVID19 Response, Data and Intelligence team.
As a member of the Data and Intelligence team::

Contribute to development and implementation of the Division's strategy in ways that align with the evolving needs of its audiences, government policy and state-wide priorities
Contribute to the annual work plan and implementation of activities in it that are assigned to the Branch
Contribute to the Department's legislative compliance agenda, and participate in relevant activities assigned to the Branch (e.g. privacy and confidentiality of information)
Establish and maintain positive and productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Make professional presentations and represent the Department at internal and external meetings, functions, forums and events

For more information on the accountabilities and key selection criteria and qualification requirements for the role please refer to the Position Description attached.

Job DescriptionAbout the role:Reporting to the GM of Optimisation, you will be responsible for the Application and Systems Analysis, Support and Delivery of the SQL Database for KinCare. You will provide essential support to the business by utilising SQL Server services including  SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and data migration from Salesforce to SQL Server.  This role will work cross-functionally with key stakeholders and business leaders to create and maintain databases, data migration, data extraction and recovery procedures.The role is initially for 12months but there is strong likelihood that it will be converted to a permanent position. Our office is based at Bella Vista but we can also offer regular work from home each week too.You will have:Advanced scripting in SQL Server experience and proficiency with Microsoft business intelligence stack (SSMS, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS); Strong SQL skills, proven ability in extracting and analysing large data sets;Experience in database performance tuning including complex query optimizations and physical database tuning using SQL;Demonstrated experience with complex data extraction and analysis of data using Salesforce;Demonstrated experience in data analytics, statistical and quantitative modelling for the purposes of business analysis and decision support, preferably in a health-related field;Demonstrated ability to engage and work collaboratively with key business stakeholders on analytics projects, including understanding and refining requirements and effective presentation of results to non-technical stakeholders;Experience creating and maintaining business reports and dashboards; andBachelor’s Degree in business or a related discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or IT.About KinCare:We have a 28-year track record of supporting older Australians and people with a disability to live independently. We’re committed to improving the quality of life and health & wellbeing for our customers through tailored in-home care services.It’s really the people here who make it a great place to work. When you come to work for us, you can be sure that you will be inspired and challenged every day. Each day you will be surrounded by passionate, committed colleagues and get to build some meaningful connections. You will also receive the support and training you need for a rewarding long-term career. As a family orientated company, we believe time at work and at home matters. We are all about work-life balance and flexibility.Prior to commencement, every successful candidate must complete a mandatory National Police check, Work rights check and provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination.If this sounds like the role and workplace for you, apply now!Further information can be obtained by visiting: www.kincare.com.au

Avant is Australia’s leading medical defence organisation with a proud heritage of protecting Australian medical professionals for over 125 years.
Avant now represents 80,000 health practitioners and medical students across every state and territory, delivering market leading products and services to meet their professional, personal and practice needs. Building on this heritage, our vision is to be the most trusted professional partner in supporting doctors throughout their lives and careers.
Being a mutual organisation, owned by members and run purely for their benefit, our members are at the centre of all we do. As well as providing products and services to our member, we play a broader community role by advocating for improvements in the healthcare system and in quality, safety and professionalism in medicine, through delivering education and research activities.
The position
As a Business Intelligence Specialist at Avant, you’ll be joining the Enterprise Information Management (EIM) team within the Group Technology Services (GTS), responsible for helping our business get the most value out of their data. You will be the Qlik Sense guru and data modelling hero that enables our business to conquer the last mile of analytics.
Avant highly values data analytics and we have recently invested a great effort in designing and implementing a state-of-the-art data platform. In this role, you’ll help us extract valuable insights from our data. Using DBT (Data Build Tool) on Snowflake, you model our datasets into the context of our business areas. With your partnering skills, you are able to extract business requirements and translate them into data models and Qlik Sense apps that help our data tell its story. At the end of the day, our stakeholders can make data-driven decisions thanks to your hard work.
This is a full-time permanent position. The team is currently located in Sydney, but working out of one of our other offices is an option (Melbourne, Canberra, Adelaide, Brisbane, Hobart, Perth).
The key responsibilities include:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to extract requirements and design data solutions
Model datasets and build Qlik Sense apps to create the insights our stakeholders need to thrive
Be a thought leader on, and advocate of, data modelling and Qlik Sense best practices and share your knowledge and expertise with the wider analytical community

The key skills needed to be successful in this role

2+ years hands-on experience in within a data-oriented role:
An entrepreneurial, curious, hands-on and problem-solving mindset
The ability to distil user requirements and translate those into a data model and app design
Excellent communication and collaboration skills; enjoyment of working with colleagues from different business areas.
Experience with Snowflake, DBT and/or Python would be looked upon favourably

Why work at Avant?
At Avant, our people are the centre of everything we do for our members. We offer a range of benefits and opportunities to enable you to make a difference, learn, and grow in your career.

Discount of 25% on Private Health Insurance, free Salary Continuance Insurance and free Travel Insurance
We value our people by offering an inclusive workplace with flexible work, career development and internal mobility opportunities.  Our flexible working arrangements are designed to enable genuine work-life balance.
Your development is our priority and we have a variety of learning and development programs that will support you in your career.
Employee Referral Program which rewards $2,500
We offer support to our people via Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Health and Wellbeing programs, Tertiary Education Sponsorship and Support.
We have a diverse and connected work environment where your contribution and ideas will be valued and respected and make a real difference to the lives of others.

Please note:  Avant Mutual is a vaccinated employer.  Prior to the commencement of your employment by Avant, you are required to be fully vaccinated against the Covid-19 virus or have a medical certificate stating that you cannot receive a Covid-19 vaccination for valid medical reasons.  
For further information, please contact our Careers team at careers@avant.org.au

We celebrate continuous learning at TTD – here you will have opportunities to be sponsored for further education, certifications and we also have an in-house learning platform to support your further development 3. Our culture - We have a wonderful team of brilliant high achievers built on a culture of empathy, grit, collaboration, & ownership. We are an award-winning company – we have won ‘Great Place to Work’ awards across Australia, US, UK, Europe and Asia! 4. responsibility is to enable our organisation to extract the most value possible from our data assets. Your expertise enables you to analyse and model data to extract valuable insights and present this back in a form which enables timely business decisions and actions.You will be responsible for:Working closely with the Humm group business to understand their business need and requirements for community using data visualisation and storytelling techniques ensuring that data elements are clear, well defined, and unambiguous. You will demonstrate understanding of the problem domain, business Job Title: Senior Functional Analyst, Data and Intelligence
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
Our Senior Functional Analysts support the Manager to lead the collection, analysis and dissemination of high-quality data, and BI solutions to support and influence decision making. We have two roles:

One role focuses on analysing and recommending opportunities for integration and workflows between Microsoft Office 365 and Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Portals, Power Automate, and Power Virtual Agent, Dataverse) and how they influence and shape Division's reporting.
The other role is a data visualisation specialist supports who leads the visualisation component of the Data and Intelligence Unit through the use of Power Bi and Tableau data visualisation tools. The role is responsible for collection, analysis and dissemination of high-quality data, and BI solutions to support and influence decision making.

An exciting opportunity exists for a Senior Functional Analyst on a fixed term basis until 31 December 2022 in COVID19 Response, Data and Intelligence team.
As a member of the Data and Intelligence team::

Contribute to development and implementation of the Division's strategy in ways that align with the evolving needs of its audiences, government policy and state-wide priorities
Contribute to the annual work plan and implementation of activities in it that are assigned to the Branch
Contribute to the Department's legislative compliance agenda, and participate in relevant activities assigned to the Branch (e.g. privacy and confidentiality of information)
Establish and maintain positive and productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Make professional presentations and represent the Department at internal and external meetings, functions, forums and events

For more information on the accountabilities and key selection criteria and qualification requirements for the role please refer to the Position Description attached.
MANDATORY VACCINATION POLICYThe department is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its workers and clients. The department may require its employees to be fully vaccinated against preventable diseases such as the current coronavirus (COVID-19) based on Victorian Chief Health Officer's Directions as issued and updated from time to time. Vaccination requirements may differ from role to role based on their risk category and the duties performed. The department's policy (attached) outlines the risk categories and requirements for employees working for the department. Where relevant, proof of immunisation status may be required.  For this role, you are required to submit proof of vaccination prior to commencement. Please refer to the attached policy for more information - DFFH COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination policy.
HOW TO APPLY:Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.Please note, for this position, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document.Preferred candidates will be required to complete pre-employment screening, including a national police check and misconduct screening.Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.  For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit Department of Families, Fairness and Housing Victoria | Jobs (www.dffh.vic.gov.au/jobs)

Our products are sold in more than 130 countries where we create life-changing differences through hearing health. As a valued member of Demant shared services BI team, you will join this effort to help people reach their full hearing potential. Role We are seeking a motivated business focussed Business Intelligence Analyst, working in a dynamic and fast paced environment, you will be exposed to the commercial aspect of both Australia & New Zealand with opportunities to add value within our Asia markets in the near future.   The core focus of this role will involve:    Strategic thinking, commercial acumen and creating positive change Turning data into information, reports into action and delivering continuous improvement Developing and delivering sustainable business solutions Interrogating our database to locate opportunities Conducting cost benefit & root cause analysis Report development and optimisation Representing Business Intelligence across multiple forums including major strategic projects     The ideal candidate will possess:  5+ years’ experience in an analytical, BI, Insights role  Previous experience supporting a Retail and/or Marketing team is highly desirable Demonstrated experience in relational databases and writing SQL queries Advanced computer skills including Excel, Power BI or similar Ability to combine strong analytical and problem solving skills with a key focus on attention to detail Versatility to build rapport with key stakeholders at all levels   What’s in it for you:   Permanent, Fulltime, Office located at either Sydney or Adelaide Be a part of fast-growing global business that offers best in class hearing care ‘MyRewards program – a program that offers discounts to more than 300 retailers and services across Australia. Wellbeing centre – an online platform that offers a countless number of online workouts, meditations, nutritional and financial advice – everything you need to live a healthier and happier life Employee Assistance Program Birthday and Christmas gifts   Don't Delay,  Apply Now!    NOTE: We review applications from multiple platforms and invite candidates for interviews continually, so don't delay, submit your application as soon as possible.

In addition, this role is to explore the new methods of reporting and use new tools to enhance accessibility. You will be working with a wide range of stakeholders, drawing on a rich data environment. Develop a data strategy and provide insights to the Executive and Senior Leadership teams as to potential improvements and issues within the reporting tools and the data collection processes used Provide a consultative approach to define, analyse and solve data and reporting issues Ensuring quality, accuracy, and timeliness of all source data used in metrics reporting, including the accurate labelling of data in reporting, clear identification of sources and data definitions Develop a data strategy that will utilise innovative applications to enable automated financial reporting and provide insights. The ability to explore some new methods of reporting, using tools such as PowerBi  About You We are seeking an energetic, passionate and qualified individual who is looking for an opportunity to develop and take their career to the next level. Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst – Scentre Group BrandSpace 
 
Our story 
Scentre Group is the owner and operator of 42 Westfield living centres in Australia and New Zealand. Our purpose is to create extraordinary places, connecting and enriching communities.
A career with Scentre Group BrandSpace fosters the chance to be part of a team that is transforming the digital media and physical retail space. Work with great people and add value to a tangible product you can see.
Through our extensive Digital Out-of-Home Media and Casual Mall Leasing networks, the BrandSpace team harnesses the full power of the Westfield environment to create meaningful connections between brands, retailers and shoppers.
The Role
We’re seeking an experienced Reporting Analyst to fuel our sales insight capability and enable the effectiveness of a large ANZ sales team, this role reports into the Business Intelligence Manager within the Sales Operations & Strategy team and is responsible for;

Compiling, analysing and reporting on sales data
The creation, build & continual improvement of dashboarding across multiple data sources.
Proactively improving the quality of an insight-driven reporting suite.
Supporting the advancement and automation of the regular sales reporting, analytics and analysis.
Delivering insight led recommendations for process improvement.
Redefining the analytics environment to track network and sales performance.
Generating models to forecast demand and revenue performance.
Generating actionable insights to inform the annual GTM sales strategy.
Executing on the development and delivery of annual sales targets and goal setting.
Developing tools to capture competitor activity and market trends.

What will set you apart from the rest? 
We’re not looking for one specific background, but what will stand out is your ability to generate powerful insights to focus the sales effort and track to performance goals. The distilling of large data sets into simplified, insight-driven dashboards will be second nature. You’ll be able to demonstrate experience not only technically in your career, but also with business partnering too. In addition to your technical capability, you’ll be confident, energetic and driven. You’ll have a history of building a strong rapport with all your stakeholders and thrive in a fast paced and evolving environment.

Motivated in creating performance dashboards and data visualisation?
Commercially minded Analyst with a strong understanding of the drivers of sales performance?
Proven track record of analysing complex datasets to identify trends and produce high quality actionable insights?
A considered a trusted advisor to your stakeholders with a minimum 3-4 years’ experience in a similar role?
An expert at Excel and Tableau/Power BI? Experienced with relational databases >2yrs SQL, Google BQ, Salesforce?

 
 
What sets us apart from the rest? 

Diverse career paths across our vertically integrated business with an in demand Data analytics core focus
Ability to innovate in a company that not only encourages it but will facilitate it
Competitive benefits including 18 weeks parental leave, volunteer days to work with our charity partners, health and wellbeing discounts and ability to purchase extra annual leave
For the second year running we have been named as a Bronze Employer at the Australian LGBTI Inclusion Awards
We’re recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) and committed to creating a workplace culture in which women and men are equally valued and rewarded

To us, diversity is about recognising and valuing the contribution of people from different backgrounds, with different perspectives and experiences. We believe that all the ways we're different contribute to our success. Diversity includes (but is not limited to) gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion and cultural background. About Bis  For over 100 years Bis has been delivering logistics, materials handling, specialised equipment and consulting services to resource companies across Australia and Indonesia.  We’ve also developed leading edge mining solutions Rexx, Razor and Auto-mate. About the Position    We are currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Engineer to join our North Sydney based team.  The role will support the Business Metrics Manager in delivering key Business Intelligence reporting capabilities for Bis. You will drive the development, implementation and ongoing support of all BI related systems. You will also work closely with the Project Teams to implement and monitor the BI systems to achieve maximum benefit for the business as a whole.    This position will also provide second level support to the service desk for the BI applications and conduct system testing, documentation and training. You will support the Business Metrics Manager in ensuring that all allocated projects and tasks are delivered on time and within budget to support Bis.  Key tasks / responsibilities include:  Oversee the data warehouse including the collection, review, validation & utilisation of data; Interprets business requirements and determines optimum BI solutions to meet needs; Ensure timely and accurate information of all reporting; Reviews test plans and monitors testing process to ensure that business results are tested; Ensure that the BI system is working to the satisfaction of the business; Provides input to standards, policies and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the BI tools and systems; Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials; Participates in implementation of BI applications / upgrades to the business.  The successful applicant will possess:  At least 3 years’ experience in BI development, implementation and support; Experience implementing systems as an analyst or key business user; Data modelling and data warehousing experience; Report and dashboard development (Cognos, Power BI, Tableau); Hands on experience with ETL tools (Infosphere DataStage, SSIS); A working knowledge of ERP systems (JD Edwards or similar); Experience in Microsoft Azure and Business intelligence stack; Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player; Capable of conducting training in small groups and one on one situations; Knowledge of relational databases, data warehousing principles and design; Industry experience with SQL, and Relational Databases (SQL Server).  Benefits at Bis In addition to a competitive salary, we provide job security with long-term (and long standing) existing customer contracts. Employee benefits also include:  Novated lease of motor vehicles Paid parental leave Bupa private health insurance corporate discounts Discounts on travel and accommodation (via Garuda Air & Crown Resorts) Corporate discounts with Hertz Australia for car rental Education assistance Employee referral programs (up to $2500) Exceptional delivery awards and service recognition awards  We are looking for people who are ready to get to work and share our company values of: Zero Harm, Unity, Passion, Excellence and Relationships.   We are your resources logistics company Bis is a mining services company who have been have been delivering logistics, materials handling, specialised equipment and consulting services to resource companies across Australia and Indonesia every day since 1915.  We find the best solutions and inventive ways to improve while looking after the health, safety and well-being of our people, the communities we operate in and our environment. Our strong team focus enables us to solve problems for our customers while also providing a unique culture that is built on the valued contribution our people make, every day.  We offer our people career opportunities, not just jobs.  We are committed to having diverse workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate by attracting, developing and retaining talented women and men of all ethnicities, ages, sexual orientations and abilities.

Accent Group Limited is the leading digitally integrated retail and distribution business in the Apparel and Footwear performance and lifestyle market in Australia and New Zealand. With over 700+ stores, 33 brands and over 35 online platforms. Our brands include; Glue, Platypus, Skechers, Hype DC, Vans, Dr. Martens, Subtype, The Athletes Foot, CAT, Merrell, The Trybe, Pivot, Timberland, Stylerunner, Palladium, Stance, Saucony, EXIE & 4Workers!
 
About the role:
We have an exciting role for an experienced Data Business Analyst. This is a great opportunity for an energetic and enthusiastic data analyst to be responsible for analysing and documenting data requirements, current and future state processes (involving data flows) and data test strategies, as well as undertaking other related duties required to assist with planning and implementing development pipelines within the Business Intelligence function.

What is in it for You?
A supportive, fun and friendly team culture - We work hard but have fun while we are at it!
The opportunity to work with a growing company and the best global brands
A State-of-the-Art custom built office space in Richmond close to the best bars, restaurants, cafes and major train Stations. We have a great culture in the office – we dress casually, work collaboratively and listen to curated playlists throughout!
Ongoing Career development and training – while we grow and transform!
Your responsibilities will include: 
Participate in all phases of the Business Intelligence, Data and Analytics development life cycle.
Work across business teams to assess new initiatives, gather requirements, preparing deliverables such as data flow diagrams, data requirements, detailed test cases and user guides.
Ownership and drive best practice for maintaining the business data mapping, data dictionary and data catalogue framework and artefacts.
Design, implement and validate reporting dashboards using visualisation tools (eg. PowerBI/ QlikSense).
Provide support to business users to troubleshoot and diagnose problems such as analysis of source data, cleansing and preparation of data sets.
Manage backlog of user and system issues through to resolution.
Elicit and document business rules and complete business process mapping where required.
Facilitate business stakeholder workshops for requirements gathering or business analysis activities as required.
Develop test plans, test cases and designs to ensure the appropriate testing of environment builds, interfaces and security are met.
To be successful you will have:
Demonstrated 5+ years of experience in a mixed skill set of BI Analyst, Data Specialist/BA with experience in SQL data warehouse environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to quickly build relationships and engage with business stakeholders to understand and deliver their requirements.
Knowledge or experience in data visualisation, report or dashboard design, or data analysis and reporting, performance reporting and monitoring.
Ability to think innovatively, analyse and conceptualise problems, convey ideas, concepts and issues, and formulate solutions in a clear, innovative and resourceful manner.
Proficiency with SQL queries.
Knowledge of retail metrics highly desirable.
Experience in ETL, data cleansing, data discovery and analytics tools.
Experience in MS Azure Data Warehouse, Data Lake and Data Factory desirable.
A result oriented and ownership mindset to drive deliverables and completion.
Demonstrated experience in breaking down complex problems and projects in manageable goals
Qlik Sense/PowerBI knowledge desirable

To achieve this, you will actively work with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements to meet business needs. You are a person who can empathise with the business to understand their “ask”. Your ability to think critically allows you to build data solutions that delivers what the business wants. You’re known for your ability to communicate and present technical information to business users of different levels. Your technical experience:ability to develop requirements into actionable business analytics strategies, roadmaps and data solutionsable to quickly build strong relationships with decision-makers and become their trusted advisoran expert in Power BI and SQL Serverhands-on experience across the Microsoft BI stack (SSRS / SSAS / SSIS)experience in the principles and processes involved in ETL from structured and non-structured data sourcessome experience creating user and systems documentation including flow diagrams What's on Offer You will build your data career in a leading Australian manufacturing business. Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions and has more than 20,000 employees across 50 countries and net sales of approximately 4.3bn USD. Hexagon’s Mining division is enabling an autonomous future through the delivery of an autonomous connected ecosystem in mines across the globe. We bring survey, geology, mine planning & design, fleet management, production optimization, collision avoidance and operator safety together in a life-of-mine solution that integrates people and processes. Our customers are safer and more productive through insight-driven decisions that sustainably captures more value from mining operations.  Enterprise Suite of Products Hexagon’s Enterprise portfolio is a data analytics hub that nurtures collaboration. It helps mines access, see downstream effects, and make decisions from operational technology data. It provides data visualization, accessibility, data analytics and reporting by connecting and structuring data from Planning, Operations, Safety and Drill & Blast systems.  The Role The Mine Enterprise portfolio is currently seeking an experienced Application Engineer to join their Perth based team on a permanent full-time basis. If you answer yes to the following questions, this might be the role for you:   Are passionate about data and unlocking its hidden value? Are you driven by successful customer adoption of technology to improve processes that generate a tangible return on investment? Have you had experience in creating business intelligence reporting that can be standardized across multiple customers? Major Areas of Responsibility  Within the position of Application Engineer, you would be the global champion for the suite of Mine Enterprise products to drive successful customer adoption and obtain customer return-on-investment. You are the voice of the customer and internal support teams and you will provide clear feedback to the software development team to better the solution for all customers. This position is responsible for driving customer adoption for the suite of solutions that deliver on a vision to connect data across the life-of-mine value chain. Skills and Experience Required We are looking for an individual with the following skills and experience:   Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering / Software Engineering, or related fields Proven experience within a similar position (software solution consulting) Good time management and ability to work with disparate teams  Prior experience with technology in the mining industry (planning, operations, drill & blast, safety). Global experience desirable Experience with Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and Microsoft SQL Server or Postgres Experience in the testing and validation of technology products and the development of training courses to assist internal lead experts. As an individual who can consolidate findings of software usage in-the-field across different customers, it is essential that you have the technical aptitude to interpret and respond to customer requirements, in addition to the soft skills to explain the benefits to management and sales teams. Customer Success  Provide technical sales assistance to regional teams including trials and demos Provide guidance on best practice use of Hexagon Mining products Primarily provide 2nd tier support to escalated requests from the regional service & support teams Attend customer sites and regional offices for technical knowledge transfer Assist with building key reference sites for our BI system in each region Provide global guidance for all major commercial deals including RFI and RFP’s. What’s on Offer Apart from a salary package that is commensurate with your skills and experience, you will also benefit from the following:  Personalized training and upskilling opportunities for career development for both technical and soft skills Work with a diverse, talented, multi-disciplinary team across the globe, gaining valuable skills and knowledge servicing some of the biggest names in the industry International and domestic travel to a variety of locations for client services Modern, well-appointed office space with a casual and friendly atmosphere Work life balance support Social events, team building activities, morning teas, quiz nights and more. Travel This position involves travel intrastate, interstate and overseas to support and deploy Hexagon Mining’s product in the field.    Language  Fluent English (written and verbal) is a pre-requisite. Spanish or Portuguese or other second language would be very favorable.

Job Title: Data and Reporting Analyst, Critical Communications
Description: INNOVATION thrives here  WHY BAI COMMUNICATIONS It's an exciting time to be part of BAI Communications. As a leading communications infrastructure provider, our technical excellence is sought after around the world. Building on our ground-breaking achievements, we continue to expand our operations, helping connect people, support communities and advance economies.  At BAI Communications, we keep Australians, from the cities to the outback, connected, and the significance of what we do is felt by everyone. Our critical communications team actively protect our sites and keep services on air. We work alongside authorities, to operate the NSW Government Radio Network and provide life-line communications to NSW Telco Authority emergency service providers who manage public safety. We are incredibly proud by the commitment, hard work and leadership our people show every day. Our trusted Field Service teams ensure continuity of our network. Our highly skilled Operators keep the public informed during times of crisis and react quickly to changing operational requirements of a demanding complex network. Our deep engineering, delivery and operational capability make us the partner of choice for the government and industry stakeholders alike.  During times of crisis, such as bushfire or cyclone season, our people travel from around the country to support this critical work. We care for our People. Volunteers for local Fire Service or State Emergency Services are provided with additional time off work at full pay for their volunteering activities. Hiring contractors fill gaps in our usual work and we are therefore always interested in hearing from people looking for permanent or casual work. We continue to develop world-class solutions for new and emerging technologies. As the third largest local government area in Australia and the fifth fastest growing region, the Moreton Bay Region boasts beautiful beaches and waterways, amazing manufacturing hubs and picturesque hinterland hamlets. Moreton Bay has a strong and connected community that enjoys all the traditional Jinibara, Kabi Kabi and Turrbal country has to offer within our region.
With a diverse workforce of more than 1900 team members dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 479,000 residents, each team member has an intrinsic ability to impact our community. Whether you’re a manager or working on the frontline, your role will make a difference - bring your expertise and join our driven team today.
This role sits within our Cultural Services Department, which includes Galleries, Heritage and Museums, Libraries, and Cultural Activation. Cultural Services aim to provide engaging leisure and learning experiences by connecting people to resources and each other. We strive for excellence when delivering exhibitions, information, collections, programs and spaces for our community and visitors. Our department employs approximately 220 staff over 16 venues throughout the region. 
About our opportunity
We have a brand-new opportunity for a passionate and savvy Business Intelligence Officer to provide high quality business and data analysis and intelligence within our Cultural Services team.
Ultimately, this position will play a pivotal role in transforming and developing our cultural service delivery across our region and within our branches of libraries, galleries and museums and cultural activation.
To achieve this, you will:

design, develop and implement innovative and appealing, user-friendly reports and dashboards to build data-literacy at all levels across the department
partner with business units to ensure that processes are reviewed (and documented) and turn information into insights that drive business performance;
provide advice on data management and reporting to ensure data integrity and reliability of reporting sources; and
further develop the department’s data sources and uses of Business Intelligence tools (programs and software)

This could include anything from reviewing and mapping a new process, conducting external research to assist leaders with strategic planning or implementing software that generates real-time and accessible insights and reports.
About you
You will be committed and driven to work and think smarter, using your business and data analysis skills and experience to promote cultural services opportunities.
As a must, you will be able to demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills, strong data visualisation skills and the ability to translate technical concepts into simple terms. Equally important to be considered, will be your IT skills and experience in data analytics and building Business Intelligence reporting platforms and dashboards.
You are one to embrace challenges with a positive attitude and be comfortable working towards deadlines and managing a variety of tasks in a busy work environment. Committed to providing a high level of customer service, you can foster and build strong relationships with business partners and stakeholders, whilst keeping and organisational mindset and doing what you do best!
Highly regarded, will be applicants who hold a tertiary qualification in Data Science (or similar field) and a Working with Children Blue Card.
Whether you are an emerging data analyst or an established business intelligence guru - this is a truly unique and rewarding opportunity you do not want to miss! Apply now!

At AIA we do things differently to make a healthy difference in people’s lives. That difference starts with every individual at AIA. We provide an environment and culture that helps our people live well and enjoy a meaningful life, at work and at home. We’re serious about helping people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. If you want to make a healthy difference everyday - for yourself and others - then we want to hear from you.


The opportunity

In this role, you will work in the business insights team to provide vital data- driven reports to help continuously develop the AIA business, nationally. You will liaise with varied stakeholders to create requirements, design, develop and implement reporting and dashboarding solutions across AIA Australia.  This role will also see you:

Influence and monitor key elements of the development and deployment life cycles of the reporting solution


Build and develop business intelligence reporting and dashboard solutions


Distill large volumes of data, information and complex concepts


Provide timely reporting and actionable insights to support the decision making and growth across AIA Australia


There are 3 permanent positions available and please note we are open to applications from Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.

To be successful in this position you will have:

Proven experience in data reporting and root cause analysis


Proficiency using Tableau dashboard development 


Previous experience in Insurance or Financial Services is a bonus


Strong verbal and written communication skills


Enthusiasm towards working in a fast-paced and cross-functional team environment


Demonstrable in programming (SQL, Alteryx, R) or database/data warehouse (MSSQL, SSIS) would be highly regarded

Why choose AIA:

At AIA, we’ve made a promise to help people live healthier, longer, better lives. And it starts with our own people.

Access our training and development to build on your current skills


Career development through internal mobility opportunities


Work for a business helping millions of Australian’s and make a difference to someone’s life everyday


Access additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself


Enjoy wonderful Health and Wellbeing initiatives that support you


Work with supportive and inclusive managers


Flexible working arrangements

Company: Department of Planning, Industry and Environment
Description:
Job Title | Analyst (Intelligence) (Environment Officer Class 9)
Employment Type: 2 Temporary roles up to 12 months  with the possibility of extension
What?s on Offer
As an Analyst Intelligence you?ll be:
?    Located at our 4PSQ Parramatta office
?    Earning between $108,841 ? $121,247 pa plus superannuation (dependent on qualifications, skills & experience)
?    Part of the greater NSW Department of Planning & Environment (NSW DPE) cluster
?    part of a world class organisation making a difference to the environment
?    Be part of an inclusive, dynamic and vibrant team culture
Environment Protection Authority Overview
The NSW Environment Protection Authority (EPA) is focused on being a world class regulator and on being the stewards of the environment.  We use all our regulatory tools to protect and enhance the environment we live in today and in the future.  We are responsive and adaptive and: 
?    take action to be the courageous voice of the environment, finding evidence and science-based solutions to some of our most formidable environmental challenges.
?    take a proactive and protective approach to ensure our land, air and water are future-proofed and enhanced for our children and generations to come.
Our mission is to create healthy environments, economies and communities so we can deliver together for the best living on the planet forever. 
EPA people are energised by our purpose and focus on the environment and are:
?    Purpose led making a meaningful difference to the environment, economy and communities delivering varied work and innovative outcome
?    Passionate and committed teams, who care, trust and collaborate to protect the environment and each other.
?    People focused ? We put people first creating a culture where everyone can be themselves, respecting and developing our diverse skills & aspirations and prioritising our safety and wellbeing.
The Opportunity 
Intelligence and Analysis Unit ? Intelligence Analyst role
The EPA Intelligence and Analysis Unit (IAU) leads the development of strategic, operational and tactical intelligence products that inform compliance campaigns, policy development, investigations and stakeholder interactions. As an Intelligence Analyst you will work closely with intelligence practitioners, clients and government partners to provide timely, accurate and readily available intelligence support. Working in a small and motivated team, you will apply an intelligence skillset to key problem areas and identify targeted and effective options for decision-makers to act on. The Intelligence Analyst will also have input into the strategies, policies and governance practices that guide the EPA?s intelligence capability.
Waste Crime Taskforce ? Intelligence Analyst role
The Waste Crime Taskforce (WCT) sits within the EPA?s Major Compliance and Investigation Branch and investigates serious and/or high profile organised waste crime offences with a view to prosecution and plans and executes proactive compliance campaigns and other operations in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to prevent and disrupt waste crime. The WCT is a multi-skilled team of investigators, lawyers, an intelligence analyst and an operational officer.
The WCT Analyst (Intelligence) provides high quality tactical and operational intelligence advice, assessments and reports to the Chief Investigator and Principal Investigators in support of investigations, compliance campaigns and other operations.  
For more information about this exciting opportunity, click here to view the role description - Ananlyst Intelligence
About you 
Knowledge and understanding of the intelligence cycle and ability to apply it to the issues faced by the NSW EPA.
Understanding and extensive experience of tactical and operational intelligence and ability to apply intelligence concepts.
Ability to prepare intelligence assessments and reports. 
Knowledge of environmental protection policy and related legislation.
Why work for us?? 
Exciting career pathways and opportunities:? 
We offer vibrant and exciting career paths for people from a wide range of backgrounds and skills. Once you?join the?NSW Government, you?ll be supported to develop your skills and expertise through ongoing training, and opportunities to move easily from role to role, and agency to agency across the entire NSW government.? 
 
We provide a safe, supportive, ethical, diverse and inclusive workplace for our people is one of our priorities. We run a variety of programs and provide a range of supporting resources to ensure the wellbeing of all our people.? 
To apply, please submit an updated CV (max 5 pages) and Cover Letter (max 2 pages) outlining your relevant experience and capabilities. 
For further information about the WCT Intelligence Analyst role, please contact Amanda Kelly on Amanda.Kelly@epa.nsw.gov.au or 02 8275 1678
For further information about the I&AU Intelligence Analyst role, please contact Kate Hey-Cunningham on Kate.HeyCunningham@epa.nsw.gov.au or 02 9995 6012.

We’re digital only, and harness the capabilities of technology, data and artificial intelligence to deliver an entire bank in the palm of your hand. We exist solely to serve our customers - to give them a smarter, more personalised banking experience. We are constantly adapting and evolving to help customers make better, more informed financial decisions. We do things in real time, to bring real value to their lives. We put them first.   And we do this every second, of every minute, of every day.   All 86,400 of them. define and document business logic and map data from divergent source systems  Work with external stakeholders, project teams and internal SME’s to effectively document requirements, business rules and SLAs in a consistent fashion  Influence projects to reduce their impact on data and perform monitoring and reconciliations during key releases/migrations  Track and report measures of data quality to inform and drive behaviours across all business units  Develop data quality assets such as master data, reference data, dashboards, monitoring, profiling, business glossaries and lineage  Coordinate overall project delivery using elements of the agile methodology, including support for test planning and execution  Play an active role in reducing risk of potential privacy issues and perform related root cause analysis to support and advise during incident resolution     WHAT MAKES YOU TICK    A blank page doesn’t scare you – you focus on solutions even when faced with ambiguity  You have a knack for translating, be it between technical and non-technical teams, different departments or businesses  You take the time to identify potential ‘gotchas’ early to avoid delays/blockers at a late-stage  You’re a strong communicator able to build collaborative relationships quickly  A pragmatic approach to delivery, with a focus on balancing tight delivery expectations with high-quality outcomes     WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO 86 400   Essential:   5+ years' proven experience in a business/system analyst or data governance role  Proven ability to work in a fast pace, agile environment, working collaboratively with cross functional teams  Strong communications (technical and business), negotiations, problem solving and stakeholder management skills  Project management experience; both working with larger project teams and leading strategic initiatives  Strong skills with Jira & Confluence and an ability to manage competing deliverables  Familiarity with data modelling and warehouse concepts  Proven SQL, data analysis and data profiling skills   Desired:   A background in financial services  A background in data, technology or automated reporting solutions     VALUES. EVERY SECOND   Customer. Customer. Customer - We put the customer’s best interests at the forefront of everything we do. We believe financial success will follow customer success.  Agile and Brave - Constantly collaborating in new ways to create something genuinely innovative.  Value Each Other - We respect everyone’s contribution, embracing a common goal and championing individuality.  Frank and Authentic - A high performing team who say what we mean and mean what we say to create a strong team culture.  Show Up - We bring our passion, positivity and sense of fun every day to embrace the challenges of changing the banking game. MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it.
Our Purpose
MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide almost 1.2 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.
Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers, partners and each other that defines who we are. 
Our Strategy
Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all of us to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. 
With more than 1500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.
The Role
Reporting to the Manager of Information Architecture & Data Modelling, the Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for leading business requirements activities to augment our Data Warehouse footprint. 
This role will see you create detailed business analysis documents while outlining problems and finding solutions for business data problems. Additionally, you will identify and prioritise functional and non-functional requirements as well as liaising with business users to obtain feedback and approval. You will create specifications to map sources to target and work closely with data modellers to represent requirements as data models and engage with PowerBI developers to ensure accurate visualisation of data requirements.
You will use your demonstrated Business Analyst skills to navigate a new data environment through coordination, planning and conflict resolution to ensure overall team success.
About You
A seasoned Business Analyst with 3+ years experience with a focus on data warehousing and/or advanced analytics projects and with excellent verbal and written communication skills.  
You have proven experience in the usage of business analyst techniques including; elicitation, documentation, interviewing techniques, conducting workshops, process mapping, gap analysis, traceability and business scenarios.
Lastly, your strong understanding of regulatory and reporting requirements coupled with your ability to forecast, budget and provide financial analysis will see you succeed in this role. 
Why Choose Us?
At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:
work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality
enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution
embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer
access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents
access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and
wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.
 
Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position.

Now boarding: Your career in travel is ready for take-off.Corporate Travel Management (CTM) is undergoing an exciting period of growth as worldwide travel returns. If you're ready to embark on a career with a global leader in business travel, we want to hear from you.The global health crisis has provided an opportunity for change in the travel industry. Headquartered and founded in Australia, CTM has offices all around the world, including Australia, Asia, North America, Europe, and New Zealand.ABOUT THE ROLEThe ANZ Supplier Relations analyst role sits within the Planning & Reporting Team - in the national finance department. The position requires interaction with the highest level of management in the business, closely aligned to and working with the Supplier Relations Team providing detailed support & analysis regarding the supplier performance, planning and financial opportunity of the business. The role will support key department heads drive business improvement through the identification, recommendation and implementation of value adding initiatives & analysis. This is a critical position within the Supplier Relations team to drive and optimize CTM's supplier revenues primarily in the Australia and New Zealand region. The position will track and analyse airline, accommodation, transport and other supplier sales and metrics, provide supplier performance reporting, ad-hoc analysis, forecasting, and guidance to supplier owners and other business colleagues. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES* Managing and maintaining all supplier worksheets, trends, analysis, and overrides calculations.* Prepare monthly journals for the financial accounting team. Including tracking and analysing air, accommodation, and transport sales performance across the ANZ business and assist with other regions as required.* Provide analytical support for contract negotiations, business reviews, budgeting, and forecasts to management* Prepare financial models to support strategic planning activities including business planning, budgeting & forecasting of overrides* Conduct required research and collect data to complete financial modelling to support new contracts and understand impacts to the business.* Identify, size, and prioritize opportunities according to revenue potential, making recommendations relating to key projects* Develop a deep understanding of the Travel industry, the market, supply economics, and CTM's value proposition for travellers and suppliers* Support the Head of Supplier Relations Manager and supplier team regarding contract management and negotiations, detailed operational and financial analysis to ensure that CTM is optimising revenue and maximising its relationships with our external partners.* Provide analytical support for contract negotiations* Maintaining, updating and preparing Airline Deal Analysis Model and Analysis for new and existing clients* Preparing Quarterly and mid-quarterly benchmarking industry analysis reports* Providing financial analysis support on business initiatives and general financial commercial insight to the business* Ability to develop, design, build, create, maintain, and edit various reports within CTM's internal reporting software - Business Intelligence - SAP / Power BI to meet the needs of the business and senior managers.* Provide support and cross-training, leave coverage with the broader Planning and Reporting Team.* Ad-hoc reporting and relevant project support as required. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE* General understanding of the key concepts of business analysis and the related tools; Including BI-SAP or Power BI* Prepare financial models to support strategic planning activities* Demonstrated experience in undertaking detailed analysis and financial modelling* Demonstrated experience in contributing to business planning, budgeting & forecasting* Good Analytics and IT skills - proficiency in MS Office suite (Intermediate to advanced Excel skills)* Good research, quantitative, and analytical skills* Ability to prioritize task, multitask, and work in a fast-paced environment* Ability to think through and solve complex problems* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Able to communicate to all levels within the business.* Good time management and organisational skills and the ability to meet strict deadlines and prioritise own work* You are a team player who is committed to working with your peers.* Thorough, accurate and an excellent attention to detailIf you're considering a career in travel, or a return to the travel industry, CTM is your number one choice.Come and experience firsthand why CTM is recognised as a leading travel management company and technology innovator across the world.Your career in corporate travel is ready for take-off. Get on board today.APPLICATION PROCESSS.Please note, the online application process consists of two steps:1) Apply through SeekOnce submitted you will be sent 2 system generated emails, the first will be from Seek. The second will be from CTM Recruitment (if it does not arrive in your inbox, please check your Junk folder). 2) Follow the instructions in the email to finish your full application

As the third largest local government area in Australia and the fifth fastest growing region, the Moreton Bay Region boasts beautiful beaches and waterways, amazing manufacturing hubs and picturesque hinterland hamlets. Moreton Bay has a strong and connected community that enjoys all the traditional Jinibara, Kabi Kabi and Turrbal country has to offer within our region.
With a diverse workforce of more than 1900 team members dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 479,000 residents, each team member has an intrinsic ability to impact our community. Whether you’re a manager or working on the frontline, your role will make a difference - bring your expertise and join our driven team today.
This role sits within our Cultural Services Department, which includes Galleries, Heritage and Museums, Libraries, and Cultural Activation. Cultural Services aim to provide engaging leisure and learning experiences by connecting people to resources and each other. We strive for excellence when delivering exhibitions, information, collections, programs and spaces for our community and visitors. Our department employs approximately 220 staff over 16 venues throughout the region. 
About our opportunity
We have a brand-new opportunity for a passionate and savvy Business Intelligence Officer to provide high quality business and data analysis and intelligence within our Cultural Services team.
Ultimately, this position will play a pivotal role in transforming and developing our cultural service delivery across our region and within our branches of libraries, galleries and museums and cultural activation.
To achieve this, you will:

design, develop and implement innovative and appealing, user-friendly reports and dashboards to build data-literacy at all levels across the department
partner with business units to ensure that processes are reviewed (and documented) and turn information into insights that drive business performance;
provide advice on data management and reporting to ensure data integrity and reliability of reporting sources; and
further develop the department’s data sources and uses of Business Intelligence tools (programs and software)

This could include anything from reviewing and mapping a new process, conducting external research to assist leaders with strategic planning or implementing software that generates real-time and accessible insights and reports.
About you
You will be committed and driven to work and think smarter, using your business and data analysis skills and experience to promote cultural services opportunities.
As a must, you will be able to demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills, strong data visualisation skills and the ability to translate technical concepts into simple terms. Equally important to be considered, will be your IT skills and experience in data analytics and building Business Intelligence reporting platforms and dashboards.
You are one to embrace challenges with a positive attitude and be comfortable working towards deadlines and managing a variety of tasks in a busy work environment. Committed to providing a high level of customer service, you can foster and build strong relationships with business partners and stakeholders, whilst keeping and organisational mindset and doing what you do best!
Highly regarded, will be applicants who hold a tertiary qualification in Data Science (or similar field) and a Working with Children Blue Card.
Whether you are an emerging data analyst or an established business intelligence guru - this is a truly unique and rewarding opportunity you do not want to miss! Apply now! 
The Details
Term: Permanent Full Time
Award/Level:  Qld Local Government Industry Award (Stream A) - Level 5 of the Moreton Bay Regional Council EBA4 Certified Agreement
Location:  North Lakes Library

$84,340 pa + super (up to 12%) + leave loading
72.5 hour fortnight
9 day fortnight

Discounted Health Insurance.

We are proud to offer opportunities to develop your career within a local government organisation and our team members are encouraged to undertake study for career development in their area of employment under our Study, Training & Research Scheme (STARS).
Generous employer and employee super contribution scheme.
Salary packaging options on novated leases, superannuation payments, smartphones and devices.

There are thousands of graduates in the market, stand out from the crowd. Technology is transforming all our lives – developments in robotics, automation, artificial intelligence and big data are creating the careers of the future. Digital careers need intelligent, analytical minds, people who want to make a difference; graduates who desire to be at the forefront of change. Regardless of your degree subject, we believe all graduates possess the skills to fuel an exciting career in technology. FDM offers numerous career paths for you to choose, and that’s why in 2019, we launched the careers of over 2,100 graduates. FDM Group is a FTSE 250 employer with a global footprint working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations such as KPMG Australian Services Pty Ltd and Macquarie Group. You will receive fully-funded training before being placed on-site with one or more of our clients in Australia for a minimum of two years. After the two years, you can remain with FDM or you may have the opportunity to transition to an in house role at FDM or to carry on working with the client as a member of their permanent team.   Why choose a career within Business Intelligence? Working as a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will be responsible for helping businesses harness their valuable data to identify new opportunities and spot trends. You will work to understand what processes are performed, gather user requirements and create specifications for the business to make informed decisions for development. The FDM Business Intelligence Graduate Program offers you the opportunity to kick-start your career and benefit from expert training, as well as exclusive placements working as an FDM Consultant with our industry-leading clients. After training, you will have the opportunity to apply your new skills working on cutting-edge client projects. This could see you taking on large-scale migrations to modernise global business data or tackling Python data analytics for e-commerce giants. We provide a comprehensive support network for all our consultants and offer professional development and wellbeing support throughout their journey with us, both during training and working on client sites.   How is the program structured? Your journey as a BI Consultant will begin with receive fully-funded training and the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout. Our award-winning Graduate Program provides a wealth of opportunity to gain transferable skills as well as becoming an expert within your field. After successfully completing your training, you will work with one or more of our clients in Australia during the two-year program.   What will I be doing? About Alinta Energy:
At Alinta Energy, we’re constantly striving to do better. Whether it’s lowering customers costs, providing world class local service or sustainable energy, our aim is to be better. And to keep getting better day after day. Better for our customers. Better for Australia. And better for our environment.
It’s an exciting time to become a part of our growing team at Alinta Energy. Our people are our greatest asset and we’re committed to a culture that’s focussed on being better at providing great service externally and internally. An organisation where people truly matter. That’s better.
We’re a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of 3,000MW, over 1 million combined electricity and gas retail customers, and around 1,000 employees across Australia and New Zealand. Supplying energy in Australia for over 20 years, today we’re a vertically integrated energy company providing generation, retail and wholesale supply of gas and electricity across Australia. We support the development of renewable energy generation and offer local customer service through support hubs in Perth, Western Australia and Morwell in Victoria.
About the role:
We are looking for a BI Visualisation Specialist to join our collaborative and innovative Data & Analytics team, reporting to the BI Operations and Support Manager. As a valued member of the team, you will work on building out the new Azure-hosted data and analytics environment leveraging the best in class BI tools (Tableau, Power BI and Databricks).
This role will involve participating in the delivery of projects across Retail, Trading, Power Generation, IT and Corporate lines of business. Gaining an understanding of business process and developing solutions to meet the business outcomes.
Additional responsibilities will include:

Be responsible for the design, build and run of BI assets, such as reports and data extracts
Assisting with solutions design to meet business, technical and user requirements
Use a flexible array of BI toolsets (Power BI, Tableau)
Be involved with the Alinta Analytics / Data Science Community of Practice
Lead or facilitate user acceptance test and drive it to completion
Support the administration of Data & Analytics environments and BI assets

To be successful you will have:

Experience working with Data Visualisation or BI toolsets – Tableau and Power BI will be highly regarded
Experience developing, managing, optimising SQL queries and relational databases
Good communication skills, both written and verbal, directed to end-users/consumers, technical teams, and management at all levels in the organisation
Developed technical specification writing/documentation skills
Ability to quickly understand business processes and data to translate into meaningful insights
Ability to work effectively either independently or collaboratively in immediate or cross-functional teams

The role would be suited to an individual with a SQL background and someone with hands-on experience with BI toolsets and working with relational databases.
Working at Alinta Energy you will have access to a range of benefits, such as:

Flexible work options for most roles where you can work a combination of days from the office and from home
Staff Energy Offer (where products are available)
Employee Referral Bonus
Salary Packaging options
Full access to Headspace Application
Salary continuance insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Purchased leave
Community volunteer leave
