Senior Tech Business Analyst- Analytics  
WIB - Treasury Technology
Sydney based, Max term role
How will I help?
As a Senior BA, working with Group Treasury, your main role will focus on Treasury Front Office’s Qlik Sense self-service analytics platform that integrates with existing Treasury data assets, thus extending data capabilities, and empowering Treasury to undertake data analytics of the Group's balance sheet at a customer account level.
What you will do
Engage with business owners and relevant stakeholders to elicit business needs
Generate artefacts to document business needs, issues and outcomes including user stories and business requirement documents, stakeholder mapping, data flows, process mapping and data catalogues. 
Actively participate in all phases of the project including analysis, design, development, testing, user training, change management and implementation.
Rapidly acquire working knowledge of customer’s internal line-of-business systems
Define data element requirements including history, timeliness and frequency of data
Design the technical data mappings from source to target including transformation rules
Eliciting business requirements through stakeholder engagement.
Delivering technical specifications for the scrum team.
Identifying issues and opportunities relating to the performance of the application.
Data and systems analysis including: Identifying new sources of data to meet business requirements, defining business rules, solving data integrity issues, Contributing towards data simplification and consolidation initiatives.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need? 
Minimum 5 years of Data BA or Technical BA experience
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Excel with VBA and other Microsoft Office applications
Experience with data visualisation tools like Power BI / Tableau
Experience in Qlik Sense and QlikView is highly desirable
Extensive experience of delivering high quality analysis outcomes & successful projects and building relationships & managing a diverse range of stakeholders with different objectives. 
Experience working in Agile / Scrum teams
In depth knowledge of Treasury & Investment Banking products and Risk measurement. 
Experience of working in Institutional Banking project is preferred 
Banking experience (esp. Treasury) is ideal

What is it like to work there?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work.  As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

Job Title: Data analyst / engineer - zero emission vehicles
Description: Can you help accelerate the transition to electric vehicles, hydrogen, and greener fleets using your data skills and insights?If so, let's talk. We are a small consultancy with big ideas and a purpose. Our mission is to make transport better for people, better for the environment, and better for the economy. We’re seeking someone special who understands this and can turn it into practical advice for our clients.About you...  You are passionate about sustainability and you can analyse and present data and research in a compelling way to drive decisions. You're interested in cars, trucks, fuels, energy or technology (ideally, a combination).  You may be a data analyst or engineer looking to crunch the numbers to shape the future. Or you might be from another technical area or advisory role with recent experience or knowledge of electric and low emission vehicles.  You must be a clear and convincing communicator, with solid data analysis skills, and an ability to translate the results into high quality reports and presentations. This includes researching and reviewing relevant literature.  The Role... We are a small team so you need to be comfortable doing multiple and diverse tasks, but your core work will be to:  Research public information sources for relevant dataAnalyse, model, and present data in a structured and convincing way for different audiencesDevelop data models to analyse datasets, develop projections, run scenarios, and present data using visual platforms (such as Power BI)Be as comfortable working with dollars as with litres, kilowatts or tonnes CO2Communicate the results and insights from your work (written and verbal)Manage, evaluate, and report on commercial trials of new fuels and technologies (electric, hydrogen, biofuels, etc.)Track and manage projects and deliverablesPrevious experience in an advisory role (especially in transport / logistics / fleet / auto / sustainability sectors) would be highly regarded.Why us?  We're on a mission to transform transport. Job Title: Data and Reporting Analyst, Critical Communications
Description: INNOVATION thrives here  WHY BAI COMMUNICATIONS It's an exciting time to be part of BAI Communications. As a leading communications infrastructure provider, our technical excellence is sought after around the world. Building on our ground-breaking achievements, we continue to expand our operations, helping connect people, support communities and advance economies.  At BAI Communications, we keep Australians, from the cities to the outback, connected, and the significance of what we do is felt by everyone. Our critical communications team actively protect our sites and keep services on air. We work alongside authorities, to operate the NSW Government Radio Network and provide life-line communications to NSW Telco Authority emergency service providers who manage public safety. We are incredibly proud by the commitment, hard work and leadership our people show every day. Our trusted Field Service teams ensure continuity of our network. Our highly skilled Operators keep the public informed during times of crisis and react quickly to changing operational requirements of a demanding complex network. Our deep engineering, delivery and operational capability make us the partner of choice for the government and industry stakeholders alike.  During times of crisis, such as bushfire or cyclone season, our people travel from around the country to support this critical work. We care for our People. Volunteers for local Fire Service or State Emergency Services are provided with additional time off work at full pay for their volunteering activities. Hiring contractors fill gaps in our usual work and we are therefore always interested in hearing from people looking for permanent or casual work. We continue to develop world-class solutions for new and emerging technologies. This includes planning for future network improvements which allow our customers to take advantage of technology innovation.   ABOUT THE ROLE Reporting Analytics plays a key role within the Critical Comms team, sourcing, analysing and reporting on key information and data to help drive critical business decisions. The Data & Reporting Analyst will be responsible for initially building contractual reporting and on an ongoing basis working collaboratively within Critical Communications (business and technology stakeholders) to elicit, analyse, translate, and document business requirements into specifications that will allow for the development of BI reporting.  Primary ResponsibilitiesDefining and Developing reporting requirements to meet contractual deliverables, building and agreeing the reports with key Stakeholders internally as well as with the CustomerConverting requirements into logic to build and develop reports with clear traceability to initial requirement.Collecting, collating and interpreting information for the creation of reports to enable sound business and strategic decision makingDrive the analysis and delivery of new or modified product features through collaboration with business SME's, architects, suppliers, and technology specialistsDisseminating intelligence obtained from this informationProviding recommendations to stakeholders based on this intelligenceProvide statistical information when requiredLiaise with the Operations, Engineering and Customer Teams to understand and translate data requirements into valuable reportsSupporting Operational cadence reporting - weekly, monthly, quarterly and annuallyWork with stakeholders to develop and maintain a roadmap of enhancements and contribute to the CSIPDocument procedures and provide training for the management of business intelligence informationMaintain and develop working relationships across BAIUtilising intelligence applications and information systems   ABOUT YOUThis is a great next step for someone who loves data and has worked within transitionExperience in developing Service Now reports is essentialDo you have a gift of translating Geek Speak?Create, Develop and run reports in Power BI/Tableau (Microsoft SSRS and analytics (reporting, predictive, prescriptive) experience is requiredRelevant experience and understanding of user needs of information and communication technologies and systemsExperience in conducting workshops to extract information and provide trainingExperience and skills in presenting and pitching solutionsTechnical qualifications in SQL, Power BI/Tableau, Microsoft SSRS and analytics (reporting, predictive, prescriptive idealTableau knowledge/experience will be advantageousExperience in Telecommunications and/or Critical Communications will be well regardedDue to Baseline vetting requirements, you MUST be an Australian Citizen to be considered for this role.   WHY WORK WITH US? Large enough to deliver and maintain large-scale operations, we remain nimble to make things happen. Be part of an inclusive culture where diverse ideas are embraced and people feel connected and cared for. Enjoy the opportunity to learn and grow alongside talented colleagues who thrive on solving complex problems. Be trusted and empowered to deliver your best and make a positive impact on customers and communities.  Ready to learn, grow and make a difference? Join us at BAI Communications. Job Title: Intelligence Analyst - Systems Operator (No Experience Required)
Description: Your role:As an Intelligence Analyst – System Operator (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Systems Operators) your role supports classified Government intelligence programs by analysing signal transmissions; and informing tactical and military advantage both at sea and ashore. This diverse and mentally stimulating role encompasses a range of specialist skills that support intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance activities. You’ll use sophisticated, state-of-the-art search receivers and other complex equipment to intercept, record, analyse and disseminate the intelligence of signal transmissions. Teamwork is an important part of the role. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel; all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.As an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator, you will receive training in the  following areas:- Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving,- Communications theory and networks,- Methods for working with intelligence information,- Preparation and presentation of intelligence briefs, and,- Provide advice to Commanders and other audiences as required. Prior experience isn’t needed. You’ll gain all the necessary skills and qualifications to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator as part of your training. Although, it is worth noting that successful Operators typically have a sound background in mathematics and are comfortable with the fundamentals of physics.Life in the Navy: A career in the Navy is challenging and highly rewarding, and comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment. Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters. Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be stationed locally not too far from home. Salary: Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package from $75,625 including service and uniform allowances. You will also receive a Maritime Allowance when serving on ships. In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.Apply Now: For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English, Maths and Science (physics is preferable).Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/intelligence-analyst-systems-operatorThe Australian Defence Force is an equal opportunity employer. This advertisement is to ensure women are aware of the rewarding and fulfilling careers available in the Navy, Army and Air Force. Females are encouraged to apply, however all roles are open for Australian men and women to apply.

The Role
The purpose of the Senior Insights & Reporting Analyst is to deliver valuable insights from data and risk reporting to the Bank business. 
In addition to this, the Senior Insights & Reporting Analyst will strive to continually simplify and challenge the reporting suite and delivery methods to add value to the Business. This role supports Banking and cross function working groups to ensure effective consultation for the design and delivery of reporting solutions, ensuring alignment with BEAR accountabilities for the function.
The Senior Insights & Reporting Analyst is accountable for ensuring deliverables align with both Group and Banking Policies, Frameworks and Standards, whilst ensuring solutions support Banking’s compliance with regulatory requirements.
Key Accountabilities 

Analysing data to provide value add insights to improve management of operational risks, obligations and compliance risks for the Bank
Design and maintain non-financial risk reporting and reports for the Bank including recommending risk ratings for the CEO profile based on analysis and insights of key data and business trends
Challenge and simplify existing reporting solutions and non-financial risk reporting
Develop, deliver, and implement dynamic operational risk and compliance KRI metric solutions to support Banking teams with monitoring and managing trends and results
Implement automated solutions where possible to reduce cost to Banking teams and ensure an improved customer experience
Providing training and support for reporting solutions and reporting governance created within the team, and to Banking teams as required
Work with key stakeholders to build knowledge and maturity of robust governance practices
Assisting, coaching, and upskilling Reporting Analysts within the team
Complete ad-hoc work as required to support the delivery of Banking strategic objectives

Key Job Requirements
Qualifications

Relevant degree in Business, Technology, or related field - desired

Experience

3+ years’ experience in banking or financial services with a strong focus on reporting, risk, and compliance
Experience managing stakeholders
Experience using Suncorp Policies, Frameworks and Standards

Key Capabilities/Technical Competencies

Excellent stakeholder management – develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders applying fit for purpose engagement models
Highly analytical – use information to identify key issues, compare data and draw insights
Excellent problem solving – seek out information, breaking down problems into simple components to develop pragmatic solutions
Strong communication – convey and explain information, coherently and confidently both oral and written
Strategic planning /critical thinking – facilitate the development of innovative solutions to complex business problems
High attention to detail – ensure data quality and accuracy
Proficient technical skills – working understanding of Excel, Tableau, Cognos, and dashboard management
Advanced reporting and data visualization – analyse and convey data across non-financial risk, compliance and governance to drive insights

About the role -

The approach you will be taking to development and delivery will be a mixture of Agile and Rapid-Prototyping. However final deliverables to satisfy major regulatory requirements will comply to strict governance criteria. You will work with the relevant Legal and Compliance SMEs who will assist you ensure cross-functional due-diligence requirements are met and reconciliation match expectations.

Good understanding of data aggregation and ability to translate one model to another model (e.g. Power BI to Alteryx or Alteryx to SQL)

 

Excellent understanding and proven ability to use one or more of the following:

SQL
R
PowerBI(DAX)




Excellent communication and presentation skills

 

Strong analytical skills
Regulatory experience 

 

Ability to manage multiple stakeholders at all levels

 

Ability to identify and eliminate non-value adding activities

 
 
Desirable
 
•      Financial services experience, especially valued would be Life Insurance knowledge
 
•      Demonstrable ability and attributes such as; assertiveness, resilience, and flexibility in times of change.
 
•       Experience with business intelligence platforms including Alteryx, Power BI  and Tableau

We are working with a market leader in the Financial space, our client has continually won award for their culture, work life balance, and career growth. This is an incredibly exciting role, as there is a wide variety and chance to work in some of the biggest business critical projects within the brand. This doesn't include the competitive salary and opportunity to be apart of something new!

There are thousands of graduates in the market, stand out from the crowd. Technology is transforming all our lives – developments in robotics, automation, artificial intelligence and big data are creating the careers of the future. Digital careers need intelligent, analytical minds, people who want to make a difference; graduates who desire to be at the forefront of change. Regardless of your degree subject, we believe all graduates possess the skills to fuel an exciting career in technology. FDM offers numerous career paths for you to choose, and that’s why in 2019, we launched the careers of over 2,100 graduates. FDM Group is a FTSE 250 employer with a global footprint working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations such as KPMG Australian Services Pty Ltd and Macquarie Group. You will receive fully-funded training before being placed on-site with one or more of our clients in Australia for a minimum of two years. After the two years, you can remain with FDM or you may have the opportunity to transition to an in house role at FDM or to carry on working with the client as a member of their permanent team.   Why choose a career within Business Intelligence? Working as a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will be responsible for helping businesses harness their valuable data to identify new opportunities and spot trends. You will work to understand what processes are performed, gather user requirements and create specifications for the business to make informed decisions for development. The FDM Business Intelligence Graduate Program offers you the opportunity to kick-start your career and benefit from expert training, as well as exclusive placements working as an FDM Consultant with our industry-leading clients. After training, you will have the opportunity to apply your new skills working on cutting-edge client projects. This could see you taking on large-scale migrations to modernise global business data or tackling Python data analytics for e-commerce giants. We provide a comprehensive support network for all our consultants and offer professional development and wellbeing support throughout their journey with us, both during training and working on client sites.   How is the program structured? Your journey as a BI Consultant will begin with receive fully-funded training and the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout. Our award-winning Graduate Program provides a wealth of opportunity to gain transferable skills as well as becoming an expert within your field. After successfully completing your training, you will work with one or more of our clients in Australia during the two-year program.   What will I be doing? FDM’s Business Intelligence Program will train you to become an expert at developing strategies to help businesses gain and maintain competitive advantage through the use of data. You will learn how to design and develop analytics tools and platforms to analyse data essential to ensuring that businesses function efficiently. BI technologies provide historical, current and predictive views of business operations with the aim of creating a simpler interpretation of big data, identify opportunities and improve strategies for long-term organisational stability.   What we are looking for:  Bachelor’s degree Analytical skills Excellent communication skills and ability to build relationships Ability to meet deadlines effectively Big ambitions to succeed within the IT industry Eligible to work in Australia (citizen/permanent resident) Geographically flexible throughout Sydney and Melbourne to support our clients   What we offer you:  Fully-funded industry recognised training and qualifications Key skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and Microsoft Excel A foot in the door to some of the world’s most reputable organisations Mentoring and on-going support throughout your entire FDM journey Modern and central training academies Social events and networking   Whether you’ve been studying for a role in the technology industry or not, we have exciting opportunities available for you. We have multiple start dates all year round, so why not make an application today? Click to apply for the FDM graduate program. Marketing Data Analyst

Permanent role
Flexible location

About the role
The Marketing Science Analyst should help shape strategic marketing agenda by supporting the Marketing Science Lead and Marketing Science Operations Lead in generating and delivering insightful analysis highlighting potential opportunities to deliver growth, maximise ROI and connect marketing performance with business outcomes.
The Marketing Science Analyst will play a key role across the marketing science value chain in processing data for analysis, building models, and creating presentations that communicate impactful insights and putting forward actionable recommendations to marketing stakeholders.
Key Duties

Development of innovative and proactive marketing performance insights using expertise in data mining and analysis tools.
Unify analytics with business acumen to partner with internal stakeholders to work through challenging marketing planning decisions and unique business questions
Responsible for developing models and tools, identifying and creating models to help understand, monitor, and predict marketing outcomes. Eg. Make and optimize budget, channel and media mix decisions, understand the impact of a marketing activity on sales, forecast the impact of budgeting, brand and competitor activity on business outcomes.
Harmonise, process, and analyse data to develop presentations which address marketing & business challenges
Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines
Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of solving complex business problems. Collaborate with internal & external partners to help develop new tools and capabilities
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key management groups particularly Technology, Customer & Market Insights, Finance and Portfolio teams.  
Support the maintenance and improvement of processes used to collect, retrieve, and interpret data.
Handle large and complex marketing data using different applications.
You will be expected to work closely with marketing teams to help them understand the impact of decisions on potential results and to generate unique insights that ‘solve the puzzle’ of what drives performance.
Establish strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders and agencies identifying shared goals, removing blockages, and enabling collaboration.
Manage stakeholder expectations and act as an advocate for marketing science practices.

About You

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Actuarial Studies, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)
1-2 years of experience with marketing mix modelling, digital media analysis, business focused analytics, advertising effectiveness analysis, quantitative market research or other related client insights experience.
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel; other tools such as SQL & R a plus but not required.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience working independently to identify themes across data points and the ability to communicate a story with the data.
Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics.
An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions.
The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally.
Strong verbal and written communication skills suitable for audiences all at levels of the business (Brand Managers, EGMs, CEOs, Board).

Technical Competencies

Graduate in marketing or computer science
Strong numeracy and analytical skills
Demonstrated experience using data mining tools
Passion for data interpretation and optimisation
Experience with relational databases and analysing large quantities of marketing data
Exposure to Dashboard development desired
Team player, creative and passionate
Ability to multi-task while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail and organization
Outstanding presentation and communication skills
Comfort dealing with large amounts of data on a regular basis
Evidence of using and applying data to aid decision making and analysis
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast-changing environment
Demonstrated ability to work independently in processing data and communicating insights.
Experience with tag management platforms, Excel, APIs, etc. will be highly regarded.

Avant is Australia’s leading medical defence organisation with a proud heritage of protecting Australian medical professionals for over 125 years.
Avant now represents 80,000 health practitioners and medical students across every state and territory, delivering market leading products and services to meet their professional, personal and practice needs. Building on this heritage, our vision is to be the most trusted professional partner in supporting doctors throughout their lives and careers.
Being a mutual organisation, owned by members and run purely for their benefit, our members are at the centre of all we do. As well as providing products and services to our member, we play a broader community role by advocating for improvements in the healthcare system and in quality, safety and professionalism in medicine, through delivering education and research activities.
The position
As a Business Intelligence Specialist at Avant, you’ll be joining the Enterprise Information Management (EIM) team within the Group Technology Services (GTS), responsible for helping our business get the most value out of their data. You will be the Qlik Sense guru and data modelling hero that enables our business to conquer the last mile of analytics.
Avant highly values data analytics and we have recently invested a great effort in designing and implementing a state-of-the-art data platform. In this role, you’ll help us extract valuable insights from our data. Using DBT (Data Build Tool) on Snowflake, you model our datasets into the context of our business areas. With your partnering skills, you are able to extract business requirements and translate them into data models and Qlik Sense apps that help our data tell its story. At the end of the day, our stakeholders can make data-driven decisions thanks to your hard work.
This is a full-time permanent position. The team is currently located in Sydney, but working out of one of our other offices is an option (Melbourne, Canberra, Adelaide, Brisbane, Hobart, Perth).
The key responsibilities include:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to extract requirements and design data solutions
Model datasets and build Qlik Sense apps to create the insights our stakeholders need to thrive
Be a thought leader on, and advocate of, data modelling and Qlik Sense best practices and share your knowledge and expertise with the wider analytical community

The key skills needed to be successful in this role

2+ years hands-on experience in within a data-oriented role:
An entrepreneurial, curious, hands-on and problem-solving mindset
The ability to distil user requirements and translate those into a data model and app design
Excellent communication and collaboration skills; enjoyment of working with colleagues from different business areas.
Experience with Snowflake, DBT and/or Python would be looked upon favourably

Why work at Avant?
At Avant, our people are the centre of everything we do for our members. We offer a range of benefits and opportunities to enable you to make a difference, learn, and grow in your career.

Discount of 25% on Private Health Insurance, free Salary Continuance Insurance and free Travel Insurance
We value our people by offering an inclusive workplace with flexible work, career development and internal mobility opportunities.  Our flexible working arrangements are designed to enable genuine work-life balance.
Your development is our priority and we have a variety of learning and development programs that will support you in your career.
Employee Referral Program which rewards $2,500
We offer support to our people via Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Health and Wellbeing programs, Tertiary Education Sponsorship and Support.
We have a diverse and connected work environment where your contribution and ideas will be valued and respected and make a real difference to the lives of others.

Please note:  Avant Mutual is a vaccinated employer.  Prior to the commencement of your employment by Avant, you are required to be fully vaccinated against the Covid-19 virus or have a medical certificate stating that you cannot receive a Covid-19 vaccination for valid medical reasons.  
For further information, please contact our Careers team at careers@avant.org.au

Summary:At Elysium Digital, you can expect to work with the best and the brightest and have a lot of fun along the way with our collaborative, flexible, and fun culture! We like to do things a little differently here at Elysium Digital. We have built an incredible culture through attracting some of the best people in the industry and we have a lot of fun doing what we love. Our teams work on industry leading projects, use the latest technology, receive amazing benefits and we offer an organisational structure that truly supports your career!!!  Sound like an awesome place to work??? Cool, let’s chat! About your new companyElysium Digital aren’t like other Digital Consultancies, I know, you have heard it all before, but stick with us. We believe in creating a better Australia by supporting our clients to build best practice digital solutions and achieve their ambitions and vision for the future. We understand that our people are the most important part of our business, and more than that, we care about our employees, so we built our company with people at the centre. Your new roleEnough about us, we’re more interested in you anyway! If you’re a Power BI Visualisation Developer who believes they have what it takes to work with the best and brightest in the industry and can demonstrate high levels of competency in some or all of the below then we’re keen to chat:Collaborate with a business and technical subject matter experts to solve problems and convey key messages using data visualisation approaches, techniques, and methodsDevelop intuitive and attractive static and interactive data visualisations using data internal and external data sources that may be either structure and/or unstructured - i.e. RDMS, NOSQL, Graph, document etc.Design, develop, implement, and maintain data models to be used by various reporting and data discovery toolsInterpret and produce unique data visualisations for a variety of output products, including reports, briefs, presentations, and dashboardsDistil quantitative and qualitative data to communicate compelling stories to diverse audiencesModify and troubleshoot existing reports and rebuilding or repointing existing reports to another data sources.Experience with one or more of the following tools: SSRS, Power BI, Tableau or QlikView.Experience in developing customized interactive reports, dashboards and visualizations using multiple data sources What can we offer you?We want work to be fun! That’s why we go up and beyond to ensure that we offer the best workplace which includes:Salary: Attractive remuneration packages that demonstrates the value we put on your skills and capability.Career Progression: Each of our employees are unique, which is why you will receive a Partner Career Manager from day one to support your individual career aspirations. They will work with you every step of the way to ensure you have everything you want and need to take your career in right the direction.Culture: Our culture is the lifeblood of our business - we have a fun, supportive, and diverse environment including flexibility and work-life balance.For you: The opportunity to make a big impact in our rapidly growing business where you’ll be surrounded by likeminded, talented experts.Employee benefits: We are industry leaders when it comes to our employee experience. We offer benefits which include a best practice parental leave policy, training and development benefits, tech, subscriptions and allowances plus more. Why should you work here?We know you have a lot of companies to choose from, and we can go on and on by telling you why we think you should work at Elysium Digital, but we think you should hear it from our employees firsthand: ‘I love being surrounded by highly talented people in a supportive and fun environment where I get to make a difference every day’. Your next stepsWe know when it sounds too good to be true it usually is, but in this case, it is this good. If you want to take control of your career and hear more about our opportunities and vision, click apply now OR contact us at HR@elysiumdigital.com.au

Job Title: Business Systems and Data Analyst - Brisbane
Description: About the RoleThe purpose of the Business Systems and Data Analyst role is to enhance business systems usage to extract more value and provide ease of use; and to facilitate effective data governance and reporting to support accurate business decisions.The role responsibilities include: Improve business value of IT systems by working with business managers and IT support teams to enhance core business systems and their data repositories, including Salesforce, Atlassian Confluence and Jira, and Microsoft SharePoint. Work collaboratively with business managers and executives to determine data analytics and dashboard requirements. Support quantitative data analysis by administering data analytical platforms (PowerBI, Salesforce reporting etc.) and providing data catalogues, user training, report templates and default system connectors/integrations. Define and administer a metadata schema within SharePoint Online to increase searchability and support data classifications. Ensure data and business systems adhere to security policies and procedures. Ensure core business systems (including SharePoint, Teams, Atlassian, S/4Hana and Salesforce) have defined, documented and communicated governance standards aligned to best practice and nationally recognised security frameworks. Assist with minimising administrative effort across the business using process automation. Develop and maintain a “Champion” program providing key staff with training and expertise to accelerate the uptake and value of core systems. Analyse system data sources (AD, Azure, SaaS, etc.) to ensure consistency and improve IT Governance and functional excellence. Assist other South Asia Esri distributors with aligning on business and data systems and policies.  About You A minimum of three years’ experience in business systems administration and data governance within similar environments. Experience with programming languages such as Python, PowerShell, T-SQL and Apex. Experience with industry-standard security governance frameworks (e.g., NIST CSF, ISO 27001, ISM, COBIT or Essential Eight). Keen interest in business technology, including self-education and keeping up to date with industry changes. Strong interpersonal / client engagement skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Highly motivated and proactive. Strong attention to detail and accuracy when accomplishing a task. The ability to prioritise workloads, manage time and schedule tasks whilst remaining resilient to changing priorities. Advocating for, and experience in presenting data-driven information. Understanding of ITIL aligned business processes, including best practice organisational data flows. The ability to foster teamwork and promote a positive and inclusive workplace experience, in-office and online. Demonstrated alignment with Esri Australia's core values. Tertiary qualification in an associated business discipline (Information Technology, Data Analytics etc.) is highly desirable. Accreditations and Certifications in related disciplines is highly regarded (Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate or Cloud vendor security certifications: Microsoft Azure Data Scientist Associate or AWS Certified Big Data) You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia. Personality/behaviour aligns to Esri Australia’s core values.  For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Tibo Torche, National Talent Acquisition Lead on 07 3218 0448 or mail to ttorche@esriaustralia.com.au. We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

Company description:Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of nearly 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journeyJob description: Provide key data to support business decision making  Full Time, Permanent position based in Melbourne Real Wellbeing starts here    What makes us, us Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of more than 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community. We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journey There are four key attributes that set us apart:  Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people. Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing. Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we’ve been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840. Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level.  These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honest   The position As the reporting analyst you are responsible for providing comprehensive reporting solutions and data analytics to highlight useful information and support decision making. Working closely with finance, this role will focus on technology costs and performance, including industry benchmarking reporting. Reporting directly into the Head of Commercial Management, this position is a great opportunity for an experienced Reporting Analyst who can extract and understand data while delivering concise and to the point reports across multiple teams.  Deliver monthly, quarterly and annual internal management reports on spend and cost allocations, performance, technology assets, renewals, commercial engagement Working with the BI team to improve and streamline current reporting processes Responsible for creating, maintaining and analysing datasets Responsible for ensuring governance reporting is completed, stored. Accurately capturing actions and outcomes Present and talk back to data provided with key internal stakeholders in the business    About you We are searching for a professional who will join us in striving to live our values of bold, warm and honest, in everything we do. Your expertise and qualifications will include:  Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, business, finance, information systems or related field Advanced skills in SQL, Service Now and Microsoft Excel Demonstrated understanding of the design and development of reporting tools and dashboards Ability to report on and understand the fundamentals of data Confident in working across operational data and SLA reporting Excellent communication skills    Interested? Our people make a real difference in the wellbeing of customers and members every day. Our ambition to be the most trusted wellbeing company in Australia therefore means that wellbeing starts with our people. Our credentials in wellbeing stretch back more than 180 years. To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people, customers and community, Australian Unity requires that all employees and contractors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by no later than 31 December 2021 as a condition of entry of any Australian Unity workplace. In order to progress your application, you will need to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination status, proof of booking for the COVID-19 vaccination, or medical exemption certificate from a registered medical practitioner. Thank you for your understanding. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people. Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however, will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job. For a discussion in confidence about this opportunity, please contact Erin Hoey, Talent Acquisition Specialist ehoey@australianunity.com.au. www.australianunity.com.au/careers

As an employer of choice, the Western Australia Police Force (WA Police Force) has a number of benefits to offer that can enrich your employment experience. In addition to your agreed salary and employer superannuation contributions, the WA Police Force offers stability, growth and learning opportunities, work-life balance opportunities, flexible leave options, salary packaging and a fit for life program.Are you community minded and keen to make a difference? Do you want to be part of a dynamic team striving to deliver contemporary tactical intelligence within a policing environment?Working as a Tactical Intelligence Analyst helps the Western Australia Police Force (WA Police Force) achieve results for the community and keeps Western Australia (WA) safe. Be at the forefront of tackling serious and organised crime, contributing to a safer WA. If you believe you have what it takes, apply to become a Tactical Intelligence Analyst.To access information about this position please click on the APPLY button which will redirect you to the full Jobs WA advertisement.For further job related information please contact Ms Liz Luppino on telephone number 0438 525 854.Closing date: Wednesday, 2 March 2022 at 4:00 pm WST. Please note: Faxed, late or pro-forma applications will not be accepted.

Why work with us?Firstly, the perks are pretty amazing! We offer amazing flexibility, ongoing learning and development so you can have an amazing career, AND an incredible environment to work in, both online and in the office!But that's not all… There's a heck of a lot more perks that are going to blow your mind! Just ask!Who is RMIT Online?We bring the best digital methodologies and people to online education, focussed on meeting the needs of the future of work. Our whole online courses range from short, 'snackable' credentials to full undergraduate and postgraduate programs. With a heavy focus on digital skills and emerging technologies, our portfolio of courses is co-designed and co-delivered with world-leading industry partners.We empower our people to do the best work of their life; you're valued for your expertise. Like our students, we are a team of lifelong learners with a growth mindset culture. Being open, collaborative and outcome-driven really pays off; and we have fun while we're at it!Let’s talk about youWith strong analytical and creative problem-solving abilities, you have proven ability to evaluate large data sets to extract meaningful and actionable insights and quickly understand business processes, systems and data sets. As a data guru, you find comfort in complex Excel spreadsheets and know your way around visualisation software such as Tableau and Power BI; experience with Salesforce is a big bonus!You thrive in fast moving environments and can multi-task like a pro. You enjoy the opportunity to work across multiple teams to frame and solve problems through analysis. Bonus points for a sense of humour, grace under pressure, knowledge of the higher education sector and/or experience in management consulting!Sounds great! Tell me about the role This is a critical role that reports to the Chief Student Experience (SX) Officer analysing student experience data to generate insights we can action to improve our student experience. This could lead to a career path into the strategy or knowledge teams, depending on whether you want to take a consulting track or a specialist track into data and knowledge. In this role you’ll be responsible for analysing, reporting and developing insights across a range of datasets – including students, teachers, and delivery partners - to diagnose issues or opportunities to improve our student and partner experience. You’ll also work alongside the Knowledge Team to identify and source appropriate datasets to generate insights across a range of business functions, and collaborate with the Knowledge Team and our Business Intelligence Guild to represent SX reporting/analytics requests, design and deliver self-service tools and dashboards for internal stakeholders, identify ongoing improvements and implement effective data governance and user training across the SX team. What’s a week in the life of this role?Always a new challenge and with loads of variety, you could be doing a range of short analytical pieces, scoping strategic pieces of analysis and debriefing insights from recently completed analysis. You’ll be continuously collaborating with various parts of the business and deep-diving into data to identify actionable insights. How to apply?Send us your CV now along with a brief cover letter telling us about:Why you’re the best person for this job and why you want to work for RMIT OnlineWhat was the most interesting data set you have evaluated and extracted meaningful information that you turned into actionable insights and how did it impact the business.Need more convincing?We have an amazing, social office in the heart of Melbourne that includes a rooftop terrace, open workspace, and more. We currently work in a hybrid model, which means a blend of working from home and working from our office.We pride ourselves on being a respectful, diverse and inclusive community of fun and intelligent people. RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child-safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.

We are an international company with a workforce of more than 38,500 top professionals, present in more than 40 countries across the five continents. Leaders in Innovation and Technological Development at the service of society, we’re looking for experts in designing a better planet who can go out there and promote sustainable development and find solutions to the biggest global challenges, including global warming, overpopulation and water scarcity.   Since establishing a presence in Australia in 2002, ACCIONA have invested more than AUD$1 billion through local investment opportunities and project development. As a national business ACCIONA employs more than 1,000 people in its renewable energy, infrastructure and water projects across the country.Job DescriptionColeman Rail has a long-standing reputation as the leading rail and infrastructure contractor in Australia, providing construction services for major rail and transport infrastructure projects Australia-wide, part of the ACCIONA group of companies with a presence in more than 40 countries.  Due to growth within our major project division, opportunities are available to be involved in the Murray Basin Rail Project which requires all activities necessary to manage, design, supply, deliver, construct, install, integrate, test, commission and handover rail infrastructure.As our Data Analyst you would be responsible for leading all Murray Basin Rail Project Alliance systems and review, development, and implementation to enable systems integration across the Alliance.As Data Analyst you will required to produce regular reporting on behalf of the Project Controls team, including overseeing the development and management of ongoing reporting requirements for internal and external purposes to internal stakeholders, Rail Projects Victoria (RPV) and relevant government bodies and authorities.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and manage the implementation of a strategy for the Systems, Reporting and Analytics function for the Alliance to assist people leaders in decision makingOwn, deliver and manage the Alliances information systems to support outcomes to achieve Murray Basin Rail Projects (MBRP) Business Plan, regularly reviewing the capability is aligned to the needs of MBRPDesign and deliver effective reporting systems/tools/framework/metrics/data to meet statutory and compliance requirements as well as ad hoc requestsProvide both strategic and tactical advice and support on the Alliances systems, reporting, metrics and analytics as requiredWork with Alliance Management Team to drive reporting efficiency throughout the AllianceShare knowledge and provide training and support for the management system to ensure understandingMaintain appropriate control environment with systems, tools and frameworks and assist the Alliance in leading a continuous improvement culture within the AllianceDevelop and produce monthly reporting requirements for the Alliance, ensuring integrity of data and reporting and analytics enables decision makingAudit and assurance of reporting and analytic platformsContinuously strive for a deeper understanding of our business drivers and develop mechanisms for improvement and maximisation of processesIdentify and resolve gaps in reporting which will value-add to the business by capturing and analysing data not currently being measuredRequired Skills and CompetenciesTertiary qualification in relevant disciplineMinimum 4 years’ experience in a similar roleAn extensive background in developing metrics for complex, project-based environments, demonstrated ability to develop dashboards with accurate and meaningful data for decision makingAn extensive background in the implementation and ongoing management and development of fully integrated cloud-based information systemsCurrent Driver Licence and your own reliable vehicleWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer and promote equality and diversity. Indigenous Australians and candidates from minority groups are encouraged to apply.

Company: St Vincent de Paul Society Victoria Inc.
Description: Join one of Victoria's leading not for profits and be a part of something big  Competitive Salary + Tax reducing salary package Full-Time, Ongoing Role     A little bit about us For over 165 years we have been in Victoria assisting people through the challenges of poverty and exclusion address suffering, advocating against inequality and promoting human dignity and self-determination. Overall, St Vincent de Paul Society Victoria has many arms and services. These include soup vans, education programs, home visitation programs and VincentCare Victoria, which provides a range of services and programs for people who are experiencing or at risk of homelessness and disadvantage. This includes crisis accommodation, drug and alcohol dependency programs, and housing. It’s an exciting time to join the organisation as we have recently launched a new strategic plan that is future oriented and full of exciting initiatives. The IT Transformation team will play a pivotal role in delivering on strategic projects and helping the organisation to achieve operational excellence.    A little about the Role The Business Intelligence Lead will play an integral role in the organisation and in the delivery of our strategy. Reporting to the Manager IT Transformation, this role will add value through the development of BI reports, dashboards, and applications to create greater visibility and inform business decisions Week to week you will work with your manager to prioritize projects; oversee the technical execution of BI projects encompassing research, design and implementation of data platforms, data pipelines, data models, reports/dashboards and data-driven applications. You will design and implement processes to mitigate data quality issues. As a good collaborator you will work closely with team members and the other teams within organization to plan, coordinate, and deliver according to a high-level roadmap. We have a lot of work to do in this space. In your first year you will work on:  Design, implement and maintain the overall Power BI, ETL and data warehouse environments and operation; Complete the funding contract data management project Work with the leadership team to develop reports and dashboards to provide greater visibility and insights for the organisation Work closely with the IT Transformation team to understand the data behind our key processes and identify and establish improvement in data capture to increase data integrity and improve the consistency in coding structures Work with the team to develop a digital mindset across the workforce to foster a culture of evidence-based decision making and innovation And plenty of other interesting initiatives…    A little bit about you You are currently working in a similar role and have experience in Power BI visualisation and moving, manipulating and analysing data between different programs. You are known for being responsive, approachable, and service oriented, you will confidently build connections with your key stakeholders and create positive working relationships. You will be enthusiastic, highly organized, detail orientated and driven by a commitment to delivering exceptional results. You will bring a "hands on" approach and be a proactive operator who thrives on developing relationships to achieve high stakeholder engagement. We love a bit of humour in the team too! Work should be enjoyed, not endured. More specifically you will have:  A formal qualification in Information Technology or a minimum of 3 years of Business Intelligence experience (required). Advanced Power BI visualisation and report navigation design (required). Strong SQL skills, including views, stored procedures and functions (required). Experience in Power BI visualisation and DAX measure development. Strong project management skills to deliver multiple projects on time and work autonomously in a high-pressure, deadline driven environment A high level of experience in moving data between programs, manipulating data and analysing large data sets. Hands on experience in querying and extracting data across multiple, disparate and complex relational databases. The ability to communicate, both verbally and written, clearly and concisely at all levels.     Why work for us?  We offer:  Salary packaging, sometimes called salary sacrificing is a huge attraction here! It is a popular way of providing employees in the community sector with tax benefits over and above their salary. It means the real value of a salary package can be significantly higher than the nominal value. We are committed to professional development to make sure that your career keeps growing while you’re working with us. We like to have a laugh and you will always find some sort of chocolate or cake in our work area… be prepared! We make an incredible difference in the lives of over 300,000 people every year. We believe in families, so we like to provide a family-friendly environment in which to work. We offer a place where you know you are contributing to an organisation committed to helping others. We are passionate about #Social Justice. We have some great talent who are happy to share their experience and skills to help you on your way. We are complex in our design which always makes work interesting.    Where good happens # Goodworks   If making a difference in your local community is important to you and you meet our essential requirements we can’t wait to hear from you. Please send us your updated CV and a cover letter that tells us a little more about you and why you would be perfect for the role. Please click here for a copy of the Position Description.     Applications close: Please don’t delay in submitting your application as applications will be reviewed upon submission.   Please note that prior to any commencement of employment, pre-employment checks must be completed these will include reference checking, a national criminal history and right to work check, proof of COVID-19 vaccination, and a working with children check.   St Vincent de Paul Society Victoria is proactive in supporting child safety We value diversity and aim to build an inclusive environment that champions, embraces and respects differences.    We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people of all abilities, cultures, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions.

Diona is an award-winning business built on a solid reputation and more than 38 years’ experience. We are specialists in cable laying installations, water, sewer and gas pipelines, as well as drainage and concrete construction. Our services encompass every aspect of utility infrastructure design and construction. We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will assist us deliver water infrastructure project in South East Queensland. As a Data Analyst Graduate you will have the confidence to work autonomously, and reporting to the Cost Control Team will deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients as well as: Manage the integration of project data from various sources such as schedule, timesheets, forecast and billingSupport our Quantity Surveyor in producing progress claimsSupport Project Managers in the analysis of project dataProduce weekly project reportingSupport the Program Manager in producing Monthly ReportSupport the improvement and development of reporting toolsIdentify opportunities to improve data collection processesWHO YOU AREThe successful applicant will have 2+ years’ experience in a similar role working on construction and utility projects as well as : Experience developing data models within Power BIUnderstanding of Data Structures and RelationshipsDeep understanding of Microsoft 365 Software (i.e. Microsoft Excel)Experience in Project Cost ManagementEarned Value ManagementKnowledge of scheduling software (such as P6 desirable)WHY DIONA?We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and because we believe that people are our most valuable asset, we invest in, and support our employees’ personal and professional growth. Some of the ways we do this is through ongoing professional development, leadership and mentoring programs, paid parental leave and professional memberships and subscriptions. WHAT NOW?If this sounds like the opportunity for you then APPLY NOW or if you require further information, contact Karen Graham on karen.graham@calibregroup.com for a confidential discussion.

The Rivet Group is an Australian provider of specialised transport and logistics, equipment hire and maintenance, contract mining and aviation services. Join Link Wentworth today to enjoy:  A strong culture of collaborative teamwork, individual empowerment, and client-centred service delivery Opportunities for career progression and professional development Options for flexible work arrangements and generous leave entitlements A competitive salary with the opportunity to reduce your income tax and increase your take-home pay with not-for-profit salary packaging An annual calendar of wellbeing and social events and activities Opportunities for recognition with our quarterly and annual Awards of Excellence Free coaching or therapy sessions for you and your family members with our award-winning Employee Assistance Program + much, much more!!!  About the Role  Full Time (38 hours/week) Permanent role Chatswood or Penrith location (negotiable) with some WFH options This role is responsible for mining data, undertaking analysis, and supporting strategic improvements as part of regulatory, contractual and management reporting requirements. About Us At Pet Circle, we want to create a world where pets and their families are healthy, happy and spend more time together. We make buying pet supplies and pet food online easy and convenient. Over the past ten years, we’ve grown to become one of Australia's Top 5 eCommerce and No.1 in the Online Pet industry. We have an incredibly passionate team, a leading brand, 600,000 customers and growing, and we’re only just getting started.  As the pet industry continues to grow, and our pets are holding bigger spaces in our hearts and homes than ever before, Pet Circle will continue to thrive. As a venture backed company, we have big goals for growth. We’ve scaled incredibly quickly and this is a unique opportunity in your career to be part of an exceptional growth story. The Opportunity Pet Circle is a digital-native business that sees its ongoing success as being customer-centric in its approach, valuing ongoing relationships with pet parents as being the foundation of growth and loyalty. The mission of the Data team is to operationalise our data by making it available and transformative for all users and applications in our business so that we can better target and deliver on our customer-centric focus. To achieve this, the Analyst Lead must be exceptional at uncovering insights that shape customer behavior and loyalty better than anyone else. Reporting to the VP Data, this Lead Analyst role is added to the Data & Algorithms team to build the analytical capabilities and capacity of the group. The right person will strive to achieve our mission, whilst always thinking “bigger picture” in regards to our mission.The role requires a blend of analytical experience, business acumen, strong communication and strategic thinking. All these skill sets will be applied to understand customer behavior and operational performance across multiple functions. You will be leading a team of analysts and partnering with other business stakeholders to truly understand business problems and needs. You will think critically about complex challenges in a fast-paced environment. In the immediate term, you will be an integral part of a BI tool migration, building data visualisations for company and operational dashboards, leading the new tool BI Tool training across the business, guiding and supporting functional analysts. Your ResponsibilitiesDevelop data visualisations, including reports, dashboards and analyses to distribute data insights in an easily digestible fashion to relevant stakeholders. Translate business problems into more specific questions or hypotheses that can be answered through data analysis, and provide/present insights or findings in a subjective manner to relevant stakeholders. Deep understanding of the data warehouse, maintain the integrity, identify gaps in the dataset and feed high quality requirements through to data engineering. Build and manage a team of 7 analysts, mentor and work closely with the team to remove data-related and technical roadblocks. Manage analysis work pipeline and prioritisation through collaboration with data scientists, engineers, and cross functional teams. Work with VP of Data in building quarterly and yearly analytics roadmap.  Provide guidance to analysts in other teams over datasets and customer-driven needs.  Lead training and provide support for technical and non-technical users on developing charts Your Ideal ExperienceBachelor or Master degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Engineering, or other quantitative discipline field with strong academic record.5+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics or business intelligence roles.Excellent SQL , Proficient knowledge in using SQL, GCP, Excel. Experience in BI tools, like Looker would be an advantage. Experience in R and Python is advantageous but not required.Experience in team management. Proven ability to leverage a large dataset, perform in-depth analysis, and present the data and findings that are easily understood by technical and non-technical audiences.Ability to work to deadlines with good prioritisation, planning and organisational skills.Autonomous, reliable, with excellent communication skills. Other Benefits of Working at Pet CircleMake an impact: Enjoy being part of a driven team with a collaborative culture that values decision-makers and actionInvest in you: Accelerate your career through our learning & development opportunities - think learning tools, stretch projects, focus groups, secondments and other internal mobility opportunities!We value wellbeing: We’re here to support you in times of need with our Employee Assistance Program. Team hybrid working arrangements also enable you to balance collaboration with home and family commitments.Pet better: Take advantage of our employee discount, product sample giveaways and PAWrental leave for your furry familyHelp us to give back: Join us on our animal welfare mission: we donate 10,000kg of pet food and supplies per month to pet shelters and support through our communities through team charity volunteer daysFlexible Working: Split your time between home and the office - work in a way that suits you and your lifestyle. Our ValuesAccountability - Promises are made, and promises are keptTeamwork - Value the diverse backgrounds and expertise we all bringCommunication - Honest, clear and respectfulContinuous Improvement - Failure is OK, as long as we own it and learn from it

We are a key provider of spatial land information services in New South Wales. Our integrated framework provides comprehensive land and property services including property, surveying and mapping information to the people, businesses and government agencies of NSW, as well as nationally and internationally.  Some of our key initiatives include: Sourcing information from organisations and individuals to compile maps, databases and informationMaking information public availability for land management purposes, state economic and social development, and for planning and providing government services to the community, including event and emergency managementOverseeing the practice and conduct of surveying in NSW through the Surveyor General.About the Role  This role reports to the Service Delivery Manager and is responsible for managing the continuous improvement of our Spatial Services product and services portfolio. This role has three focus areas: business intelligence, analytics and reporting. As our Service Delivery Coordinator, you will be the lead in these areas of endeavour and be responsible for undertaking data analysis and provide specialist advice on the key focus areas to support the strategic development and business development of Spatial Services. In addition, you will utilise business intelligence tools and applications to provide insight on business performance and product development opportunities.  On a day to day-to-day basis you will: Generate reports and liaise with key internal stakeholders to inform business decisions.Lead exploratory analyses to uncover customer insights to improve the digital customer experience.Be part of a small leadership group and make recommendations for improvement, identify changes and recommend actions.Mentor and train a small team to ensure performance standards and personal development objectives are met.Proactively profile, analyse and interpret campaign data and results, and then use the discoveries to improve future solutions, analyses and recommendations.About You  The successful candidate will have a responsibility of managing priorities in a high-volume environment as well as providing specialist advice and making prompt decisions while ensuring client expectations and business objectives are met.  To be successful in this role you will have: Relevant experience and qualifications/training in a similar field.Genuine interest in/and ideally proven experience in business intelligence, analytics and reporting.Understanding of the products and services that may be associated with Spatial Services.Experience in using Spatial Services related business, administrative, information and financial systems.Experience using a range of software applications including but not limited to Splunk, Microsoft Suite including Excel, Power BI, Python and JIRA.A motivated team player who can work in independently as well as in a team environment.An inquisitive mind - will you investigate something unusual in the data if it wasn't what you were looking for?Strong interpersonal skills to engage with people at all levels of the organisation and build strong relationship and trust with clients and internal stakeholders.Learn More  For enquiries relating to the role, please email Shaun Bunyan at shaun.bunyan@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  How to Apply  Your application must include a covering letter and an up-to-date resume that details your knowledge, skills and experience in relation to the above role, demonstrating your capability against the focus capabilities of the role.  Please submit your CV (5 page maximum) with a maximum two-page cover letter outlining how your experience meets the focus capabilities of the role.  Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at $99,431 base plus superannuation  Click Here to access the Role Description. For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Lucinda Pham via Lucinda.Pham@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Based on our current Work, Health and Safety (WHS) requirements, and in line with our Mandatory Vaccination Policy, it is a condition of engagement for a role within Service NSW/Department of Customer Service that staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. multiple_details: Competitive Package with great Industry Perks
Description:
Situated in Flight Centre’s HQ, one of Brisbane’s most desirable corporate headquarters complete with rooftop dining and drinks, 24/7 gym, direct access to South Bank train and busway stations and the South Bank precinct just across the road, we offer perks and company culture that are second to none.
About the Opportunity 
We are on the hunt for a Senior Reporting Analyst to join our dynamic, fast-paced and successful Finance team. In this role, you will report to the General Manager of Finance and work collaboratively with our Flight Centre Travel Group teams. 
As a Senior Reporting Analyst, you will be specialising in reporting, responsible for the design, build and maintenance of reports and process automation to support the operational requirements of the business. You will be responsible for managing changes, including automation and implementation and overseeing the consistency of reporting and data structures. You will also be tasked with working on both operational and financial project initiatives. This role leads a team of 2 Reporting Analysts and is responsible for performing a variety of data and automation reporting activities to a high standard utilising advanced analytical and automation skills across complex datasets. 
  What you will be doing: 

Conduct monthly 1 on 1s 
Budgeting, forecasting and cash-flows 
Develop and analyse reporting as required by operational and finance leaders 
Lead the Reporting Analyst team and ensure they hit their targets and timeframes 
Assist with special projects and the implementation of systems and process improvement initiatives 
Format and communicate results, using textual, numeric, graphical and other visualisation methods appropriate to the target audience 
Apply data analysis, data modelling, and quality assurance techniques to gain a detailed understanding of business processes 
Identify modifications or maintenance required for established data structures and associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions)
Specify and apply appropriate data transformation techniques to turn various data sources and types into standardised outputs which supports business processes 

You'll be perfect for this role if you can showcase: 

5+ years of experience in a reporting role 
Understands complex database structures 
Knowledge of data integration methods and tools 
Business/Commerce/IT degree with Finance Systems understanding 
Strong knowledge and experience with Transact SQL or similar, Power BI, Visual Basic for Applications, MS Excel and PowerPoint 

What's in it for you? 

Flexible work environment 
Ongoing training and professional development 
Access to our 24/7 gym located at Global Head Office 
Global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses 
Essential to have an understanding of accounting concepts and principles. CA/CPA preferred 
Travel discounts and deals bookable through our internal team of travel agents, Travelwise 
Discounted financial and health services through our Moneywise and Healthwise businesses 

We do things a little differently… We do things the Flight Centre Way! We have a unique culture based on a proven mix of ideas, values and ways of working that have helped shape our business for over the past 40+ years. Across all our brands, we take our business seriously but not ourselves. We take leaps of faith, have trust in our teams and work collaboratively to achieve our goals. 
If you think you have what it takes, then reach out today!
