It starts with yes At Optus we believe that our Amazing People are central to helping us achieve our vision to be Australia’s most loved everyday brand, with lasting customer relationships. Your team ... Our newly formed Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP) and Insights function has an exceptional career opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to complement the team..   Your core responsibilities:  Develop and deliver self-service enterprise dashboards, standardised reporting, and ad-hoc analysis for the People & Culture (P&C) division; Improve on existing HR reporting (e.g., HR Metrics reporting including future workforce KPI's) to drive meaningful business results; Engage and collaborate with HRBPs, CoEs and People Leaders to identify actionable people insights by providing business analysis of HR related data using BI tools and statistical means; Improve the reporting and self-service insights capabilities and availability of HR data across the organisation to support HR and the business; Continuously contributing to reporting tool enhancement including the introduction of SuccessFactors Analytics; Support the development of predictive models for attrition, high performance, and recruiting demand by manipulating and analysing large datasets using analytic features of multiple tools; Build on expertise with the use of reporting and forecasting tools and applications (SuccessFactors, SAP People Analytics, O365, SQL, PowerBI & Tableau); & Clearly explain findings from data and easily translate recommendations into the language of the business to drive well-informed decision-making.  Your key ingredients for success ...  Tertiary qualified in a Business, Finance, Marketing or Statistics discipline; Experience in modelling, querying and integrating datasets, with SuccessFactors and SAP People Analytics preferred; Advanced SQL programming experience in manipulating complex and large data, plus advanced O365 skills inc. Excel & PowerPoint; Solid working experience with analytical and BI tools such as Tableau, Alteryx & PowerBI; Practical experience with complex data quality, lineage challenges and solutions; Understanding of Telecommunications Industry, regulatory environment and competitive issues (ideal, but not 100% essential); & People centric with exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to work with diverse styles and levels of management.  Please apply with your CV and cover letter via the online function today!

About the opportunity  Reporting into the Associate Director Business Insights, this position is responsible for developing and implementing analytics outputs and data visualisations to support the wider team and particularly Alumni and Supporter Relations. This role will see you Increase impactful alumni engagement and philanthropic opportunities for the University through data extraction and insightful and high-level analysis.  About you   The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a Lead Business Insights Analyst who: Has demonstrated high-level data analysis skills and has the ability to discover patterns and relationship within the data Has strong experience preparing, reviewing, consolidating and analysing big datasets (SQL, R, Python, SPSS or equivalent) Has knowledge of predicitive analytics methodologies and tooling Can manage and refine Alumni and Supporter Relations' propensity modelling and probability scoring, using this to provide priority portfolios of individuals for the Alumni and Supporter Relations team to connect with Has highly developed written, verbal and presentation skills including the ability to prepare reports of a consistently high standard and can present information in a compelling way. Is an expert in workload, project management and organisational skills, including the demonstrated ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and also take initiative. Has a demonstrated focus and excellence in customer service. About us  The Alumni and Supporter Relations team engages with alumni and the broader community through a wide range of communications, events, community giving and engagement programs. The University of Sydney has a community of 380,000 alumni with over 30 alumni associations as well as interstate and international alumni chapters.  This change plan brings together 5 dedicated functions and this role and sits within business insights. This team is responsible for assessing trends in alumni and donor engagement, providing data insights that help inform future strategies and identifying priority portfolios with whom the team should connect individually. This position would provide leads for the Relationship Managers to follow up on and also the Global Campaigns Volunteers team on any data gaps we need to fill through annual check-in or engagement initiatives. It would give the Community Giving team regular reports on fundraising performance and trends in giving. Note this role will sit within Advancement Services but will be a dedicated resource for Alumni and Supporter Relations.  Closing date: Sunday 23rd January 2022 at 11:30pm  The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.  The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.  Click to view the Position Description for this role.

About the JobSwinburne is embarking on an exciting journey, working towards our new vision of bringing people and technology together to build a better world. We are seeking a Data and Reporting Analyst (DRA) to join us and be responsible for building Swinburne’s capacity to design, develop and deliver analytical and decision support, centered on work integrated learning (WIL), career development learning, and employability. The role is responsible for developing and delivering evaluative solutions as part of the WIL Transformation Project. As the DRA you will play a key role in reporting on the achievement of institutional and business area KPIs, as well as design, integration, analysis and reporting of measures of initiative and project impact. Drawing on their expertise in analytics and survey-based evaluation, the incumbent will develop and interrogate data sets, conduct analyses and provide complex advice and reporting. You will naturally have an innovative approach with evolving analytical techniques and technologies and possess outstanding communication and interpersonal capabilities, to work with a wide range of data and reporting stakeholders.Reporting to the Senor Project Manager WIL, the role resides within the Employability Unit within the Education, Experience and Employability Portfolio. As part of the role you will also maintain strong links with the Employability Operations team, working to build collective capacity towards evidence informed WIL and employability practice.The DRA will be part of a strategic WIL project team, also comprising a including a Learning & Teaching Consultant, Senior Business Analyst, and Careers Consultant. As the DRA you will take on a leadership position in Development and integration of evaluation and success indicators for WIL.You will also contribute expertise to the achievement of deliverables within the following • Review, streamlining, and redevelopment where needed of business processes and associated software systems which support our WIL activities • Redevelopment of communications and marketing messaging to students, staff and industry To learn more about Swinburne’s Transforming WIL strategic project and it’s nine work packages please refer to the postion decription for more information.About Swinburne University of TechnologySwinburne is a young university with a long history. As a dual-sector university of technology, born of a technical college, we are proud of Swinburne’s technology DNA, and of our national and global standing. Our contribution to Technology, Entrepreneurship, Innovation and the STEM disciplines, and our track record of meaningful industry and community engagement, are natural manifestations of the legacy initiated by the vision of our founders George and Ethel Swinburne in 1902. We offer postgraduate, undergraduate, vocational education and online education to provide students with a variety of work-relevant pathways. About you To be suitable for the role you will have:• A degree with subsequent relevant experience; or extensive experience and specialist expertise or broad knowledge in career development or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training• Demonstrated experience in conducting qualitative and quantitative analyses to facilitate business decision-making, with strong modelling skills• Design and development of project and initiative performance indicators and measures of impact• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to effectively influence stakeholders and colleagues at various levels of seniorityA full list of selection criteria is available within the position description. Job Title: Media BI Analyst - 12 Month Fixed Term
Description:
Foxtel’s purpose is to bring home Australia’s most valued entertainment experience.  Whether it’s a blockbuster sports match, a must-see reality episode, an election special, the newest hit movie or the most ambitious drama, Foxtel brings together the best of TV and on demand for our customers.
We work as a team, we’re agile and we’re accountable. We put the customer first and we’re passionate about what we do. We have fun and we’re different, better, special.
Our Marketing and Digital team are searching for an experienced and highly analytical Media BI Analyst Contractor to aid our Head of Media Performance and Analytics in driving forward both data driven initiatives critical to our data maturation and driving marketing performance by identifying key optimisation opportunities.
The successful candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have rounded analytics experience that touches both data and media acumen.
 
Your mission

Work cross-department to collate insights from offline, online, website and broader business to allow collaboration on insights and recommendations
Produce automated and customised reports to deliver actionable insights back to the business
Continuously monitor, track and evaluate performance and proactively suggest improvements
Provide strong expertise to support and execute marketing campaigns and strategies and complete post campaign analysis
Assist in the development of channel testing plans to improves ongoing marketing activities
Support the wider digital team on adhoc reporting requirements to enable more focus on trafficking campaigns.

 
Your capability

4 years’ experience in a marketing  or digital analytics role
Working knowledge of Google Analytics, DCM, DV360, TTD, Search 360 and Social Channels (FB, Twitter, etc…)
Working knowledge of Tableau and Datorama platforms.
Ability to decipher large amounts of data, data cleansing and refine combinations to drive actionable optimisations.
Experience of working in a fast paced environment with high demand and multiple projects
Experience within Broadcasting or Telecommunications would be beneficial
Excellent communication, analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to write and operate SQL queries to extract more value of our data clean rooms and data warehouses
Experience in the use and operationalization of media mix and multi touch attribution models to inform business outcomes

 
What’s in it for you?
At Foxtel you will have the opportunity to work with authentic leaders and teams that put our customers at the centre of everything we do and thrive on achieving things together. You’ll also receive a free Foxtel subscription and discounted broadband. On top of that, you’ll enjoy a range of exclusive benefits across health, wellbeing, personal and professional development, partner discounts and unique experiences.
 
Above all, we’re passionate about entertainment and, if you are too, you’ll love working with us.  So if you’re excited about this opportunity, please click ‘Apply now’.

Job Title: Intelligence Analyst - Systems Operator (No Experience Required)
Description: Your role:As an Intelligence Analyst – System Operator (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Systems Operators) your role supports classified Government intelligence programs by analysing signal transmissions; and informing tactical and military advantage both at sea and ashore. This diverse and mentally stimulating role encompasses a range of specialist skills that support intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance activities. You’ll use sophisticated, state-of-the-art search receivers and other complex equipment to intercept, record, analyse and disseminate the intelligence of signal transmissions. Teamwork is an important part of the role. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel; all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.As an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator, you will receive training in the  following areas:- Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving,- Communications theory and networks,- Methods for working with intelligence information,- Preparation and presentation of intelligence briefs, and,- Provide advice to Commanders and other audiences as required. Prior experience isn’t needed. You’ll gain all the necessary skills and qualifications to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator as part of your training. Although, it is worth noting that successful Operators typically have a sound background in mathematics and are comfortable with the fundamentals of physics.Life in the Navy: A career in the Navy is challenging and highly rewarding, and comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles, rewarding careers, opportunities to travel, and excellent social and fitness facilities, free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment. Don’t worry, it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships, submarines and helicopters. Some days, you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days, you could be stationed locally not too far from home. Salary: Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package from $75,625 including service and uniform allowances. You will also receive a Maritime Allowance when serving on ships. In addition to your salary, you will receive generous superannuation, housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.Apply Now: For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English, Maths and Science (physics is preferable).Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/intelligence-analyst-systems-operatorThe Australian Defence Force is an equal opportunity employer. This advertisement is to ensure women are aware of the rewarding and fulfilling careers available in the Navy, Army and Air Force. Description:
G8 Education is an ASX 300 organisation and leading provider of quality early education and care services. Owning over 450 Centres and with over 10,000 team members, we are continually expanding and looking to grow and strengthen our network.
About the role:
To provide value added insights to the business that lead to optimal business decisions. Provide in-depth strategic and analytical information in the areas of operations, customer, network growth and portfolio performance management. Build and maintain reports to track key performance indicators.
Key responsibilities include:
• Use Power BI to understand, interpret, and blend large volumes of data from different sources• Use Power BI to build company-wide reports and model data for analysis• Using data analytics to generate insights in the areas of customer experience, operations, marketing and team• Undertake regular reviews of existing portfolio for demographic, economic and commercial drivers• Produce documentation of results and findings, interpret and present back to the business, including to the executive management • Providing relevant and accurate analytical review of the Group’s data and key performance metrics • Creating efficiencies in reporting methodologies• Work with the rest of the FP&A team in developing G8’s data strategy including data dictionary, data integrity rules, documentation requirements, and master data file management• Business partner with departments within the other areas of the business to provide reporting and analytics to drive increased revenue and lower costs• Present information using Power BI to a range of levels in the organisation including executive management

• 4+ years’ experience in a similar role• Undergraduate qualifications in finance, business, or a related discipline• High attention to detail• Problem solving skills• High level understanding of data and experience of blending large volumes of data from different sources• Prior experience in extracting, integrating, manipulating, and displaying data from various systems using automation where possible• Power BI experience highly desirable• A good communicator across all levels of the business• Presentation skills • Ability to plan and prioritise workload • Advanced level of Excel modelling skills• Early education sector experience desired • Natural curiosity to ask questions of the data and look for insights• Basic to intermediate SQL knowledge desired
 
Benefits Include:
• Attractive salary package• Generous discount on childcare fees • Exclusive access to our employee benefits program covering a wide range of discounts and promotions • Dedicated focus on professional growth and development

About the opportunity  The Australia Defence Force (ADF) Health Services contract allows Bupa to provide health support to 85,000 ADF personnel across 59 facilities. This includes integrated workforce providing health services such as primary and occupational healthcare, dental, physiotherapy, mental health and psychology services, pharmacy, occupational rehabilitation and health administration. As well pathology, imaging and radiology, vocational rehabilitation, mental health, hospital, specialist, allied health, patient transport and other off base services enabled by Bupa systems.  Reporting to the Senior Manager - Data & Analytics, the Senior Analyst - Data & Analytics is responsible for leading the development of analytic products to improve longitudinal health outcomes for ADF personnel and value for Joint Health Command (JHC).   How will I help?  Key accountabilities include:  Development of data solutions that meet the stakeholder expectations and align with the data strategy for Bupa ADF.Trouble-shoot stakeholders' data and analytics problems, produce effective solutions and deliver resultsDevelopment of data models/solutions, Power BI dashboards and reporting and actionable Insights using Analytical models to drive business improvementsManagement of a pipeline of Analytics work across Bupa ADFPrepare data for reporting and complete any data mining needed to prepare new fields or measures.Develop predictive models to support reporting and enhance data-driven business decision making.Maintain relationships with key staff across Health Services to understand their business problems and offer recommendations for where analytics could help solve issues or offer insights.What's in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements, you'll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will collaborate strongly with colleagues who are committed to delivering exceptional experiences. We trust, respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk highlights:  Discount on our health insurance, travel, car, home, contents, and pet insurance products as well as Bupa services such as Dental and OpticalA 'People First' wellness program - SMILE. Provides a range of services such as health coaches, annual skin checks and flu vaccinations, assistance with nutrition, mental and general well-being guides and product discounts. You will feel happier & healthier for working at Bupa!What do I need?  Highly experienced in data analytics, data quality, data warehousing and reporting with expertise in analysing data sets, quantitative analysis, data mining, predictive modelling and creating data visualisations3+ years technical knowledge and skills across the Microsoft Data Platforms & Data Analytics and using SQL to extract and manipulate data for reporting and insights. Plus 2+ years of experience using Microsoft Power BI (including DAX coding)Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or a related quantitative fieldStrong business acumen with strong written and verbal communication skills & ability to engage stakeholders at all levels and facilitate meetings, present to large groups, teach technical concepts, and coachCollaborative approach to work, professional maturity, ability to work independently with minimal supervisionYou must be an Australian citizen and be able to attain and maintain a baseline security clearance from the Defence security and vetting service.What is it like to work there?  Bupa is a world leading Health & Care organisation with over 22,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. In Australia, we help to take care of people through our leading health insurance services as well as providing a personalised approach to care through our modern Dental clinic network, our Bupa Optical stores, Bupa Medical Visa services and over 70 Bupa Aged Care Homes. Bupa Therapy, along with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa, your wellbeing, identity and own story is respected and valued.

PM-Partners group are a specialist Project Management Consultancy.  We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk.  Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.PM-Partners is currently seeking a Business Analyst with Power BI reporting skills, strong business process, continuous improvement and analysis skills to take on this contract opportunity improving offboarding process and form reform activities.In this role you will be responsible for several business analysis activities including delivery of process engineering and analysis on improvement opportunities for offboarding process and form reform activities. You will be working in our client's Improvement team, working with Common Corporate Support customers to identify client aligned process improvements and efficiencies. Location:           Melbourne CBD / Working RemotelyDuration:           ASAP Start through to end of June 2022 + ongoing renewalsDaily rate:          $850 - $950 (incl super)To be considered for this position you will have experience and strengths in the following: 5+ years proven experience in delivery as a Business / Functional Analyst Experience in Agile delivery as a Business/ Functional Analyst (certifications preferred) Experience with Power BI, SharePoint build's and reporting Experienced in the practice of continuous improvement methods such as Lean six sigma, HCD and Business Process Mapping Experience with negotiating with users, technical staff and product owners to achieve desired outcomes. Strong demonstrated ability to lead workshops and work directly with solution stakeholders Experience working in both the public and private sectors Strong skills and experience with documenting business requirements and functional design through user stories, wireframes, screen mockups, etc. Work directly with and between stakeholders and solution development teams for requirements elicitation and refinement. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Industry standard BA and Project methodology certifications are highly desiredWhat we can offer you: Culture: A fun, fast paced, collaborative delivery environment People: A group of talented, experienced, and dedicated Consultants to work by your side with a dedicated Relationship Manager Passion: Ability to band together when under pressure to deliver first class results to clients Transparency: Open door policy Professional Development: On the job development and access to certifications in our Training practice Care and Support: On-going support and advice from experienced PM-Partners Consultants Knowledge: Access to PM-Partners Delivery and Advisory practicesIf you feel you meet our selection criteria and are looking to join a leading Project Management Consultancy, please submit your resume to Steve Brewer at PM-Partners via Seek application (preferable) or email – stevebr@pm-partners.com.au

Job DescriptionAbout VisoryVisory empowers SME’s by connecting them with experts to supercharge their back office. It’s where a powerful platform, a dedicated team of experts, and actionable business insights come together in one place to transform how businesses manage their financial performance.Through people and technology, we provide a digital first back-office finance solution that allows business owners to focus on big-picture business growth.Launched in early 2020, we are a fast-growing early stage start-up that wants to make a lasting impression on how businesses handle their back-office. Our small, yet ambitious team has grown significantly in the last 12 months and consists of talented individuals across finance, customer success, product, and engineering. We are a diverse and geographically distributed team that is customer and technology obsessed. We value a people first mindset; a mindset not bound by limits that allows us to search for opportunities where others don’t. The Opportunity This is an opportunity to lead Visory’s mission to enable data driven insights and business transformation for all our customers.We believe that reporting falls shorts for most businesses, we are here to change that.The Business Insights and Transformation Lead will drive a business build, leading the development and execution of a new service and product. They will work with customers to understand their key drivers and derive solutions that unlock valuable business insights for SME’s to action, improving their business. In addition, they will work cross-functionally to provide critical inputs to our Product and Engineering teams that will underpin the build of our insights and analytics tool.  What you’ll do: Service Design & Go To Market Work with customers to understand product/market fit Use product/market fit to develop our go to market strategy for “Insights” Understand how much customers are willing to pay for our “Insights” product and associated services Put a commercial model around the product which a) has acceptable unit economics b) has a strong vision for how we can improve these unit economics with automation and efficiency Understand how we connect insights to implementation and thus new services for our customers Service Delivery Work directly with customers in multiple capacities: Provide analysis of key reporting and valuable advice to customers that highlight business risks and opportunities Suggest measures for businesses to implement this advice, improving their business. Track these measures through to value realisation Author and present these findings in standard business format which can be used to create an education library on different topics for business improvement. Through this process, help create a content asset library for Visory Reach a level of product penetration for the “Insights” offering to the existing customer base.  Grow revenue from new services and the Insights product Ensure all reporting, advice and any service delivery that is driven off the back off this is completed via our platform. Product Roadmap Work with our customers & product team to ensure a strong product vision is being communicated and developed Use learnings, to automate: Service delivery The financial pillar of the ‘Insights’ section of the product The advice collation, powered by data & delivered by our people Leadership Once the service design model is agreed and tested, build out a service delivery team to take over all direct customer engagements Lead and resource this team appropriately to scale with customer demand Lead and develop our ‘Insights’ mission, including reporting and definition of Objectives & Key Results  Role Requirements: Work experience in a management consulting or professional services environment with a consulting lens to developing financial solutions to problems for SME’sStrong commercial acumen and financial analysis skills (CFA or equivalent qualification preferred, but not mandatory)Strong analytical skills and the capacity to interpret qualitative and quantitative data, specifically financial dataThe capability to think, articulate and communicate logicallyStrong problem-solving ability applied in a structured wayExperience working cross-functionally to deliver complex technology led solutions What you might love about working at Visory: You’ll lead and drive the creation of a new product that will transform our offeringA flexible working environment, whether it’s picking up the kids from school or taking some time to enjoy the mid-day sunshine. We also have part-time options availableHigh autonomy where you determine how you help us achieve our goalsRemote first: We are a remote first team so the role can be based anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. We connect in person frequently to our co-located colleagues, whether this is for coffee or in one of our many workspaces across Australia and New Zealand. Of course, if you prefer an office environment you can utilise these workspaces as frequently as you like. Our ValuesPeople First – Empathy and humility over all elseNo limits mindset - Fear of failure? It’s low around here. When we fail, we fail fastHonesty - Constructive confrontation and continuous feedback is keyResults driven - We are output focused and don’t respect superficialityResilience - We value grit: perseverance is our “middle name”Integrity - We always do what’s right, not what’s convenient What to consider before applying:We’re a small start-up that is growing very quicklyWe are new at this and it’s likely we will make mistakes along the wayAt times, we are building the bike while riding itWe won’t handhold you - We have a highly autonomous environment. However, this doesn’t mean we don’t work as a teamWe offer unvarnished honesty and love continuous feedback. Our Hiring Process:1. Our first introduction – 30-minute phone call2. Getting to know you in more detail– 1-hour MS Teams call3. Understanding your technical skills – 1-hour MS Teams call (1 or 2 interviews may be required)4. Decision   www.visory.com.au

About the opportunity  The Australia Defence Force (ADF) Health Services contract allows Bupa to provide health support to 85,000 ADF personnel across 59 facilities. This includes integrated workforce providing health services such as primary and occupational healthcare, dental, physiotherapy, mental health and psychology services, pharmacy, occupational rehabilitation and health administration. As well pathology, imaging and radiology, vocational rehabilitation, mental health, hospital, specialist, allied health, patient transport and other off base services enabled by Bupa systems.  Reporting to the Senior Manager - Data & Analytics, the Senior Analyst - Data & Analytics is responsible for leading the development of analytic products to improve longitudinal health outcomes for ADF personnel and value for Joint Health Command (JHC).   How will I help?  Key accountabilities include: Development of data solutions that meet the stakeholder expectations and align with the data strategy for Bupa ADF.Trouble-shoot stakeholders' data and analytics problems, produce effective solutions and deliver resultsDevelopment of data models/solutions, Power BI dashboards and reporting and actionable Insights using Analytical models to drive business improvementsManagement of a pipeline of Analytics work across Bupa ADFPrepare data for reporting and complete any data mining needed to prepare new fields or measures.Develop predictive models to support reporting and enhance data-driven business decision making.Maintain relationships with key staff across Health Services to understand their business problems and offer recommendations for where analytics could help solve issues or offer insights. What's in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements, you'll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will collaborate strongly with colleagues who are committed to delivering exceptional experiences. We trust, respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk highlights: Discount on our health insurance, travel, car, home, contents, and pet insurance products as well as Bupa services such as Dental and OpticalA 'People First' wellness program - SMILE. Provides a range of services such as health coaches, annual skin checks and flu vaccinations, assistance with nutrition, mental and general well-being guides and product discounts. You will feel happier & healthier for working at Bupa! What do I need? Highly experienced in data analytics, data quality, data warehousing and reporting with expertise in analysing data sets, quantitative analysis, data mining, predictive modelling and creating data visualisations3+ years technical knowledge and skills across the Microsoft Data Platforms & Data Analytics and using SQL to extract and manipulate data for reporting and insights. Plus 2+ years of experience using Microsoft Power BI (including DAX coding)Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or a related quantitative fieldStrong business acumen with strong written and verbal communication skills & ability to engage stakeholders at all levels and facilitate meetings, present to large groups, teach technical concepts, and coachCollaborative approach to work, professional maturity, ability to work independently with minimal supervisionYou must be an Australian citizen and be able to attain and maintain a baseline security clearance from the Defence security and vetting service. What is it like to work there?  Bupa is a world leading Health & Care organisation with over 22,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. In Australia, we help to take care of people through our leading health insurance services as well as providing a personalised approach to care through our modern Dental clinic network, our Bupa Optical stores, Bupa Medical Visa services and over 70 Bupa Aged Care Homes. Bupa Therapy, along with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa, your wellbeing, identity and own story is respected and valued.

As one of Australia’s largest listed companies, we’re proud of our longstanding contribution to Australians. Wesfarmers achievements are deeply rooted in the desire to continually reinvent ourselves for the brands we stand behind, destinations that many Aussies call home. Think retailers like Bunnings, Kmart, Target, Catch and Officeworks. Our work doesn’t stop there, we operate in the industrials sector which supplies the nation with chemicals, energy and fertilisers, and industrial and safety products. Join the team of industry leaders in our Advanced Analytics Centre With plans to transform the Australian retail and industrial landscape, comes a big responsibility. We see a future where we are leaders in the data and digital space. It’s why we’ve been working hard to accelerate the development of data, digital and analytics capabilities across our businesses. We’re building a shared data asset for strategic use cases, right in the heart of Melbourne at our Advanced Analytics Centre – a space designed for the best and brightest as they shape our data and digital journey.We’re focused on harnessing the power of data and transforming it into meaningful insights that enhance our customer experience, strengthen our businesses, and help them pursue new growth opportunities. That’s where you come in.This is a full time/permanent position based in our brand-new Melbourne CBD offices. What you’ll be doing You will work end to end with our team of data experts with a stronger focus on providing insights and deriving meaning from the data. Information gathering, querying the data and analysing it will be a key part of your role. You will have the freedom to express your views and insights to help our businesses and advanced analytics centre thrive.What you’ll need Demonstrated experience with SQL and writing SQL scripts.Commercial experience reflecting that of a mid-level to senior Data Analyst.End-to-end experience with a focus on providing insights.Strong back end focused experience in the last couple of years.Python or R coding skills will be highly regarded as this is a mid/senior level role.Good presentation skills and the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Excellent communication skills with a curious nature. We encourage applicants to show their passion for analytics.Nice to have’s Consulting experience.Experience with programming languagesSound knowledge of the Cloud.Experience working in the retail sector.Experience with customer data and analyticsWhy we think you’ll love working hereWith us you’ll: Accelerate our data journey. We’ve worked hard at building an environment for you to lead change. It’s an opportunity to intellectually stretch yourself as you work with one of the largest data sets in the country on a variety of complex problems that will make a big impact.Be backed to succeed. With data and digital being a key priority for our CEO and our company having a clear data-driven vision, your work is more than an initiative, it’s a game changer. In addition, you’ll have access to leading-edge technology and be encouraged and supported in your development, which enables you to achieve great things.Work with the best and brightest. In a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve results.Benefit from variety and balance. Combine your thought-leading approach and hands-on expertise as you collaborate on projects across our businesses. Owning your craft, this role allows you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work and life.Our culture We’re results focused, but we’re a business that cares. Here we are less about titles and more about everyone playing a valuable role. We provide autonomy and space with freedom to operate, quickly learning from mistakes because we know they are part of the way forward. We’re curious, open minded, and collaborative. And although we’re thought leaders, we’re humble, and willing to share knowledge and learn from one another. Next steps If this sounds like your next career move, then combine your cover letter and resume into one document and click on the ‘Apply’ button by 30 January 2022. Please note that we may commence interviewing of candidates prior to this closing date. For brief enquiries please contact Human Resources at iramphul@wesfarmers.com.au.We’re hiring the best and the brightest talent in Australia. Let’s start to explore the possibilities of achieving great things together. For more information, visit our website at https://www.wesfarmers.com.au/util/careers/data-and-digital-careers

Marketing Data Analyst

Permanent role
Flexible location

About the role
The Marketing Science Analyst should help shape strategic marketing agenda by supporting the Marketing Science Lead and Marketing Science Operations Lead in generating and delivering insightful analysis highlighting potential opportunities to deliver growth, maximise ROI and connect marketing performance with business outcomes.
The Marketing Science Analyst will play a key role across the marketing science value chain in processing data for analysis, building models, and creating presentations that communicate impactful insights and putting forward actionable recommendations to marketing stakeholders.
Key Duties

Development of innovative and proactive marketing performance insights using expertise in data mining and analysis tools.
Unify analytics with business acumen to partner with internal stakeholders to work through challenging marketing planning decisions and unique business questions
Responsible for developing models and tools, identifying and creating models to help understand, monitor, and predict marketing outcomes. Eg. Make and optimize budget, channel and media mix decisions, understand the impact of a marketing activity on sales, forecast the impact of budgeting, brand and competitor activity on business outcomes.
Harmonise, process, and analyse data to develop presentations which address marketing & business challenges
Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines
Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of solving complex business problems. Collaborate with internal & external partners to help develop new tools and capabilities
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key management groups particularly Technology, Customer & Market Insights, Finance and Portfolio teams.  
Support the maintenance and improvement of processes used to collect, retrieve, and interpret data.
Handle large and complex marketing data using different applications.
You will be expected to work closely with marketing teams to help them understand the impact of decisions on potential results and to generate unique insights that ‘solve the puzzle’ of what drives performance.
Establish strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders and agencies identifying shared goals, removing blockages, and enabling collaboration.
Manage stakeholder expectations and act as an advocate for marketing science practices.

About You

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Actuarial Studies, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)
1-2 years of experience with marketing mix modelling, digital media analysis, business focused analytics, advertising effectiveness analysis, quantitative market research or other related client insights experience.
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel; other tools such as SQL & R a plus but not required.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience working independently to identify themes across data points and the ability to communicate a story with the data.
Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics.
An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions.
The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally.
Strong verbal and written communication skills suitable for audiences all at levels of the business (Brand Managers, EGMs, CEOs, Board).

Technical Competencies

Graduate in marketing or computer science
Strong numeracy and analytical skills
Demonstrated experience using data mining tools
Passion for data interpretation and optimisation
Experience with relational databases and analysing large quantities of marketing data
Exposure to Dashboard development desired
Team player, creative and passionate
Ability to multi-task while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail and organization
Outstanding presentation and communication skills
Comfort dealing with large amounts of data on a regular basis
Evidence of using and applying data to aid decision making and analysis
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast-changing environment
Demonstrated ability to work independently in processing data and communicating insights.
Experience with tag management platforms, Excel, APIs, etc. will be highly regarded.

multiple_details: Experience in data & analytics is essential!
Description:
G8 Education is an ASX 300 organisation and leading provider of quality early education and care services. Owning over 450 Centres and with over 10,000 team members, we are continually expanding and looking to grow and strengthen our network.
About the role:
To provide value added insights to the business that lead to optimal business decisions. Provide in-depth strategic and analytical information in the areas of operations, customer, network growth and portfolio performance management. Build and maintain reports to track key performance indicators.
Key responsibilities include:
• Use Power BI to understand, interpret, and blend large volumes of data from different sources• Use Power BI to build company-wide reports and model data for analysis• Using data analytics to generate insights in the areas of customer experience, operations, marketing and team• Undertake regular reviews of existing portfolio for demographic, economic and commercial drivers• Produce documentation of results and findings, interpret and present back to the business, including to the executive management • Providing relevant and accurate analytical review of the Group’s data and key performance metrics • Creating efficiencies in reporting methodologies• Work with the rest of the FP&A team in developing G8’s data strategy including data dictionary, data integrity rules, documentation requirements, and master data file management• Business partner with departments within the other areas of the business to provide reporting and analytics to drive increased revenue and lower costs• Present information using Power BI to a range of levels in the organisation including executive management
 
Essential Criteria:
• 4+ years’ experience in a similar role• Undergraduate qualifications in finance, business, or a related discipline• High attention to detail• Problem solving skills• High level understanding of data and experience of blending large volumes of data from different sources• Prior experience in extracting, integrating, manipulating, and displaying data from various systems using automation where possible• Power BI experience highly desirable• A good communicator across all levels of the business• Presentation skills • Ability to plan and prioritise workload • Advanced level of Excel modelling skills• Early education sector experience desired • Natural curiosity to ask questions of the data and look for insights• Basic to intermediate SQL knowledge desired
 
Benefits Include:
• Attractive salary package• Generous discount on childcare fees • Exclusive access to our employee benefits program covering a wide range of discounts and promotions • Dedicated focus on professional growth and development
This is a rare opportunity; if you want a diverse, challenging and personally fulfilling role, apply now!
Please note the advertising closing date is indicative only. G8 Education reserves the right to close the advertisement before this date is reached. Therefore, it is encouraged that you submit your application as soon as possible. G8 Education is a committed advocate for child protection, safety and wellbeing. We have a zero tolerance for any form of child abuse or harm. The safety and wellbeing of children will always be our priority and all team members are expected to embrace this shared commitment.G8 Education is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all who attend the premises that it operates. This includes accepting responsibility to provide, so far as is reasonably practicable, a workplace that is safe and without risk to health for all team members, children and members of the broader community. G8 Education requires all employees to have received both vaccinations by 31st January 2022 (or hold a medical exemption), all new employees joining the organisation will also need to meet this requirement.

Company: Catholic Education Office, Diocese of Parramatta
Description:
Catholic Education – Diocese of Parramatta (CEDP) is a system of schools committed to responding to the needs of students in a world that is changing rapidly. With 5000 passionate employees located across 83 primary and secondary schools, our purpose is to transform the learning and unlock the full potential of each of our 40,000 plus students. We are always on the lookout for top talent to help us achieve our strategic goal of inspiring the future, through quality catholic schooling and by strengthening the professional lives of our employees.
The internal People & Culture function at CEDP is undergoing a transformation. With a focus on delivering efficient services across school, head office and leadership teams, we are seeking HRIS Analyst to join our team.
About the opportunity:
This newly established role sits within our passionate People & Culture team. The focus of your role will be to drive analytics and insights to influence the People & Culture strategy. More specifically you will:

Partner with key stakeholders to develop specific reports to pull specific data relating to key challenges to meet the demands of the business
Develop and implement data collection systems and reporting frameworks and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality to meet system needs
Interpret data, analyse results and provide business-friendly, actionable reporting and insights
Identify, analyse and interpret trends or patterns relating to key workforce indicators in complex datasets
Respond to reporting and data analysis
Provide executive, annual and ad-hoc reporting requests
Maintain the integrity and quality of the data in CEDP systems and project deliverables
Ensure accurate, timely and secure data management to support self-service analytics
Combine data from internal and external systems to create meaningful workforce insights

About you:

Tertiary qualifications in the relevant area of study
Ability to work across large scale application systems such as (SAP, Success Factors, Oracle, Salesforce or similar)
Ability to work independently and adapt to change
A valid Working With Children Check for paid work 

Interested?
CEDP promotes the safety and wellbeing of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children, and children from culturally and/or linguistically diverse backgrounds. About us
Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) is one of the world’s leading wine companies.  We know that it’s the thinkers, makers and doers who have the most impact as we continue to strive towards being recognised as the world’s most admired premium wine company.  We are proud of our portfolio of brands that have tremendous heritage, rich quality and a reputation for excellence across the globe.  From the iconic luxury of Penfolds, to the broad appeal of Lindeman’s and newer brands like 19 Crimes, we are committed to creating memorable wine experiences for our consumers.
About the role:
Reporting to the Supply Sustainability Manager, the purpose of this role is to support the business and functions by ensuring relevant processes and systems are implemented to ensure compliance to regulations and effective management and integrity of Sustainability Data globally. 
Focusing on our sustainability data, systems and reporting. It will play a critical part in transforming TWE systems and data and analytics capability. This role will directly support the empowerment of our business leaders with data and insights to support better decisions, improve processes and ensure we improve our environmental and overall sustainability footprint.

Continually refine and improve our approach to data collection to ensure consistent, complete, and accurate global sustainability data 
Build a culture and process to support an enhanced focus on data
Lead the manipulation, collation and reporting of data to build stakeholder confidence and engagement
Ensure our approach, process methodology is compliant with relevant technical standards and meets reporting requirements
Conduct verification to ensure accurate data and insights to meet internal and external reporting requirements 
Managing external assurance and drive programs that respond to opportunities for improvement
Lead the development, implementation and transition to a more mature reporting system 
Deliver core environmental and sustainability systems improvements to support strategic initiatives
Actively support TWE continuous improvement and change management processes 
Develop next level analytics including analysing and generating reports of trends, gaps and opportunities to improve performance
Building and developing robust, sustainable and effective analytical solutions

About you
With a Bachelor's Degree in environmental sciences or science related field you will have proven experience in sustainability focused role in either consulting or a corporate organisation.
Expert user of environmental reporting systems including implementation and development of a supportive culture and processes
Strong experience working in data and analytical disciplines including systems such as Power BI and Power APPS. Able to clearly explain insights and develop action plans to respond to improvement opportunities
Expert knowledge of relevant environmental regulations, policies and technical standards. and ability to apply them effectively to data 
Demonstrated success in delivering effective and high-performance analytical solutions.
Good communication skills and the ability to engage with various stakeholders.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including influencing skills.
Experience in improvement methodologies and approaches such as Lean is advantageous
What’s in it for you
Financial Review Boss Best Places to Work winner 2021
Access to the world’s most admired wines through our employee product allowance
True flexibility in determining how, when and where you work to achieve your potential
Global opportunities across Australia & New Zealand, the US, Asia, UK/Europe
Opportunity to build a career across multiple functions (we’re really good at doing this!)
Structured development programs to support your health, wellbeing and career
“TWEforME Day” – an additional day of leave each year, for you to do you
Meeting-free Monday mornings (we all love this!)

Culture
We bring our whole selves, we’re courageous and we deliver together – that’s our DNA.  We’re a passionate bunch who enjoy working together, like to have fun and keep things down-to-earth.  We’re brave enough and care enough to have the right conversations to get the best outcome and are famous for our can-do attitude.  We’re definitely “glass half full” people and see challenges as opportunities and move with pace to achieve our goals.
If you’re ready to help us be the world’s most admired premium wine company, please apply now!

Inclusion and Diversity
Just like the wide range and variety of brands in our wine portfolio, TWE embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or on the basis of disability.  If you require any assistance to be included in our process, please contact recruitment@tweglobal.com [link removed], quoting the job title and reference number.



How to apply
We move quickly at TWE and continually review applications, so if you don’t want to miss out, apply today.  Note that we prefer to deal with you directly; we haven’t briefed a recruitment agency on this role and won’t be accepting CVs through any recruitment agency, so please apply directly.
In light of COVID-19, we are frequently reviewing our recruitment processes.  Right now, we are conducting all interviews virtually.  This is a fluid situation and we will adapt our processes as we need to with any government guidelines or regulations.

Marketing Data Analyst

Permanent role
Flexible location

About the role
The Marketing Science Analyst should help shape strategic marketing agenda by supporting the Marketing Science Lead and Marketing Science Operations Lead in generating and delivering insightful analysis highlighting potential opportunities to deliver growth, maximise ROI and connect marketing performance with business outcomes.
The Marketing Science Analyst will play a key role across the marketing science value chain in processing data for analysis, building models, and creating presentations that communicate impactful insights and putting forward actionable recommendations to marketing stakeholders.
Key Duties

Development of innovative and proactive marketing performance insights using expertise in data mining and analysis tools.
Unify analytics with business acumen to partner with internal stakeholders to work through challenging marketing planning decisions and unique business questions
Responsible for developing models and tools, identifying and creating models to help understand, monitor, and predict marketing outcomes. Eg. Make and optimize budget, channel and media mix decisions, understand the impact of a marketing activity on sales, forecast the impact of budgeting, brand and competitor activity on business outcomes.
Harmonise, process, and analyse data to develop presentations which address marketing & business challenges
Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines
Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of solving complex business problems. Collaborate with internal & external partners to help develop new tools and capabilities
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key management groups particularly Technology, Customer & Market Insights, Finance and Portfolio teams.  
Support the maintenance and improvement of processes used to collect, retrieve, and interpret data.
Handle large and complex marketing data using different applications.
You will be expected to work closely with marketing teams to help them understand the impact of decisions on potential results and to generate unique insights that ‘solve the puzzle’ of what drives performance.
Establish strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders and agencies identifying shared goals, removing blockages, and enabling collaboration.
Manage stakeholder expectations and act as an advocate for marketing science practices.

About You

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Actuarial Studies, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)
1-2 years of experience with marketing mix modelling, digital media analysis, business focused analytics, advertising effectiveness analysis, quantitative market research or other related client insights experience.
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel; other tools such as SQL & R a plus but not required.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience working independently to identify themes across data points and the ability to communicate a story with the data.
Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics.
An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions.
The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally.
Strong verbal and written communication skills suitable for audiences all at levels of the business (Brand Managers, EGMs, CEOs, Board).

Technical Competencies

Graduate in marketing or computer science
Strong numeracy and analytical skills
Demonstrated experience using data mining tools
Passion for data interpretation and optimisation
Experience with relational databases and analysing large quantities of marketing data
Exposure to Dashboard development desired
Team player, creative and passionate
Ability to multi-task while demonstrating a high level of attention to detail and organization
Outstanding presentation and communication skills
Comfort dealing with large amounts of data on a regular basis
Evidence of using and applying data to aid decision making and analysis
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to fast-changing environment
Demonstrated ability to work independently in processing data and communicating insights.
Experience with tag management platforms, Excel, APIs, etc. will be highly regarded.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst Salesforce - NSW Government
Description: Senior Data Analyst Salesforce - NSW GovernmentLocation: Parramatta, Sydney, with great WFH flexibilityRate: $900 - $980 per day + SuperContract Length: 12 monthsNote: Must have extensive prior experience as a Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst working with Salesforce.We are currently seeking experienced Salesforce Data Analysts for our NSW Government client who will be responsible for design and enhancement of Salesforce dashboards for the Department and wider Executive teams.Keys to Role: - You have extensive prior experience as a Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst working with Salesforce. - You have a track record of working consultatively with colleagues to meet stakeholder expectations while providing a professional, consistent and reliable approach to customer service. - You manage competing priorities in a high demand environment, and manage stakeholder expectations about analysis outcomes, including with staff and stakeholders who may not have a background in data analysis.- You have prior experience implementing, or working to a well-defined Reporting Process and Data Governance Framework.The OpportunityRight now, we have an opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst (Salesforce) to join us for a 12-month contract in a new customer-focused directorate. Following a review of a critical, customer-facing business process, a large program of work has commenced to redesign process, policy and procedure, and enhance the accessibility, visibility and governance of customer data to drive improvement initiatives.The primary purpose of the role is to design (or enhance) Salesforce dashboards for the Department and wider Executive teams, lead the implementation of a Reporting Process and Data Governance Framework, and support the directorate by creating reports and analysing data from the Salesforce CRM as required. You will: * Lead the design and implementation of dashboards for executives at the Department and the School level via a consultative process. * Lead the development of additional levels of themes in the Salesforce CRM to enhance the usefulness of the current data, and work with the operational teams to ensure they are implemented effectively. * Support the development of detailed business cases and customer satisfaction surveys by extracting and analysing data from the Salesforce CRM as required. * Lead the development and implementation of a Reporting Process and 'front door' system for reports. * Lead the implementation of a Data Governance Framework.

About DUALDriven by a vision to be the world’s best underwriting business, DUAL has always taken a different approach to our industry peers.Since our business was founded in 2004, we have had a strong entrepreneurial spirit that runs through every part of our business. We empower our people to develop products, services and processes that deliver consistently for our partners. As a company we’re known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events. Whatever you are looking for in a career, we want to help you do more.Our philosophy is simple: we genuinely put people first and want our people to be the healthiest and happiest they can be, at work and at home. We aim to attract and retain the best talent, and support them to achieve their aspirations. It’s how we grow our business and keep one step ahead of our competitors.About the Role We’re looking for an experienced Portfolio Analyst to join our Commercial Team in Sydney. This role will assist in the collection and analysis of data from DUAL systems and databases to create policy, premium and claims reports for analysis and distribution to the wider business on a monthly and ad hoc basis.  This role also ensures a smooth operation by constant process improvement. In this role you will be responsible for;Compiling data to monitor and report on the portfolio performance, synthesizing data into appropriate and concise insightsConduct regular and ad-hoc analysis of the portfolio, including the identification of exposures , variation from target and the preparation of communications to convey findingsExecuting regular templated premium and claims reports to share with Senior Stakeholders in the businessSupporting the maintenance, monitoring and continuous improvement of data analysis files, ongoing review of underpinning assumptions and process documentationProviding analytical support for the development and implementation of portfolio strategies, perform analysis of risk appetite and underwriting rules and adherence to risk appetiteDesign and development of reports on data visualization Platforms such as Power BI.About YouYou will be confident in working independently across multiple systems and tasks and with large volumes of data. As a detail-orientated individual you will have experience in cross referencing files to identify discrepancies and advanced Microsoft Word and Excel skills, allow you to present data and reports in professional formats. You will also:Be a friendly, collaborative team player who is also an independent thinkerHave strong problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to detail, complemented with intellectual curiosityHave great interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and collaborate with different stakeholders across the businessPossess a robust analytical skill set, be deadline-driven, organised and able to multitask Have 2 years of relevant working experience in large volume transaction business, in a role with demonstrably translatable skills.Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications including Power BIAdvanced data skills such as Power Query, SQL would be preferredSalary and BenefitsAt DUAL we value work/life balance, health and wellbeing, family and giving back, which is why our benefits are reflective of this. We provide employees with a competitive salary and benefits, which will be flexible and dependent on the successful candidate’s individual skills and experience. How to ApplyAre you the right fit for this role and the DUAL Team? Tell us why in a short paragraph that you share along with your Resume to our HR Team. Find out moreTo find out more about DUAL Australia including who we are, what we’re up to and what we’re about, head to the DUAL Australia website or visit us on our LinkedIn page. EEO Statement Help us think differently. As a business we’re on a journey to build an inclusive workplace where our people feel welcome to bring their whole and true self to work, where differences are accepted and where our words and actions are inclusive. Together we are learning, sharing stories, and achieving change.

Information Technology Services (ITS) delivers digital solutions that enable the Australian National University to achieve its strategic goals: a student experience equal to the world’s best, and research that transforms society and creates national capability.  ITS has responsibility for the University’s digital ecosystem and is leading the delivery of the Digital Master Plan, a 10-year strategic roadmap for the transformation of the University’s digital capability.  
About this role 
Are you looking to take the next step in your career, have a solid foundation in Data Integration Analysis? ITS is seeking a suitably qualified, highly motivated individual with a successful record of achievements as a data integration analyst.

A cover letter or ‘pitch’ describing how your skills, experience and approach align with the role - maximum 2 pages.

About the OrganisationOur client is a large Federal Government Department looking to engage a high performing APS6 Data Analyst for a 6 month contract, with possible extension.The roleThe Issue Strings project (the project) is based within the Business Intelligence and Quality Improvement (BIQI) Team within the Complaints Management and Education Branch (CMEB).The CMEB provides a high-quality parliamentary complaint resolution and Public Interest Disclosure service to the public. The BIQI Team is responsible for managing the Office’s business intelligence function through reporting. We support business areas across the Office to access and utilise data and analytics through Power BI.The goal of the project is to improve our current data taxonomy through the development and implementation of a consistent set of issue strings across the Office. Additionally, the project aims to introduce governance mechanisms for the development of future issue strings.Ideal candidate:We are seeking an individual with experience in reporting, who has strong skills in excel, live case management databases, and Power BI or similar analytical reporting tools. The individual will work autonomously with some guidance, as part of a small geographically dispersed team. The individual will use their research skills and stakeholder engagement skills to identify, propose and implement an improved data taxonomy. The individual will also use their strong excel and analytical skills to map existing issue strings to new issue strings. The individual will use their knowledge of live case management databases to implement the new issue strings into our case management system, Resolve.Key duties:Review how issues have been used in internal and external reporting and identify issues to be remedied.In consultation with stakeholders where required, develop a small number of high-level, systemic issues to be used for data across the Office.Define sub-issues based on the current agency- and organisation-specific issues.Modify the current issue string hierarchy to fit the new high-level issues and changed hierarchy.Update Resolve (the case management system) with the new issue strings.Run a Pilot of the testing of the new issue strings and remedy any issues where required.Map the new issue string hierarchy against the current issue string hierarchy for the purposes of Power BI reporting.Introduce a governance framework for introducing new issues and develop user guidance for the use of the new issue strings where required.Hhow to ApplyShould you be interested on this role please send your cv via SEEK or call Francesca Avelluto on 0261627332 for a confidential discussion (or email favelluto@dfp.com.au)DFP welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability. In addition, DFP will provide reasonable adjustments for individuals with disability throughout the recruitment process. If you identify as a person with disability and require adjustments to the application, recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise via adjustments@dfp.com.au or 1300 337 000 and indicate your preferred method of communication (email, phone, text) so we can keep in touch and meet your accessibility needs.Note: You may be required to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination status.

Job Title: Public Health Intelligence Inbox Coordinator, Reporting & Insights
Description:
Application Closes: 08 February 2022
Role: Public Health Intelligence Inbox Coordinator, Reporting & Insights (Fixed term - Full time until 30 June 2022)
Number of vacancies available: 1
Office Location(s): 50 Lonsdale Street/Work from home
Position Summary: 
The Public Health Intelligence (PHI) Inbox team operates as the central point of contact for requests relating to COVID-19 data, reports and epidemiological advice.
This role undertakes a customer-focused approach in the coordination of COVID-19 requests including ensuring stakeholder expectations are being both managed and responded to in a timely manner. 
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders to continuously improve service delivery and enhance operational standards.
Responsibilities 

Coordination and distribution of key information and advice to identified stakeholders on a range of COVID-19 public health issues. 
Operate as an effective team member by delivering quality, timely and effective customer service to a range of stakeholders.

Promote and develop relationships and linkages with key areas across the Data, Intelligence, Modelling and Epidemiology branch within the COVID-19 Public Health Division.

Undertake administrative tasks to support the successful operation of the PHI inbox team's objectives including ensuring all enquiries and requests are appropriately prioritised, managed and reported in a timely manner.
Contribute to the full life cycle of projects to meet departmental objectives including:

a)     Assisting in research, analysis and implementation of projects based on defined outcomes and outputs.
b)     Supporting the development and delivery of projects or sub-projects and their successful delivery and completion within resourcing, timeline and budget parameters. 
c)     Contributing to the monitoring and evaluation of projects to ensure departmental objectives are met.

Where responsible for overseeing, monitoring or delivering projects, ensure they are delivered in accordance with relevant legislation and government regulations, guidelines and standard operating procedures. 
Keep accurate and complete records of your work activities in accordance with legislative requirements and the department's records, information security and privacy policies and requirements.
Demonstrate how the actions and outcomes of this role and work unit impact clients and the department's ability to deliver, or facilitate the delivery of, effective support and services.
Other duties as required.

Mandatory Vaccination policy:
The department is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its workers and clients. As it is an essential element of any role within the department that employees be able to attend work onsite and to do so safely, employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of their employment. This requirement applies unless they have a medical condition which means they cannot be vaccinated against COVID -19. Therefore, the department will ask any prospective employee, who has been identified as the preferred candidate for a role within the department, to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status prior to any offer of employment being made.  If a prospective employee has a relevant medical condition which means they cannot be vaccinated against COVID-19, they should contact the department to discuss their individual circumstances.
 
HOW TO APPLY:
Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.
Please note: For this position, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document.
Preferred candidates will be required to complete pre-employment screening, including a national police check and misconduct screening.
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.
For further information please visit the Department of Health <https://www.vic.gov.au/department-health>
Click 'Apply Now' to submit your interest in this position.
