We are a business who is crazy about customers. We use disruptive thinking every day to ensure that we are capturing every opportunity to deliver the ultimate experience to our customers and people.We empower our people to Do it. Own it. Love it and that’s why they choose to work for us.Here, it’s never just a job – We care about what we do and the impact we have, and that’s what connects us.Whoever you are, you'll fit right into our team of 1,400 different personalities. We’ll support you to be the best you can be here at Vocus and at home.What's the opportunity? Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you will be responsible for the creation and development of business-analytics products (using Salesforce and Tableau), reports, and ad-hoc decision models. This is a hands-on role which will require ongoing use of SQL database and OLAP technologies, visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau), and best-practice modelling (e.g., machine-learning, statistical modelling, spreadsheet-engineered-decision models) to support the design, build and enhancement of data visualizations, reports and future analytics products to support business decisions. The purpose of this role is to enable data-driven decisions across Vocus Enterprise Sales through the manipulation of raw datasets, the development of visualisations that communicate meaningful insights and the creation of ad-hoc-decision models (e.g., best-practice-designed spreadsheets that foster quantitative decision making). The successful candidate will display a cultural fit with the wider Sales Enablement team, especially in displaying a growth-mindset and eagerness to provide great service to its customers in the Enterprise and Government Sales Team. What are the responsibilities?  Design and development of data visualisations for creating meaningful insights (using Salesforce and Tableau CRM). Data modelling and analysis. Building best-practice-engineered-spreadsheet models that support strategic and tactical business decisions. Development of presentations and reports. Gathering business requirements and other technical documentation for future analytics-based products. End-to-end solution delivery: from concept, prototyping through to production.  What you will need to be successful:  An analytical mind with both a problem-finding and problem-solution focus. Experience in designing and developing data visualisations and dashboards Creative and open-minded, with the ability to think both divergently (ideas/hypotheses) and convergently (narrow down a solution and execute on deliverables). Knowledge of Salesforce, Tableau CRM, SQL database and OLAP technologies, best-practice-spreadsheet engineering (nice to have). Good experience with Powerpoint presentations  Ability to communicate clearly (via the written word and oral presentations). Experimental mindset (conceptualise, build, share, iterate and test to converge on a final product). Attention to detail, and a focus on cross-checking one’s work. Previous Telco experience is a bonus.  If this sounds right to you, don’t Go with the flow, Go with who you want, go with your gut, Go big, Go Vocus. Hit apply to start a journey you won’t regret.  The extra stuff we know you want to know  We know how to celebrate our wins and we know learning from our mistakes makes us better. We are all about flexible working and, hand on heart, we practise work life balance. We high five you on your work anniversary and give you a day off. We know time off is important for balance, so we have an option to buy more leave. We embrace your unique style and let you be a master of your own style with no dress code. This is just the tip of the iceberg, so jump on our careers site or LinkedIn to find out more!  #LI-VOC

Who are we? We are a not-for-profit organisation which has a vision for a world where all children can grow, learn, play and thrive in safe, nurturing and stable homes, schools and communities. It is our mission to support and educate families and communities in caring for vulnerable and displaced children. We also recruit, support, train and advocate for foster and kinship parents, guardians and adoptive parents from out-of-home care through our NSW-based program My Forever Family. The Role The Business and Data Analyst will assist with the implementation of projects to ensure data quality and data remediation both within and outside the organisation’s CRM.   You will have a good understanding of data management practices to ensure data integrity and a high quality of information within our CRM.  You will be creating reports and dashboards, performing analysis, downloading and cleaning data, contributing to formal reports, remediating data directly into Salesforce CRM, participating in system improvement projects, mapping processes and identifying improvements to processes. This is a part-time position of 3 days per week, on a fixed term contract to June 2022. To be considered for and ultimately be successful in this role, you will need to have:   1-2 years' experience as an Analyst Advanced Excel skills Experience working with Salesforce CRM Experience handling data sets Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Great attention to detail Strong listening and communication skills A Bachelor level degree in Business, Economics, Accounting or similar and/or experience in the human services sector will be highly regarded In exchange for your commitment and experience, we offer a family friendly and flexible working environment with attractive PBI salary packaging. There is flexibility in the role to work part of the time from home and part from the office.  If you want to be part of a committed and innovative team making a real difference to the welfare of children, have empathy, drive, and commitment to help us realise our organisational goals, plus a can-do attitude and innovative ideas, we’d love to hear from you. To find out more about your future team and our program, visit www.adoptchange.org.au  To be considered for roles with Adopt Change you will need to have (or be willing to undergo) a National Police Clearance and current Working with Children Check. Please ensure you have work rights in Australia. You will also need full Covid vaccinations complete, as this is a role that will include in-person meetings including time in the office.  Adopt Change is committed to building a workplace culture that supports diversity and inclusion. We work closely with Aboriginal partnership agencies in the community and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates. No agencies please - this role is being managed in-house.

Description:
Opportunity to work on a high impact transformation
Looking for experienced R programming specialists
Duration until 30 January 2023

Opportunity to work on a key program at the Reserve Bank of Australia, delivering a new analytics platform that will be at the core of our economic insights and reporting. 
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to work on a highly visible project involving a complex SQL multidimensional data warehouse, reporting and analytics solution for APRA-sourced data which is used to analyse and forecast liquidity and other nationally critical data in the Australian financial system.
You’ will be working with senior economists and IT program professionals to deliver a bespoke and high profile analytics and reporting system which is critical to the Bank’s work.
In this role you will:

Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to develop, maintain and optimise data collection and related statistical reporting to provide timely, accurate, and accessible data for economists' informed decision-making.
Independently assess and document current business standard and ad-hoc complex reporting and data analysis requirements including calculations.
Analyse and document user stories and business requirements for a new data analytics platform using agile based and traditional methods
based and traditional methods
Transform data from multiple sources using R programming to produce automated data analytics, visualisations and statistical reports.
Ensure ongoing data integrity, reporting data inconsistencies and resolving these in close collaboration with stakeholders.

Your team
This role is within the Financial System Group which monitors, researches and reports on the payments system and stability of the financial system.
You will work closely with mature and high performing cross-functional Scrum teams within the RBA and with APRA. The work environment is collaborative, friendly and supportive.
Your background
To be successful in this critical role you will possess:

Advanced experience designing and developing efficient code, functions and scripts that leverage data from multiple sources using R and SQL programming languages.
Ability to facilitate workshops or meetings with business and technical stakeholders and external parties at various levels.
Demonstrated experience in data extraction, manipulation and data management.
Advanced knowledge of database and business intelligence concepts and tools.
Any IT technology expertise involving solution design / database development desirable.
Strong written communication skills and concise and succinct communication style.

Your development & career
Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.
About the RBA
The RBA pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.
Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts. 
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

About the role?
Pen Underwriting have multiple contracts with local Australian Insurance companies and Lloyd’s of London, across Property, Liability, Motor, Construction and Professional Indemnity classes. 
The role of Insurance Data Analyst sits in Pen’s Technical division. This role will work with our portfolio managers in organizing and analysing insurance portfolio data, identifying key trends and measuring performance. The primary purpose of this role is to deliver quality insights on our insurance portfolios to help drive business strategy and direction.
 Key accountabilities include: 
Gather, prepare data and undertake detailed analytics of General Insurance portfolios – measuring performance loss ratios, business mix, exposure, rate movement
Monitor the effectiveness & impact of historical changes to portfolios – changes in business mix, rate increases, and changes in exposure. 
Develop and provide insights that drive strategic business decisions in relation to insurance portfolios
Become Pen data expert, driving continuous improvement across the business in data &analytics. Promote data & analytics to be at the core of decisions across the business
Ability to liaise with actuaries & insurance product specialists
Improve efficiencies through integration, automation, training, and self service

About you
We are looking for someone who has a solid background in Data and Analytics, ideally within the General Insurance industry.. Preferably the successful applicant would have experience with data extraction and cleansing, as well as proven analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills and the ability to work with stakeholders across the business.
To be successful in this role, you would be able demonstrate: 
Ability to present information and identify key observations/trends
Demonstrated experience applying knowledge gained through analysis to solving business and process problems 
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Microsoft Access, SQL, Crystal and Power BI preferred
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Why Pen?
Pen Underwriting are a specialty Underwriting Agency committed to providing our brokers with great products and service. We are recognised as one of Australia’s leading underwriting agencies and pride ourselves on our expertise and service.
Pen is owned by Gallagher, one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2021 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 10th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.
What will we offer?
At Pen, we provide all of our people with a rewarding opportunity to be part of a great team, to learn and develop in a safe and vibrant environment, to be challenged, but also supported.
Additional benefits:
Competitive remuneration and incentive program
Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances
Salary sacrifice options including additional leave
Flexible work policy
Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme
The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential
How to apply
We encourage you to apply via our careers website or for further information, please contact our Talent Acquisition team at careers@ajg.com.au [link removed]
Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.
Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.

Who are we?
Capricorn is a member-based financial services organisation which exists to improve the lives of over 24,000 Members across Australia and New Zealand by supporting them in building stronger automotive businesses. We provide products and services including trade credit, risk protection, equipment finance, trade events, travel services, fuel cards and more. Last financial year Member purchases exceeded $2.59 billion and Member returns exceeded $71 million.
The role and what we are looking for:
The Data Privacy Business Analyst is responsible for current state analysis and risk assessment and will work with business and technology stakeholders to deliver improved data privacy management processes and technical solutions.
Key responsibilities of the role will include:
         Work closely with technology and business SMEs to undertake analysis of current data and records assets and information systems and processes         Conduct SME workshops to elicit current state information         Work with key stakeholders to conduct privacy risk assessment and rating and solution prioritisation         Contribute to definition of privacy business benefits and metrics         With the Data Privacy Project Manager, work with technology platform and business owners to define and deliver sustainable data privacy management processes and technical solutions         Define the scope of data privacy management projects in collaboration with the Project Manager and key stakeholders         Develop functional requirements, specifications, and process documentation for data privacy solutions         Work with technology platforms and Solution Architects to formulate solution designs         Define acceptance criteria and validate testing outputs to ensure solution requirements are met
We're also looking for candidates with the following experience:
         Demonstrated knowledge of business analysis techniques and project methodologies         Experience in business analysis practices including process modelling         Ability to clearly articulate complex topics to a wide audience         Strong understanding of IT systems and operational data privacy requirements         Strong understanding of Australian and New Zealand privacy legislation         Advanced skills in Microsoft Office including Excel, Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Word         Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels

Proven experience with data privacy or data      management/governance initiatives 

A great place to work
When you join Capricorn, you join a community of people who enjoy coming to work and a company that genuinely invests in their employees. Our culture is one of our most valued assets, so when we recruit, we look for people that not only share our values but are also excited to celebrate our successes. It is our dedication to creating a great place to work, that has resulted in Capricorn being finalists in the AIMWA Pinnacle Awards for Human Resource Management Excellence for the last two consecutive years. 
Making Capricorn a great place to work is our commitment to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace in which everyone is treated fairly and with respect. We recognise diversity and inclusion as one of our most important resources and this is why we are committed to ensuring our work lives fit in with our personal lives. We offer our employees a flexible working environment, paid parental leave in addition to supporting employee’s individual circumstances. Other great benefits of working with Capricorn include ‘dress for your day’ dress code, wellness program, ability to purchase leave, access to a range of discounts, a fantastic reward and recognition program and plenty of social events to keep our team connected. 
The next steps
If you think you are the right person for this role and you believe in a Member first culture, then please apply now. Applications will be reviewed as they arrive, so it is better to apply sooner rather than later. If you need any assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact HR on (08) 6250 9500.
For further information and detail on Capricorn, please visit our website at www.capricorn.coop/careers.

Who is Evie Networks?    At Evie Networks our business is to accelerate the switch to sustainable electric transport to clean the air, reduce emissions and make our cities more liveable. Our electric vehicle charging solutions give people the freedom to go electric and go anywhere.  We value people who are creative and tenacious because it won’t be easy and there are many unknowns, but when we wake up each day we know our efforts contribute to shaping a new and emerging market, as well as making the world a better place.  We promote a collaborative and supportive work environment where everyone’s contribution is acknowledged and valued. We empower everyone to make a difference and therefore everyone should own a share of the business. We promote a healthy work-life balance because its good for us, our families and our business.     At Evie you’ll get involved in almost every aspect of what we do. You will be stretched, and you’ll learn and grow from the experience.  The Role The purpose of the Business Analyst in the Product team is to support all lines of business and functions at Evie to deliver products. The primary role is to provide analytical, process development and project management support. The position offers strong potential for progression to product management roles. As a member of the Product team, the BA must always be the voice of the customer within Evie Networks.   Being a key interface with the technology team and reporting to the Head of Product and co-founder, your role will include:     Collecting, analysing and deriving insight from market, customer and internal data to help design and improve products and processes. Designing, developing and tracking lean metrics for product performance. Scoping, developing, implementing and managing processes and tools in support of products. Turning process requirements into operational processes. Training and supporting Evie staff and stakeholders in Evie business processes. Leading continuous improvement activities to improve process, product and customer service. Project management including integrating process requirements.  The Person You’re goal orientated, have a sense of urgency and your nature is to challenge the status quo. The electric vehicle market in Australia is still largely uncharted territory which means your passion to make a difference, desire to use your initiative and continuous focus on excellence will ensure your success in this new role.    What you need to be successful:  Up to 5 years experience in business analysis Strong process and numerical skills Good general technical and commercial understanding  Excellent communications, teamworking, networking and interpersonal relationship skills Ability to work with cross-functional teams Bachelors degree in relevant field, e.g. engineering, science, technology, product management or marketing  Prefer to haves:  Demonstrated success in process design, implementation and analysis Experience in user testing and project management Experience in flowcharting and graphical tools Energy, automotive or transportation industry experience would be ideal Proficiency with business intelligence and visualisation tools eg. Microsoft BI, Google Data Studio, Tableau or Matlab will be an advantage. Coding skills including Python, Javascript and SQL will be an advantage     An opportunity where you have a direct impact on Australia’s sustainability and environment is rare!    An attractive package with generous bonus schemes is on offer along with the opportunity to become a shareholder; now that’s unique! Make your mark in this essential and growing industry.    If you’re not afraid to grow and learn from your customers, and are passionate about working for a company who is rapidly growing, fun, adaptable and always open to new ideas, then apply now! Please include a cover letter outlining where your skills and approach match our mission.    For further information please contact Tiffany Villaluz on 0412 722 869.    Successful candidate will be subject to police clearance

Job Title: Public Health Intelligence Inbox Coordinator, Reporting & Insights
Description:
Application Closes: 08 February 2022
Role: Public Health Intelligence Inbox Coordinator, Reporting & Insights (Fixed term - Full time until 30 June 2022)
Number of vacancies available: 1
Office Location(s): 50 Lonsdale Street/Work from home
Position Summary: 
The Public Health Intelligence (PHI) Inbox team operates as the central point of contact for requests relating to COVID-19 data, reports and epidemiological advice.
This role undertakes a customer-focused approach in the coordination of COVID-19 requests including ensuring stakeholder expectations are being both managed and responded to in a timely manner. 
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders to continuously improve service delivery and enhance operational standards.
Responsibilities 

Coordination and distribution of key information and advice to identified stakeholders on a range of COVID-19 public health issues. 
Operate as an effective team member by delivering quality, timely and effective customer service to a range of stakeholders.

Promote and develop relationships and linkages with key areas across the Data, Intelligence, Modelling and Epidemiology branch within the COVID-19 Public Health Division.

Undertake administrative tasks to support the successful operation of the PHI inbox team's objectives including ensuring all enquiries and requests are appropriately prioritised, managed and reported in a timely manner.
Contribute to the full life cycle of projects to meet departmental objectives including:

a)     Assisting in research, analysis and implementation of projects based on defined outcomes and outputs.
b)     Supporting the development and delivery of projects or sub-projects and their successful delivery and completion within resourcing, timeline and budget parameters. 
c)     Contributing to the monitoring and evaluation of projects to ensure departmental objectives are met.

Where responsible for overseeing, monitoring or delivering projects, ensure they are delivered in accordance with relevant legislation and government regulations, guidelines and standard operating procedures. 
Keep accurate and complete records of your work activities in accordance with legislative requirements and the department's records, information security and privacy policies and requirements.
Demonstrate how the actions and outcomes of this role and work unit impact clients and the department's ability to deliver, or facilitate the delivery of, effective support and services.
Other duties as required.

Mandatory Vaccination policy:
The department is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its workers and clients. As it is an essential element of any role within the department that employees be able to attend work onsite and to do so safely, employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of their employment. This requirement applies unless they have a medical condition which means they cannot be vaccinated against COVID -19. Therefore, the department will ask any prospective employee, who has been identified as the preferred candidate for a role within the department, to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status prior to any offer of employment being made.  If a prospective employee has a relevant medical condition which means they cannot be vaccinated against COVID-19, they should contact the department to discuss their individual circumstances.
 
HOW TO APPLY:
Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.
Please note: For this position, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document.
Preferred candidates will be required to complete pre-employment screening, including a national police check and misconduct screening.
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.
For further information please visit the Department of Health <https://www.vic.gov.au/department-health>
Click 'Apply Now' to submit your interest in this position.

The Organisation:Our client is a global leader in sensor, software, and autonomous solutions and has more than 20,000 employees across 50 countries.     One particular division of our client's organization is enabling an autonomous future through the delivery of an autonomous connected ecosystem in mine sites across the globe. They bring survey, geology, mine planning & design, fleet management, production optimization, collision avoidance, and operator safety together in a life-of-mine solution that integrates people and processes. This intern makes sure their customers are safer and more productive through insight-driven decisions that sustainably captures more value from mining operations. One particular Enterprise Software Suite is a data analytics hub that nurtures collaboration. It helps mines access, see downstream effects, and make decisions from operational technology data. It provides data visualisation, accessibility, data analytics and reporting by connecting and structuring data from Planning, Operations, Safety and Drill & Blast systems.    The Role: The Enterprise Software portfolio team is currently seeking an experienced Application Engineer/BI/Data Software Consultant to join their Perth-based team on a permanent full-time basis. This role has been created due to growth, and your direct report is here in Perth to guide you through this new position. Being the only role globally of its kind for our client, there will be a lot of iteration, adjustment, and change to make this role your own. You will be able to put your stamp on this position!    If you answer yes to the following questions, this might be the role for you: > Are passionate about data and unlocking its hidden value? > Are you driven by successful customer adoption of technology to improve processes that generate a tangible return on investment > Have you had experience in creating business intelligence reporting that can be standardised across multiple customers?    Major Areas of responsibility within this role: You would be the global champion for the suite of the Enterprise Software products to drive successful customer adoption and obtain customer return-on-investment. You are the voice of the customer and internal support teams and you will provide clear feedback to the software development team to better the solution for all customers. This position is responsible for driving customer adoption the suite of solutions that deliver on a vision to connect data across the life-of-mine value chain.    Skills and Experience Required: > Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering / Software Engineering, or related fields> Proven experience within a similar position (software solution consulting). Good time management and the ability to work with disparate teams is essential. > Prior experience with technology in the mining industry (planning, operations, drill & blast, safety). Global experience desirable.> Experience with Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and Microsoft SQL Server or Postgres.> Experience in the testing and validation of technology products and development of training courses to assist internal lead experts.     As an individual who can consolidate findings of software usage in the field across different customers it is essential that you have the technical aptitude to interpret and respond to customer requirements, in addition to the soft skills to explain the benefits to management and sales teams. Customer Success: > Provide technical sales assistance to regional teams including trials and demos.> Provide guidance on best practice use of our client's products.> Primarily provide 2nd tier support to escalated requests from the regional service & support teams.> Attend customer sites and regional offices for technical knowledge transfer.> Assist with building key reference sites for our BI system in each region.> Provide global guidance for all major commercial deals including RFI and RFP’s. Having past consulting and training experience will be of value. What’s on Offer:Apart from a salary package that is commensurate with your skills and experience, you will also benefit from the following:> Personalised training and upskilling opportunities for career development for both technical and soft skills.> Work with a diverse, talented, multi-disciplinary team across the globe, gaining valuable skills and knowledge servicing some of the biggest names in the industry.> International and domestic travel to a variety of locations for client services.> Modern, well-appointed office space with a casual and friendly atmosphere.> Work life balance support.> Social events, team building activities, morning teas, quiz nights and more.Travel: This position involves travel intrastate, interstate, and overseas to support and deploy the products in the field. Language:> Fluent English (written and verbal) is a pre-requisite.> Spanish or Portuguese or other second languages would be very favourable.  What's next?...If you feel like the above is a reflection of you, your skills, and where you want to be in 2022, then nows is the time to take the next step! Want to know more?The consulting team at Beacham Group welcome your telephone enquiry. For more detailed information about this specific career opportunity, or if you would like to discuss your future career plans with an experienced industry specialist, please contact Glenn Beauchamp (+61 8 6143 5006 / +61 411 116 966) or Ellen Dorizzi  (+61 488 988 100) in our Perth office for a strictly confidential discussion. We look forward to viewing your application letter, resume, and any other relevant supporting information.

APRA is seeking a Principal Analyst to join our Authorised Deposit-taking Institutions (ADI) Strategic Insights team within the Data Analytics and Insights branch.  ADI Strategic Insights supports APRA's core functions and has responsibility for producing high quality analysis and reports relevant to the prudential supervision of the banking industry. The team utilise a range of data sources to develop insights and identify risks, including financial, economic and loan-level data. The team also contributes to the design of requirements for banks to report data to APRA.  As part of the team you will provide forward-looking analytics and insights, driving risk-based supervisory judgements and strategic decisions. The Principal Analyst plays a key role in shaping the delivery of data-driven insights and advice to APRA's senior executive, banking supervisors, risk specialists and other Government bodies.  You will work closely with senior specialists across APRA to identify emerging risks and formulate and prioritise key initiatives in response. You will also collaborate with a wide range of both APRA and industry stakeholders, and have an opportunity to lead significant projects that will impact the banking industry.  The successful candidate will have significant experience in the financial services industry, combined with a strong background in data analytics. You will have excellent problem-solving ability along with strong written and verbal communication skills. Experience with database queries and business intelligence tools is desirable. The team use SAS EG, R and Power BI, thus experience with these technologies is desirable but not essential.

Here at Linfox we believe together, anything is possible. Use sophisticated technology to deliver everyday essentials and natural resources for Australia’s biggest companies. Work with major customers in retail, healthcare, government and defence. Shape the future of logistics with industry leading innovations in safety, sustainability and efficiency. Create a career to be proud of. Expect all this and more when you join Linfox. 
What does the job look like?
The Resource & Industrial business have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analytics Lead to join their team based at our GHO in Essendon Fields. You will be accountable for managing the delivery of actionable reporting to senior management and external stakeholders with a primary focus on presenting data in an understandable way. This role will leverage data and provide insights on business development and organisational performance, supporting decision making and improving business efficiency. Key areas:

Develop analytical solutions including data extraction, manipulation, analysis and presentation for the purpose of insights and recommendations
Effectively lead & collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders across the business to not only capture but drive business requirements, design, and develop appropriate BI solutions to assist in the most optimal way
Manage the data analysis to evaluate, prepare and present insightful reporting to drive improvements in business performance and customer satisfaction
 

 
Are you the one?
Reporting to the National CI Manager, you will have a passion for creating clean and insightful reports that drive data-led decision making. You will have a strong analytical background and understand how to present complex information simply and directly to relevant stakeholders. You will be a self-motivated individual with the ability to adapt to challenging situations. You can demonstrate:

Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, or related field is desirable
Previous experience working in supply chain roles
Expertise in PowerBI or other reporting/visualisation tools
Advanced Excel skills and demonstrated experience managing large datasets
Strong communicator with solid data analysis and problem-solving skills and comfortable speaking with people across all levels of the business
Demonstrated knowledge of analysis techniques, problem solving, and identification of key metrics that measure and drive the long-term health of a business

How will I help?
The Customer Information Management (CIM) team is responsible for leading the way forward in the development our customer centric capabilities. As CIM’s role within the data management of Westpac’s customer data evolves new capabilities will be implemented.  We are continually looking for new and improved ways of doing things Additionally, you will investigate and analyse business problems or opportunities and design future data management requirements, processes and capabilities.
What you will do
Annual validation and maintenance of operational processes and procedures to meet our compliance obligations.
Liaise with key stakeholders such as business units, financial crime, ISG, assurance and project teams
Review and approve changes to the CIM owned applications.
Ensure adherence to the enterprise data governance framework.
Profiling of data and analysis of data lineage.
Utilise a variety of data sources and associated tools and technical skills, e.g. Oracle OCH, Teradata (xDW), Tableau, etc.
Maintain business procedures and documentation.
Identify and manage project risk and issues affecting the Customer Domain.
Ensure the smooth operations and stability of CIM applications and systems, by running review reports, performing daily checks and setting up new users.
Ensure project implementations go-live without impact to operational processes and customer data.
Define and document what is required for changes to business data processes, policies and systems to achieve business outcomes.
Monitor and triage production issues between business and technology teams.
Adoption of new tools and technologies to better manage customer data. 
Define and document what is required for changes to business data processes, policies and systems to achieve business outcomes. 
What’s in it for me?
Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us. 
What do I need? 
5+ years’ experience in a relevant customer focussed industry (retail or financial services preferred).
Business and data analysis skills.
Proven ability to interact effectively with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Intermediate to advanced skills in Teradata SQL. 
Intermediate to advanced skills in process and control documentation, including flowcharting.
An understanding and experience with regulatory requirements and related controls.
An understanding of audit and assurance concepts and processes.
Experience of business operations within the finance industry.
Experience with SAS, Tableau or Qlikview.
What is it like to work in Westpac?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs. 
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

You love looking at data and have the ability to comprehend complexities that surround financial requests, system connections and data feedsAn inquisitive mind – If something doesn’t look right you will investigate to ensure accuracy with reportingThis is an excellent opportunity for a candidate who genuinely enjoys working with data and systems and helping others do their job by providing support and answer by way of accurate and understandable data.  Our benefits:Meaningful work that allows you to contribute to a mission you believe inA safe and supportive place to continue to grow and hone your craftA diverse and inclusive work environment where you can connect with colleagues from around the worldGenerous flexible work arrangements, and parental leave programsAn opportunity to give back through community volunteer events and corporate partnerships like Code Like a GirlWe value open-minded, open-hearted teams, who reflect a diversity of experience, identity and perspective. BSA|CUI is a national provider of strategic advice, design, implementation, operations and maintenance services, specialising in telecommunications networks and technologies.    We are a people business and an equal opportunity employer - we support and recognise the importance of a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. Proudly, our executive leadership team comprises of almost half female employees.  About the Role Reporting to the Head of Data & Analytics, the Performance Insights Analyst role is the central point for delivering insights company-wide for financial and operational activities through the PowerBI self-service analytics platform. Join our agile Data & Analytics team as part of the corporate Technology function and bring your ideas to life. We support your personal development, value your initiatives and nurture your ability to influence high level decision makers. Work flexibility has taken a new meaning across the economy in the unique environment we are all operating in. At BSA we value the safety and wellbeing of our people and we embedded work flexibility within our culture, with the Executive Leadership Team actively driving it throughout the company. Key responsibilities:   Review and consolidate reporting requirements and automate any repetitive reports. Gather user requirements and document technical specifications. Develop scalable and fit-for-purpose dashboards in PowerBI, as well as produce and deliver user training. Identify patterns and discrepancies in financial and operational activities to lift revenue and profit. Identify leading indicators for financial and operations performance that will support data-driven decision making for key stakeholders. Build advanced analytics dashboards using machine learning and statistical algorithms Stay at the forefront of analytical techniques in the industry and implement innovative solutions Develop trusted relationships with key stakeholders Escalate issues and their impacts to management team and propose solutions. Uphold BSA Values and Behaviours and take reasonable care to prevent injuries to self and others.  Qualities, attributes and skills that will set you apart:   Three or more years’ experience delivering insights driven by an analytical mindset that builds a story from the data for decision makers. Passionate about continuous learning and development Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistics, data science, commerce, finance. SQL data extraction capabilities and data visualization experience (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Qlik or similar). Proven experience with predictive analytics and statistical modelling using Python / R or similar. Proven experience with stakeholder engagement. Advanced SQL knowledge. Advanced Excel knowledge. Relational / Dimensional Modelling experience desired. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Why work with us:   A competitive salary package Flexible work arrangements Reward and Recognition program Health & Wellbeing program Learning and Development opportunities  Join us and be a part of a progressive culture that is enjoyable, flexible and results-driven. Canstar is Australia’s biggest financial comparison website. For over 25 years, Canstar has been researching and rating financial and consumer products. We employ over 150 staff with a diverse range of educational and professional backgrounds. We take pride in the cultural and gender diversity of our staff and our ability to offer our people the opportunity to grow and develop their skills as the company grows too. The Insights team plays a key role in Canstar’s communication strategy by ensuring we are first to market with compelling news stories that are data-driven, topical and well researched. Data Insights Analysts are responsible for creating new and innovative ways to analyse data, and find stories in research. Data Insights Analysts regularly access market and consumer data and surveys, analyse trends, write summaries and assist with media enquiries.  We are looking for a Casual Data Insights Analyst, offering 2 days per week, who will assist the Insights Team with media-related data requests. In this role, you will assist the team in providing topical, timely, data-driven insights that inform our consumers. An exciting new opportunity has become available to join the eCommerce team within the National Buying department of ALDI Stores, based in Minchinbury. This is a permanent full time role.
 
As an eCommerce Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the eCommerce team by conducting performance analysis in order to optimise sell through, determine opportunities to improve efficiency and monitor revenue. In this role you will focus on delivering actionable insights utilising data from various sources resulting in increased profit and improved customer experience.
 
What we are looking for:
The successful candidate will be able to work in a fast paced, highly dynamic environment and possess strong numerical and analytical skills. With a passion for eCommerce, you will be an outcome driven individual with a keen eye for detail and the ability to meet competing deadlines. Candidates with eCommerce and online retail experience will be highly regarded.
 
Selection criteria:

4+ years’ experience within relevant fields
Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining performance, financial and business reports
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collate and convert data into meaningful insights
Advanced proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel
Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to adapt in an evolving environment
Understanding of test and learn methods, highly regarded
Strong communication skills; both verbal and written
Ability to perform consistently under high pressure situations
Able to work autonomously and proactively identify areas of opportunity
High level of professionalism and dedication with a positive can-do approach

 
What's in it for you?

Market leading remuneration - $124,900 - $142,500 (including super)
Flexible work options - work from home up to 10 days per month
Great work life balance with 5 weeks annual leave
Be part of a leading international retailer
Work in a team of collaborative, friendly and supportive colleagues

 
Role responsibilities:

Develop and maintain performance, sales and revenue reporting for the team
Undertake monthly / yearly financial reconciliation in line with ALDI compliance requirements
Develop and implement reporting landscape across the team
Extract and collate data from various data sources to provide insights
Develop and present optimisation proposals based on quantitative and qualitative methods
Analyse and assess the performance of products, categories, warehousing efficiency, site traffic and conversion rates in order to determine strategic recommendations and outcomes
Monitor and report on products and transactions based on purchase activity
Provide a range of reports to the eCommerce team and other key stakeholders
Support the team with numerical / analytical and adhoc administrative project needs

 
These roles report to the Executive Manager - eCommerce.
 
COVID-19 update
At ALDI we believe that our employees should expect to come to work every day with the comfort and confidence that they are in the safest possible environment. You will be required to adhere to all ALDI and State and Federal Government COVID-safe practices and regulations.
From March 1st 2022, a condition of ongoing employment with ALDI will be that employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they have a valid medical exemption. This requirement will apply to all employees across stores, warehouse, transport and offices.

Description: Who are we? Come join our collaborative, flexible and friendly team at Standards Australia and be a part of Australia’s future! We are the peak non-government Standards body in Australia and we facilitate the creation of standards which help govern the specifications that products and services in Australia should live up to. We work closely with government, industry, consumer, and stakeholder groups and are working in exciting areas such as circular economy, artificial intelligence, renewal energy and smart tech.   We are experiencing an exciting period of growth embarking on a number of new projects, which would see our current team of 250+ employees grow substantially throughout 2022, our centenary year. About the role The Advanced Analytical Specialist will be passionate about advanced analytical techniques, data modelling and machine learning and has demonstrated experience in implementing practical solutions to drive business change. As a member of a small but growing team, you will be involved at every stage of our data value chain from identification, collection and cleaning, through to analysis, insight generation and decision making about how we expand and grow our market whilst putting our customers and the Australian community at the heart of what we do.    This role ideally suits a seasoned Advanced Analytical Specialist looking to make a strategic contribution in a dynamic 100-year-old start-up environment.What you'll do  Design and implement advanced analytical models (customer churn, customer lifetime value, consumer behaviour) for use across Customer, Sales and Marketing Drive insight-led analytics relating to the performance of Standards Australia’s products and assist with strategy performance Deepen our modelling capability using tools such as R, SQL and cloud computing platforms (e.g., Azure) Assist in forming business strategy by building analytical models that review and identify performance opportunities, providing insights and implications to relevant stakeholders Interrogate and interpret data to identify meaningful insights, patterns and trends Partner and collaborate with internal stakeholders to deliver value Assist in forming business strategy by building analytical models that review and identify performance opportunities, providing insights and implications to relevant stakeholders  About you  2 – 4 years relevant work experience in statistical modelling, advanced analytics and/or deep learning within a relevant industry. Preferably in an ML Ops settings An advanced degree (MA/MSc or PhD) in a quantitative degree e.g., STEM related A consultative, customer-centric approach to work and demonstrated ability to communicate complex data  Demonstrated success in the efficient cleaning, transformation and analysis of high volumes of structured and unstructured data Strong skills in database design, query (e.g. SQL) and manipulation; data visualisation (e.g. PowerBI); statistical analysis (via R or Python) Technical experience with statistical model tools like Python and/or R Demonstrated experience in investigating, recommending and integrating/deploying third party solutions, including Vendor/Partner collaboration in areas including Data Governance, Reporting Tools, Data Lakes, distributed Compute and Visualisation  Working for usIntegrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect and Excellence form the basis of all we do. Our success is measured not only on the outcomes but on the path we took to get there.  Standards Australia offer a flexible and positive culture where individual and team efforts are recognised and rewarded. We celebrate our success through quarterly events such as EOY party, Family Day, Melbourne Cup, Awards and Picnic day. We also promote training through our internal L&D team and access to services like LinkedIn learning and toastmasters. What's next?If you meet the above criteria, please submit your CV and a covering letter which outlines your experience and suitability to this role. Eligible applicants must be a Permanent Resident or have legal rights to work in Australia. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 15 business days of their application.

About Online Education Services (OES) OES was established in 2011 and is majority owned by SEEK Limited. Online Education Services (OES) is an online education enabler, working with education partners in providing end to end and standalone solutions for online learning. OES designs, promotes and delivers high-quality programs online on behalf of its education provider partners. The programs are delivered to students who are unable or prefer not to study on campus. Partners are provided with fit for purpose unbundled standalone services, or a complete range of services to support the full student life-cycle online from marketing and recruitment through to graduation. This includes student administration and support, course design, learning management system hosting and optimisation, assessment management and market insights. Work with us: As an employer, our values underpin everything we do; Agility and Innovation, Passion and Perseverance, Teamwork and Collaboration, and Integrity. With the changes and challenges Covid-19 has brought about, the OES team remain dedicated to ensuring that our people are feeling connected now more than ever. By joining OES, you’ll not only be joining a booming industry and organisation, but you will be sure to find your place within an organisation who cares about you, your health and well-being, keeping you socially connected whilst investing in your professional development. We have a guaranteed interest in innovation and the preservation of our values-based culture, and our students and our people are at the heart of everything we do. As a workplace, we use regular feedback and insights from our people to help inform and boost engagement, and have a dedicated team who ensure we are focused on employee well-being, corporate sustainability and socially interactive activities across the year. This 12 month contract role:  The Data Analyst role will assist in setting up student facing initiatives for HEPPP (Higher Education Participation and Partnerships Program) students and conduct analysis to determine the impact of the initiatives for students, whilst working with stakeholders to set up and refine initiatives throughout 2022.  Responsibilities:  Access and manipulate student data to evaluate the impact of each initiative against key student retention metrics and other determined success metrics. Conduct detailed analysis on how students access and interact with various aspects of each initiative using complex modelling techniques as appropriate. Present results of analysis in an easy to interpret way using different data visualisation techniques. Provide input into determining how initiatives can be accurately evaluated including identifying valid control groups where possible and establishing success metrics for each initiative – ensuring they are measurable. Establish and maintain regular reporting on initiatives. Provide data on initiatives to our university partners. About you:   Tertiary qualification in business, analytics, computer science or related discipline. Experience in delivery of reporting or analytics with ability to analyse, generate and communicate insights drawn from multiple data sources. Expert in SQL and a sound understanding of R and/or Python. Some exposure to statistical/machine learning modelling would be advantageous. High critical or numerical reasoning. Advanced user of Excel. Very strong writing and presentation skills. Ability to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. Highly self-motivated. Ready to join us? If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you. Apply now!

You will be able to provision appropriate technical deliverables – SSIS packages, entity models, SQL query and update python scripting etc – to facilitate delivery of critical HESTA Investment Management and Investment Execution data needs, aligned with the HESTA IDS “hub and spoke” data model It is desirable for you to have exposure to python, R, Power Query and other data wrangling technologies.  Experience in data migration or data onboarding programs as well as a passion for data quality (evidenced through a professional qualification i.e. DMBOK)   What’s in it for you?   This role represents the chance to join a leading industry fund that offers a welcoming and supportive culture as well as unrivalled training and development opportunities.  Other benefits include: •    a competitive remuneration package•    opportunities to grow your career•    sustainable and collaborative workspaces   HESTA is a great place to work but don’t take our word for it, we were named (again!) Employer of Choice 2021 by the Australian Business Awards and Employer of Choice for Gender Equality five years running!     Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.   It is important to protect the health, safety and wellbeing of all HESTA employees, and those people they come into contact with at work and reduce the risk of COVID spreading in the workplace and the wider community, therefore all HESTA employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. APRA is seeking a Principal Analyst to join our Authorised Deposit-taking Institutions (ADI) Strategic Insights team within the Data Analytics and Insights branch.  ADI Strategic Insights supports APRA's core functions and has responsibility for producing high quality analysis and reports relevant to the prudential supervision of the banking industry. The team utilise a range of data sources to develop insights and identify risks, including financial, economic and loan-level data. The team also contributes to the design of requirements for banks to report data to APRA.  As part of the team you will provide forward-looking analytics and insights, driving risk-based supervisory judgements and strategic decisions. The Principal Analyst plays a key role in shaping the delivery of data-driven insights and advice to APRA's senior executive, banking supervisors, risk specialists and other Government bodies.  You will work closely with senior specialists across APRA to identify emerging risks and formulate and prioritise key initiatives in response. You will also collaborate with a wide range of both APRA and industry stakeholders, and have an opportunity to lead significant projects that will impact the banking industry.  The successful candidate will have significant experience in the financial services industry, combined with a strong background in data analytics. You will have excellent problem-solving ability along with strong written and verbal communication skills. Experience with database queries and business intelligence tools is desirable. The team use SAS EG, R and Power BI, thus experience with these technologies is desirable but not essential.

You must technically astute and understand reporting, and specifically telephony reporting, as well as having the ability to work with scenario modelling. Company: Mercedes-Benz Financial Services Australia Pty Ltd

Working with Marketing to implement customer retention journey/lifecycle strategy Be the key contact within Sales & Marketing as subject matter expert for customer profile, retention and campaigns Preparation of business case proposals in PowerPoint for delivery to Management Who we are looking for:Most importantly, we are seeking a positive and pro-active individual, who will make the most of this opportunity to utilise their curious mindset and is willing to experiment with technologies and systems. As the Senior Resource Planning & Reporting Analyst, you will report to the Workforce Optimisation Manager. You will be responsible for short, medium, and long-term forecasting across any of the Channels within Customer and Business Operations (CBO) team of Bupa Health Insurance. Workload to be forecasted includes inbound and outbound calls, digital chat & messaging, e-mail, back-office transactions, retail demand and social interactions. You will be working very closely with Workforce Scheduling and Real Time Teams to produce short, medium, and long-term Service Level forecast & resource recommendations across assigned channels in CBO.  This is a Permanent Full-Time Opportunity and is based in Brisbane/Melbourne/Sydney when you're not working from home.  How will I help?  Key accountabilities include:  Deliver recommendations around resourcing in line with each team forward recruitment strategies ensuring that staffing requirements are balanced with the operating budget & are completed in conjunction with the appropriate stakeholder.Support stakeholders with the planning, management, and implementation of medium to long-term forecasts.Making recommendations using shrinkage targets to enable effective planning of activities. E.g. training, meetings, annual leave, and including tracking of turn over for recruitment.Provide detailed trend analysis of call volumes, Average Handle Time, shrinkage, Average Speed of Answer performance and other metrics as required, to improve forecasting accuracy and productivity.Identify areas for improvement in forecasting, scheduling, rostering and shift trade processes and make recommendations to take for implementation of these.Design, develop and maintain internal workforce management process and training documentation.Contribute to Continuous Improvement by analysing data and performing root cause analysis, identifying common process and procedure issues.What's in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements, you'll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will collaborate strongly with colleagues who are committed to delivering exceptional experiences. We trust, respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference.  What do I need?  Excellent understanding of Forecasting and Resource Planning processes and methodologyExperience in resource planning both Contact Centres (including Digital) & Back Office operation teamsWorking knowledge of Workforce Management Systems (Aspect eWFM experience desirable)Experience with the Aspect, Live Person and Genesys suite of products desirableAdvanced Excel & SAS skills highly desirableDemonstrated time management skills including the ability to manage competing priorities to achieve deadlines & desired outcomesWell-developed analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to adopt a pro-active stance towards business issuesWhat is it like to work there?  Be at the heart of helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives. At Bupa, we employ more than 80,000 people globally who are making this a reality. One thing stands out about Bupa people -our customers are our passion; they're at the heart of our culture of care. If you've got the belief, the drive and the talent to help us in our ambition then we'd like to hear from you.

Salary: $59.45 per hour (HEW Level 6)Appointment Type: Casual positionLocation: Macquarie University, North RydeThe RoleThe Business Intelligence and Reporting Office is seeking an experienced Data Governance Analyst to support the team in ensuring all reporting data is accurate and meet regulatory requirements. Your responsibilities in this role will include: Crafting grammatically correct business term definitions and/or quality checking proposed business term definitions and assessing compliance with the Macquarie term definition standards. Review and assess information artefacts (documents, web content, etc.) for appropriate use of agreed business terminology. Support the implementation of the Macquarie University business glossary procedure. Conduct root cause analysis to resolve data quality issues. Perform data profiling on designated key data items. Determine metrics and measurements for ensuring data quality. Collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure data quality. Support the development of Data Management practices, process and role guides based on the framework principles to drive the data management within business and technology teams, e.g. Data Stewardship, and Custodianship roles. Provide support to the Manager Data Governance, BI&R in setting up the data governance operational processes, including working with the project team to set up these processes. Escalate data management and security risk, breaches, quality, performance, gaps and delivery issues / risks as required Perform other duties as required and appropriate for this position. About You  You will need to have the following attributes to be successful in this role: Tertiary qualification in a related field and/or equivalent experience in a similar role. Proven capacity to establish and work with information needs for government data requirements, ideally for higher education and university planning. Experience in supporting analytics work within complex multi-stakeholder environments. Knowledge of Australian Information Management and Security and Privacy legislation and industry best practices. Understand data risks and solutions big data, data leakage, cloud computing, systems access, data management. Able to develop effective and trusted relationships with all stakeholders. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to analyse and interpret requirements and information from numerous sources. Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills with the ability to present to a wide range of audiences. Experience in documenting operational support procedures. To Apply  Please apply online by submitting your CV and a separate cover letter (no more than 1 page) outlining how you meet the requirements for this position.  *This position requires a criminal record check  Role-Specific Enquiries: Kwame Wetsi, Manager Data Governance via kwame.wetsi@mq.edu.au  Applications Close: Tuesday, 15 February 2022 at 11:59pm (AEST)Equity & Diversity StatementAt Macquarie University, we are committed to providing a working environment where each individual is valued, respected and supported to progress. Job Title: Technical Business Analyst - MDM, SQL, ETL - 12 months - based in Darwin
Description: Large enterprise organisation based in Darwin and delivering very complex, high value, and / or high-risk ICT programs and multi-year digital transformation initiatives has a requirement for a Technical Business Analyst to elicit, analyse, document and communicate business requirements and business rules to enable system integration between the Tibco EBX enterprise Master Data Management solution and key systems and downstream data warehouses platforms within the organisation.   The role will, over time grow to be an SME for MDM best practices, design patterns and standards to guide future MDM activities and will be responsible for the analysis and system testing of the architecture, data models, integrations and workflows within the MDM solution.   The role will require working closely with:   • Solution Architects, MDM Technical Leads, Data Analysts, Project Managers, Test Team members and other program resources • Business and System stakeholders • Technical Subject Matter Experts • Non-Government Service Providers who provide case management, health and wellbeing services for children • Vendor/s   Key Duties and Responsibilities   Facilitate workshops, interviews and focus groups to elicit requirements from project stakeholders.  Responsible for understanding business needs, collecting data, delivering analysis and identifying, evaluating and recommending solution options and preparation of quality evidence-based written reports and other documents, including future state data and process flow maps.   Provide detailed user and system documentation, end user training and knowledge-transfer services.   Establish information management business and functional requirements.   Conduct walkthroughs to validate and obtain approval of business analysis outputs and work packages.   Take ownership of business and system analysis initiatives and ensure work packages are delivered on time, to expected quality standards and as per scope, as agreed with the Project Manager.   Analyse new source systems and reference data needed for codification and assist with development and configuration activities for the Enterprise MDM Platform.   Assist in the implementation of best practices around MDM Development, Process, and System Integration and Testing.   Work with solution architects, technical leads, developers and vendors to develop customer centric solutions.   Essential Skills and Experience   Minimum 5 years hands-on experience gathering and analysing technical business requirements.   Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information across project teams and stakeholders with attention to detail and accuracy.   Experience in large transformational project/program management within established structures and the ability to work to tight deadlines and competing priorities.   Highly effective client liaison and workshop facilitation skills.   Experience in working collaboratively within a team environment with high priority deliverables, and ability to guide and knowledge transfer to project team members.   BA and system support, relevant to provision of requirements support and clarification to design, build, test, implementation and Business As Usual support activities.   Ability to delivery business analysis regardless of the Program’s delivery model (Waterfall, Agile, Hybrid).   Experience communicating with a wide range of stakeholders including project team members, technical staff, subject matter experts, vendors and executive.   Extensive experience writing documentation to a high standard including process models, business requirements, functional specifications, entity relationship diagrams, test plans, system and user documentation.   Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server development and experience using T-SQL, extract-transform-load (ETL) processes, data quality analysis and associated tools such as SSIS and Microsoft Data Quality Services.   Demonstrated experience in data analysis on multi system data convergence and migration projects including gathering and documenting data requirements, data migration business rules and development of complex data maps.   Desirable Skills and Experience    Knowledge of data architecture / design concepts and techniques.   Understanding of MDM (Master Data Management) principles, systems and capabilities is highly desirable.   Tertiary qualifications in information technology, computer science or software engineering or Business Analysis Certification, or equivalent.   Experience using Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence.    Personal Qualities required of Candidate(s)   High level oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with ability to effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders. Ability to work in a large team environment with members of diverse cultures and backgrounds. Self-starter with high personal drive and a positive attitude. Disciplined and accountable for supporting and maintaining work products. Behaves in a respectful and professional manner, maintaining high integrity and transparency when delivering work. Excellent problem solver and critical thinker. Promotes teamwork and collaboration by engaging stakeholders and team members.   The successful applicant will be required to be based in Darwin for the duration of the contract

Just imagine your future with us…  Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity and flexibility. We are an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We have an Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion.  Inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top at Aurecon and is an expectation of all. We are seeking applications from a diverse group of people, including those who want to work flexibly, have accessibility needs, want to bring their whole selves to work, and can enrich our workforce with cultural diversity. We are curious about your story and how we can support you to be your best.  Our flexible way of working includes our YesFlex flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options. Aurecon offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, two weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.  Our Data & Analytics offering is unique, and we're excited to include new team members as we grow our already diverse capability and industry experience, with the flexibility that comes from a start-up mindset and the scale that comes with being part of a global design and advisory practice.  The Role  As a Data Consultant, you will be joining a rapidly growing team in an emerging unit of the business where your expertise will lend value to our developing client offerings and internal processes. Your data engineering and business intelligence (BI) knowledge will give you the confidence to work closely with clients from an array of public and private sector environments as well as work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment day to day.  Here are the key things we are currently working with to 'bring ideas to life'. Advise clients on assessing data quality and improving their data strategyCreate accessible data pipelines for consumption by data scientistsManage the mechanics of data ingestion, processing (transformation), and storage in common cloud-based platformsAcquire and integrate a variety of data from various sources and formats, including operational and reporting databases, public APIs, non-structured datasetsDesign and develop dashboards and data visuals to assist effective and efficient decision-making and storytellingWhat we are looking for Strong background in a scientific disciplineKnowledge and interest in programming and data manipulation using tools such as Python, SQL, Power BIWillingness to keep learn and growing both digital and consulting skillsComfort with ambiguity and complex open-ended problemsHigh level of energy, curious to ask questions and an enthusiastic "can do" attitudeWe know today's complex challenges can only be solved through bringing together diverse teams of people from across our business, so there will be opportunities for you to apply your skills and creativity to projects in other geographies and markets.  About us  We've re-imagined engineering.  Aurecon is an engineering and infrastructure advisory company, but not as you know it!  For a start, our clients' ideas drive what we do. Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world's most complex challenges. And through a range of unique creative processes and skills, we work to re-imagine, shape, and design a better future.  We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential that others can't.  Think engineering. Think again.  Want to know more?  You can learn more about what it's like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.  If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!
